675395360.name: Magical, Ancient Delight
675395360.author: a TripAdvisor user
675395360.reviewBody: Strolling around this district, is like stepping back in time, while up to date specialties abound!  A combination of old and new, with the amenities of modern times.

670309827.name: World Heritage for Sure
670309827.author: a TripAdvisor user
670309827.reviewBody: The entire downtown is a World Heritage site and no wonder. There are so many amazingly beautiful old buildings.  It\'s lovely just to wander around and enjoy the history.  Lots of nice cafes to stop at when you\'re tired.

669654891.name: Colonial Mexico at its best
669654891.author: a TripAdvisor user
669654891.reviewBody: Well preserved, lovely buildings.  Very large and lively public square.  Easy and safe to walk around and take it all in.

665388731.name: Morelia \u2764\ufe0f
665388731.author: a TripAdvisor user
665388731.reviewBody: I love Morelia, it\u2019s so beautiful place, the food is delicious! \nAnd there are many places to enjoy the ameizing views that this place offers to you.

661161032.name: A very beautiful city
661161032.author: a TripAdvisor user
661161032.reviewBody: We wanted stop in Morelia on our way to Patzcuaro since we have heard so much about this location. From the moment we entered the city limits we were impressed by the magnificent and decorative architecture on the buildings. This location is so scenic and lovely and El Centro always seems to have plenty of interesting activities. I am so glad we decided to come here.

653572769.name: OMGODDESS
653572769.author: a TripAdvisor user
653572769.reviewBody: What a place. We walked over six miles today and never seen so many fabulous churches in my entire life!\nMorelia still sparkles with colonial charm and colors a not to be missed place.

646204829.name: Holidays
646204829.author: a TripAdvisor user
646204829.reviewBody: The center of Morelia is a place with lots of life, restaurants, museums and churches to visit. Lots of bars and places to dance or have a drink and stay awake

646061715.name: Disappointing
646061715.author: a TripAdvisor user
646061715.reviewBody: We are staying in the heart of Morelia, just across the street from the cathedral. This area has some interesting buildings and a pleasant park, Plaza Des Armes but, when we asked at the information centre about a tour they told us that none were available in English. Bummer! \nWe walked to the aqueduct and it\u2019s an aqueduct that ends suddenly in thin air. The park next t it is green and full of trees but we could see nowhere to have lunch or a coffee.\nWe won\u2019t be back here.

641829437.name: Morlia
641829437.author: a TripAdvisor user
641829437.reviewBody: We loved spending Christmas wandering the streets of this historic city. The people were nice and welcoming. The walk to the Guadalupe Church was delightful and the church itself is incredible. The restaurants around the main square were fantastic and the sidewalk tables are a must! We were entertained by an elclectic group of musicians throughout the evening. We heard everything from ballads to opera. \nMorelia is a must if you are in Michoac\u00e1n.

641798084.name: Beautiful City
641798084.author: a TripAdvisor user
641798084.reviewBody: This city is so historic, people are friendly and helpful. It is truly a city to walk and enjoy the buildings, churches and history of its people

636779969.name: Open space and beautiful church
636779969.author: a TripAdvisor user
636779969.reviewBody: This place has good walking space and people like to take pictures with the pigeons. You can literally throw food up in the air and they all rush to the food. Various stands with snacks all over. They also have a trolly that takes you to view scenic areas and history. You can find all kinds of shops with food, fruits, finer restaurants, clothing and shoes. The Catholic Church is beautiful inside and out. We were able to see it from a far in our hotel. Wish we were closer because once they light it up. It looks that much more beautiful. The only thing that the area lacks is hotels with pools. I guess Michoac\u00e1n is not into pools because we had a hard time finding hotels with pools and tv\u2019s in the rooms.

633501404.name: Immaculate
633501404.author: a TripAdvisor user
633501404.reviewBody:
I have traveled to many cities and towns in Mexico. I have never seen one so clean.  Big streets, whole areas just for pedestrians to walk.  Restaurants and shops everywhere. Covered walkways and a fireworks show at the Cathedral on weekends.
   They really want to bring in the tourists.
Will definitely go again.

631448939.name: well preserved old town
631448939.author: a TripAdvisor user
631448939.reviewBody: Around the main square, the building facades and some of the buildings are original.  There are several lovely parks and you can go into the schools and library to view the murals and architectural features.  A nice half day stroll

631417879.name: Stunning architectural centro...
631417879.author: a TripAdvisor user
631417879.reviewBody: This UNESCO city is stunning with all of the buildings made of pink cantera stone. At night it glows a wonderful warm color and there are also lights shown on the Cathedral in the evening.Lots of activity there as well...

630369317.name: Same colonial Spanish style as many other Plaxa des Armas
630369317.author: a TripAdvisor user
630369317.reviewBody: Large chirch, local government building on one side of it, Palace of Justice on opposit side, and hotels on the fourth side to complete the zplaza des Armas. I have seen it in so many Spanish colonial towns that I wonder after time if it was in Mexico or Peru or .....\nAnyway, the square was lively this long weekend. Plenty of colorful decorations, people dancing and strolling by. Kids playing. Maracas bands.\nGood way to stroll, visit the large chirch and spend some time over lunch or drinks watching people go by.

622776271.name: Spanish Colonial Architecture
622776271.author: a TripAdvisor user
622776271.reviewBody: The historic center has a Spanish Colonial Architecture Style .\nWith great iron-works art displayed all-around.

620860024.name: An amazing city
620860024.author: a TripAdvisor user
620860024.reviewBody: So glad we came to Morelia. It\'s a perfect historic centre that you can walk around for hours admiring the stunning colonial architecture. Lots of food, bars, street food. While we were there the area in front of the cathedral was closed to traffic and the most stunning mariachi band played. The city has a happy, relaxed vibe. I loved it and would reccomed. Felt very safe.

618245730.name: Amazing architecture!
618245730.author: a TripAdvisor user
618245730.reviewBody: Safe at night, easy to walk, restaurants, boutiques, bars, safe public transportation, coffee shops, amazing architecture, beautiful views and nice people!

616985331.name: The History of Colonial Achitecture before your eyes
616985331.author: a TripAdvisor user
616985331.reviewBody: The architecture of Morelia is some of the most suburb of all Mexico. It has fabulous examples of every period and style. I particularly liked the SW corner of he Plaza de Armas on Calle Allende. On the three corners you can see magnificent colonial buildings each of a completely different and glorious style. The history of Colonial Architecture before your eyes.

614939730.name: So Interesting!
614939730.author: a TripAdvisor user
614939730.reviewBody: This is the focal point. The giant square in the middle of the area is chock full of people-playing, walking, reading, and relaxing. It\'s not only proximity to the historical sites and sights but the square abuts the central shopping street, and perhaps, the best restaurants in town. There\'s a little street off one end of the plaza that features several interesting eateries: two or three gazpacho places, a Chinese restaurant, and a place dedicated to elite-corn on and off the cob with every known condiment to accompany. This is a great place to people watch.

612732027.name: Beautiful colonial place, great architecture
612732027.author: a TripAdvisor user
612732027.reviewBody: You really have to visit this place the Colonial buildings spread for quite a few blocks and are all very beautiful and worth watching some of them can be visited, you can also by some arts and crafts from local indigenous people

607407491.name: Beautiful
607407491.author: a TripAdvisor user
607407491.reviewBody: This was our 2nd trip to Morelia because enjoyed it so much first time.  Will return again.  So much to see, lots of history, museums, art museums, people watching and just sitting in the park relaxing.

606489789.name: Morelia and surrpounding smaller towns are amazingly artistic and exciting to visit!
606489789.author: a TripAdvisor user
606489789.reviewBody: I flew in to Morelia, drove to Zinzunzan for a two week vacation.  I visited the island of Janitzio, the towns of Pazcuaro, Quiroga and Santa Clara de Cobre (Copper City) .  I was amazed how many Americans lived there and how friendly the towns are.  I had always heard so many stories.  The air and temperature are so inviting.  We were able to go hiking, shopping, and dinners were a delight.  There is so much to see.  It was so relaxing and fun.  It rained almost daily but the weather cleared quickly.  A wind breaker worked well.

602808862.name: Stunning... Day or Night!
602808862.author: a TripAdvisor user
602808862.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to stop, rest and reflect. On the day of our visit, the church was alive with a funeral procession. It was a great reminder that this site is a very real, active part of this community.

594524886.name: A place you cannot miss!
594524886.author: a TripAdvisor user
594524886.reviewBody: Centro Historico de Morelia is full of beautiful buildings made of pink cantera. It is a nice place to take a stroll either at night or during the day. You will find museums, historical buildings, parks and all types of restaurants with local and international cuisine.

587162625.name: A Must See!
587162625.author: a TripAdvisor user
587162625.reviewBody: Morelia\u2019s Centro Hist\u00f3rico is beautiful,  lively, clean and safe. The Catedral, the Plaza de Armas and the Portales are in the city center and within seconds of each other. The Cathedral is beautiful and the plaza and the portales offer opportunities to sit and people-watch. We enjoyed a couple of cocktails outside of the Hotel Virrey de Mendoza. To enjoy the colonial architecture, just walk up and down Madero Street which also offers plenty of shopping and dinning. A great way to see the historic city center is to take a guided tour on a trolly. It starts near the cathedral and the plaza and lasts about one hour. The tours includes the major sites including the impressive aqueduct. The historic city center is very busy so be careful when crossing the streets. Also, be ready to see people asking for money. Fortunately, we never encountered anyone who was aggressive. Overall, Morelia\u2019s historic city center is a great place to visit.

584339114.name: fantastic
584339114.author: a TripAdvisor user
584339114.reviewBody: Historic de Morelia are very nice place to go around,many old house to wiev,and also sorunding area..

576150992.name: Loved walking through history
576150992.author: a TripAdvisor user
576150992.reviewBody: So much history here, beautiful area, safe, intersting.  Spend some time on an Art Tor through Casona Rosa - loved it!

568738832.name: A walk into the past
568738832.author: a TripAdvisor user
568738832.reviewBody: The Spanish presence has left an incredible mark in this beautiful city. If you come to Mexico you really want to visit Morelia. The Historic center is beautiful, clean, organized and very family friendly. Especially worthy noting is the Guadalupe Sanctuary, a building which around which, as it had to be, the city develops around. The historic center also "hosts" several colonial hotels that are just a delight to stay and wake up in the next day to realize you are truly in such a magic place. Oh, and the policemen are ready to help you if you need information.

564951394.name: Best Colonial City
564951394.author: a TripAdvisor user
564951394.reviewBody: The sidewalks are clear and traffic polite, leaving us free to "see" the gorgeous colonial structures constructed with massive stones. Lots of families enjoying the city together is infectious.

558870958.name: One Day Covers It All
558870958.author: a TripAdvisor user
558870958.reviewBody: It is easy to see and experience most of Morelia\'s historical center. Start out on the Plaza de Armas, walk over to the Regional Museum of Michocan, then on to Jose Morelos\' house and birthplace (he was a priest  and leader of the independence movement). Next should be a short stop at the Artesans\' museum and shop where you can see how many of the local crafts are made (pottery, lacquer,  copper goods..). Then it\'s back to the square for a tour of the cathedral and the Palacio Gobierno across the street. Last is a stop at the candy market--Mercado de Dulces-- where you can sample and purchase all kinds of delicious treats.Souvenirs can be had here as well. Enjoy the walk and stop and rest in the Plaza. Some great cafes and restaurants along this route as well.

558680679.name: Gorgeous location, historical and well maintained
558680679.author: a TripAdvisor user
558680679.reviewBody:
I am so amazed at the architectural beauty of the cathedral and surrounding buildings, taking walks and going to gardens at plazas visiting monuments and buying artisan gifts to take home. 
I miss this city and will plan a return trip soon.  It is hard to find parking in the city so plan to walk a lot or go out at night! The city looks amazing at night 😍

I never want to leave when I visit, it's such a stunning place to live...

558666492.name: Walk and enjoy
558666492.author: a TripAdvisor user
558666492.reviewBody: Walking around the centro gives you a good feel about life in Morelia. There are lots of things to visit and many places to eat!

558660519.name: Charming, Safe, Walkable, Morelia
558660519.author: a TripAdvisor user
558660519.reviewBody: We returned to Morelia because we enjoyed the historic centre so much.   There are many museums and parks to visit.   Morelia has many fine restaurants and cafes, and we especially like the fruit gazpacho for lunch.   People are friendly.   The centro is relatively flat so walking is easy.

557927655.name: Elegant !
557927655.author: a TripAdvisor user
557927655.reviewBody:
We were almost scared off from visiting Morelia because of the travel warnings from the US government.  I am so glad we went. It would have been a shame to miss this lovely colonial city.

Clearly there is no danger in the city - it's obvious from the number of people strolling around in the evening that this place is safe.

It's such a pity that their tourism industry is affected so badly by fake news of the dangers.

It's definitely one of the prettiest cities in Mexico and amongst the cheapest.

552797602.name: A beautiful, walkable historic Centro
552797602.author: a TripAdvisor user
552797602.reviewBody:
Morelia has spent a lot of money to make Its Centro Historico a work of art.  We thoroughly enjoyed walking passed the Catedral and businesses.  

The significant spots are mostly marked with signage in English and Spanish, and there are walking tours of 3, 5, and 8 hours suggested.  

We popped into the University offices and the Banamex office to find huge interior plazas with murals and so forth. 

It was Three Kings so the Plaza was decorated with many exquisite Natividads. Very special!

551701161.name: So much to see!
551701161.author: a TripAdvisor user
551701161.reviewBody:
The zocalo is full of life, great place to enjoy a coffee while people watching, the Arquitecture is outstanding, there is so much history in this plaza where you can learn great deal about Mexico.
The plaza is surrounded by portales where you can enjoy delicious food, find beautiful arts and crafts and relax around the gardens in the area.
On Saturday night there is a light show that congregates families at the plaza, really enjoyable for strolling and watching.
Don't forget to buy some products from the artisans that are normally in the surrounding areas, they crafts are handmade and beautiful.   Also visit the Mercado de artesanías for gifts.

550990115.name: Beautiful
550990115.author: a TripAdvisor user
550990115.reviewBody: This historic downtown is beautiful, I wish they would clean it up better its kind of dirty. You can spend a whole day walking around.

543383164.name: Stunning Cathedral and a lovely Plaza with restaurants and shops all around.
543383164.author: a TripAdvisor user
543383164.reviewBody: The Cathedral and the Plaza are the two attractions in this area. The plaza is lovely to relax in with your coffee bought from Oxxo. The Cathedral is really an imposing sight and the absolute best photos that you can take of it and the Plaza are from the top floor restaurant of the Hotel Mission Cathedral, at the side of the Cafe Cathedral. \nAnd here they are.

539543761.name: Lovely Centro Historico
539543761.author: a TripAdvisor user
539543761.reviewBody: The zocalo in the centro historico has restaurants and coffee shops all around it and the central park is great for strolling and looking at whatever art installation is currently on display. Big fireworks display every Saturday night at about 8:30pm in the cathedral courtyard.

539186903.name: A nice place to hang out.
539186903.author: a TripAdvisor user
539186903.reviewBody: The visual display of "Mapping" in Plaza San Francisco on Friday nights, and the fireworks in front of the Cathedral on Saturday nights draw crowds, and the closure of the main avenue on Sunday mornings for walking, skating, jogging, and biking (some are available to rent) all attract families in large numbers -- and some tourists -- which means many street vendors and entertainers.  El Centro de Morelia is a very pleasant city center to spend time, without the heavy touristy emphasis (and prices) of places like Guanajuato or Queretaro.

530911667.name: True colonial beauty
530911667.author: a TripAdvisor user
530911667.reviewBody: To walk around me enjoy the sunset... WOW so lovely. Stayed and had drinks and dinner at the "Portales" great people watching. The church lit up at night is a sight to be seen!

522075372.name: Friendly square
522075372.author: a TripAdvisor user
522075372.reviewBody: Friendly people, not over burdened by people hawking goods while we had dinner. Prices were very good. Buy your Pesos before heading out.

521781190.name: Outstanding colonial architecture in a dynamic neighborhood
521781190.author: a TripAdvisor user
521781190.reviewBody: The architecture is astounding. It\'s a joy to meander in the historic central neighborhood admiring Spanish colonial architecture that hS UNESCO World Heritage protection. The barrio is filled with cafes, restaurants, and bars. It\'s definitely not a museum. It\'s a dynamic and modern place

513708729.name: Amazing!!
513708729.author: a TripAdvisor user
513708729.reviewBody: I was amazed! All the colonial buildings are beautiful and really good preserved. The cathedral is a architectural gem beautiful inside and outside.

506477403.name: Beautiful
506477403.author: a TripAdvisor user
506477403.reviewBody: Is most beautiful, you can walk for all down town, to eat regional food and candies and visit a lot museums!

500743035.name: Beautiful!
500743035.author: a TripAdvisor user
500743035.reviewBody: Amazing to walk all over it and to do some shopping WHY NOT! I recommend doing this from Monday to Thursday because there are no (what I call) people traffic and you can actually enjoy the Historical Center. It has a few hidden little parks where you can go and sit there to read. One thing bad about the place is that sometimes smells like

500471186.name: Amazing
500471186.author: a TripAdvisor user
500471186.reviewBody: The historic center is downtown Morelia.  It\'s amazing beautiful park, museums, cultural spaces, and restaurants,  one of the most beautiful town in Mexico.

493988641.name: Amazing old city
493988641.author: a TripAdvisor user
493988641.reviewBody: Morelia is definitely must visit city in Mexico!It is sooooo authentic and ful of amazing Mexican and colonial spirit all in one!

492031200.name: Stunning Downtown - Very Beautiful
492031200.author: a TripAdvisor user
492031200.reviewBody: This colonial city is extremely beautiful and absolutely worth visiting.  The entire downtown has charm and character.

487128313.name: Must see the show at the cathedral on Saturdays
487128313.author: a TripAdvisor user
487128313.reviewBody: Moreli ais easy to walk by, very traditional. The arts and crafts and the candy museum are fantastic. the best thing happening is trhe show at the cathedral every saturday around 8 pm....

485093005.name: Take time to stroll through this beautiful historic town center
485093005.author: a TripAdvisor user
485093005.reviewBody: Take time to stroll, stop for coffee, beer or ice cream, peek into the many cathedrals (we saw 6 weddings on Saturday alone!), the shops, the outdoor cafes.

484519869.name: Colonial
484519869.author: a TripAdvisor user
484519869.reviewBody: It\'s the heart of the city, unique architecture. You can witness sound and light show every night 845 pm. It\'s beautiful.\n

484405063.name: Lovely, church filled town
484405063.author: a TripAdvisor user
484405063.reviewBody: Centro is loaded with action. All the colleges in this city keep the pace moving. Loved sitting and relaxing in the park!

482091860.name: Sunday Morning Bike Ride
482091860.author: a TripAdvisor user
482091860.reviewBody:
Morelia, the capital of the state of Michoacán is often considered the most Spanish of Mexican cities. Its historical center, full of Spanish style buildings constructed of pink cantera stone, remains mostly intact from colonial times.

Every Sunday between 8:00 am and 1:00 pm, Morelia’s historical center closes to automobile traffic and opens to skaters, joggers, dog walkers, and especially cyclists. The nearly 5 km (3 mile) out-and-back route runs down the city’s main thoroughfare of Avenida Francisco I. Madero, and then continues alongside the Morelia Aqueduct to Plaza Morelos.

Tents along the route rent bikes for M$15 (US$0.80) for 30 minutes and M$20 (US$1.10) for one hour. After handing over 20 pesos and my Nevada Driver’s License as collateral, I got my bike and was off to explore Morelia’s historical center.

Starting from Plaza de Armas, I pedaled east past the Morelia Cathedral, one of the most magnificent churches in Mexico. Continuing east, I coasted past the elegant Jardín de Villalogín and the iconic statue fountain of three topless Tarascan women. Veering to the right, I cycled alongside the arched stone aqueduct to Plaza Morelos with its majestic equestrian statue of local revolutionary rebel leader José María Morelos, for whom this handsome city is named.

With thousands of historical monuments, Morelia is a worthy UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of Mexico’s most captivating and beautiful capitals. For a fast and fun way to explore this most Spanish of Mexican cities, hit the open road on a Sunday morning bike ride.

480665568.name: A Mexican jewel...
480665568.author: a TripAdvisor user
480665568.reviewBody: This has got to be one of Mexico\'s most beautiful cities. Morelia is an old and very historical town. The architecture of this place is simply astonishing. It is also in my opinion one of the most Spaniard looking cities in all of Mexico. But don\'t let that fool you as you will quickly be immersed in the lively and unique culture of the state of Michoac\u00e1n. As we walked around the streets we had the pleasure of seeing various street performers  including a group of local artists performing "la Danza de los Viejitos" or "The Old Mens Dance"; an beautiful traditional pur\u00e9pecha dance. While having lunch in a restaurant across the plaza we were accompanied by small local bands who delighted us with music while we enjoyed our meals. \n\nMorelia is a "must do" if you are touring historic Mexico.

476467010.name: Amazing historical downtown
476467010.author: a TripAdvisor user
476467010.reviewBody: My first visit to this city, my friends and me, we were amazed for the beautiful buildings and places with a lot of history.

475284110.name: Excellent place to walk around
475284110.author: a TripAdvisor user
475284110.reviewBody: Downtown Morelia is a nice place to walk around.\nGreat architecture, very nice churches and restaurantes.\nIf you visit on a Saturday night, check for the fireworks at the Cathedral.

473390861.name: Charming Central Morelia
473390861.author: a TripAdvisor user
473390861.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral and don\'t forget to visit the candy market! the restaurants in the area provide great service and delicious food, try walking and don\'t drive.

468527075.name: Centro Hist\u00f3rico
468527075.author: a TripAdvisor user
468527075.reviewBody: One of the best places I\'ve ever visit the main town is beautiful full of old churches and variety of restaurants definitely a must in your visit to Morelia

468074720.name: Life in the Center of Town
468074720.author: a TripAdvisor user
468074720.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyed four days in Centro Historico.  The old architecture, cleanliness and liveliness made the stay very worthwhile.  Particularly Saturday and Sunday there were numerous festive activities and events.   Notably the firewoirks display at the Cathedreal Saturday evening was particularly fun.

467880128.name: Clean and Beautiful
467880128.author: a TripAdvisor user
467880128.reviewBody: Everywhere you look it\'s beautiful, very colonial and a lot of history.  It\'s better if you walk.  Lots of places to eat, shop and if you need an extra bag or sandals because your feet are tired, you\'ll also find it there without having to look for a walmart.  it\'s perfect if you like photography.  they also have museums that you can visit for a very affordable fee You can easily spend the whole day in El Centro and not get bored.

467385089.name: A fine example of colonial architecture!
467385089.author: a TripAdvisor user
467385089.reviewBody: I have visited many colonial cities in Mexico and always enjoy them.  There is a lot of activity here, including indigenous dancers in the plaza.

465607548.name: lovely city to explore
465607548.author: a TripAdvisor user
465607548.reviewBody: Downtown Morelia is a lovely place to explore. My favorite part of the visit were the events in front of the Cathedral. Saturday night fireworks, sunday morning Zumba and bike riding. A fun place for couples and families.

464639390.name: Many of Morelias historical buildings located here
464639390.author: a TripAdvisor user
464639390.reviewBody: Nice space with lots of historic buildings to visit as well as numerous shops and restaurants and lots of attractive plantings in the square which is popular by locals and tourists.

463915374.name: Beautiful and well preserved historic center.
463915374.author: a TripAdvisor user
463915374.reviewBody: Beautiful and well preserved historic center either. Very lively on weekends. Breathtaking at night.

461004983.name: Wonderful Archatecture
461004983.author: a TripAdvisor user
461004983.reviewBody: The Centro h\nHistorico district in Morelia is the place to stay when visiting the area. There are many hotels and restaurants around. You can hop on a guided tour ( a cable car type bus) that meets in the central park area that goes around the entire area and gives a brief history of the buildings and cathedrals. Beware however that the tour bus driver will answer your questions and give information in English  and the ticket salesperson and tour director will also speak to you in English. BUT when the tour begins it is only Spanish throughout. There was NO answers to questions by our English fluent guide and not even a sentence about the buildings in English, I thought that was misleading as they gave the impression it was a bilingual tour. But the buildings and Cathedrals were beautiful to see. Lots to do in the Historic Center. Its easy to walk too.

460256795.name: Awesome downtown
460256795.author: a TripAdvisor user
460256795.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautifuls downtowns in Mexico, the pink cantera the colonial buildings the atmosphere everything combined to make you feel full of joy and peace.

460032346.name: Beautiful City
460032346.author: a TripAdvisor user
460032346.reviewBody: Morelia is a lovely Ciry, with a wonderful weather, clean a blue sky, very relaxing the Morelia\'people are so kind I love Morelia

459811414.name: Feels like Europe
459811414.author: a TripAdvisor user
459811414.reviewBody: If you love old architecture and sipping coffee at a cafe this is your place. I recommended the trolley tour which only takes about 1 hour. During the holidays the decorations are beautiful.

457248715.name: Colonial style excellence
457248715.author: a TripAdvisor user
457248715.reviewBody: We visited with our Mexican friends being guided over the main Square right Has of the Cathedral. Justicia Palace is a Good example of a colonial Spanish architecture. \nStone made. Fantastic. Gry enter to the Cathedral!  THE opposite also Governors Palace with a large patio inside. Painting of La Revolution inside. Entry for Free  . \nPlanty of restaurant and caffeterias around. Do not miss a Chance to hehe a breakfast There.

449640009.name: Have to visit
449640009.author: a TripAdvisor user
449640009.reviewBody: This area of the city is a magnificent place to visit. The art, architecture, and style are are just a few things i xan mention about it, but is so much more than that, customer service, good food and unique suvenirs are easy to find and very affordable.  At night time they have fireworks and performance on the streets.  Is just a place that you have to experience because words can\'t describe the magnificence of the area. This is anplace you can get lost in time, due to well preserved buildings, one man feeling  time stop in the classic baroque style.

445693364.name: a true Mexican place
445693364.author: a TripAdvisor user
445693364.reviewBody: with decent climate and beautiful architecture, this colonial city is a great example of Mexico\'s beauty. The Cathedral and museums are nearby so you can walk around.

442000411.name: Beautiful and cultural.
442000411.author: a TripAdvisor user
442000411.reviewBody: Stroll around and listen to musicians, dances by the Tarrascan Indians, vendors with balloons and sweets.  Get a 20 minute shoeshine for one dollar.

438806432.name: A World Heritage Site
438806432.author: a TripAdvisor user
438806432.reviewBody: The city of Morelia is a treasure trove of well-preserved 16th, 17th, and 18th century buildings. The historic center is a great location to explore museums, cultural spaces, exhibition centers, restaurants, and nightlife. There is something of interest in every corner, within walking distance. From UNESCO: "Built in the 16th century, Morelia is an outstanding example of urban planning which combines the ideas of the Spanish Renaissance with the Mesoamerican experience. Well-adapted to the slopes of the hill site, its streets still follow the original layout. More than 200 historic buildings, all in the region\'s characteristic pink stone, reflect the town\'s architectural history, revealing a masterly and eclectic blend of the medieval spirit with Renaissance, Baroque and neoclassical elements. Morelia was the birthplace of several important personalities of independent Mexico and has played a major role in the country\'s history."

435079282.name: Gorgeous
435079282.author: a TripAdvisor user
435079282.reviewBody: Wonderful city, friendly people, easy to walk around.  Vibrant young people because of the University.

421566543.name: Large historical area with beautiful and well maintained building
421566543.author: a TripAdvisor user
421566543.reviewBody: Morelia historic center is among the best in Mexico. It is very large and all, or most of the buildings are of the same colonial area. There are dozen beautiful churches, palaces and lovely squares. Surprisingly, this is not a touristic area and essentially is built for residents and locals and it is one of my favored place in Mexico.

420976026.name: Beautifully Maintained, full of History
420976026.author: a TripAdvisor user
420976026.reviewBody: This colonial city is so enormous and has a lot of history to offer. It\'s colonial structures are well maintained and has a lot to offer people that are in the colonial and shopping district. The shops and street vendors offer so much to the local culture and ambiance within the city. Sightseeing in the city is really pretty with great sunsets, and a lot of nightlife. The best part of this city is the tacos. This is a staple in the food industry. Oh it\'s so good:)

417726828.name: Definitely worth visiting for City and Butterflies
417726828.author: a TripAdvisor user
417726828.reviewBody: Morelia is surprisingly beautiful.  The old historia buildings have been lovingly taken care of and easy to walk.  On weekends the cathedral has a wonderful sound and light show.  The covered arched walkways are home to many good restaurants, and really come alive art night with music and vendors.  The famous butterflies of Michoacan are not far away and a sight not to miss on a sunny day.  The old historic center of Morelia is safe, friendly, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  It is the largest city in the State of Michoacan.

417165518.name: Loved it
417165518.author: a TripAdvisor user
417165518.reviewBody: it\'s an amazing city and if you like architecture this is the place for you and I know you will love it

413134847.name: Lots to see and do
413134847.author: a TripAdvisor user
413134847.reviewBody: The historic center of Morelia has a wealth of sights and sounds and tastes.  Churches and eateries and parks and shops.  A great fireworks display is held in front of the cathedral on Saturday evenings.

409720284.name: One of the best preserved colonial city centers in Mexico
409720284.author: a TripAdvisor user
409720284.reviewBody: Morelia has been carefullu restored and preserved since many years ago, and moder architecture is rather rare in its historical center. Its palaces, churches and plazas, from the XVI to the XIX century blend harmoniously, even though it is the center of a big city, capital of the state of Michoac\u00e1n.

408036358.name: Heaven for those who love architecture
408036358.author: a TripAdvisor user
408036358.reviewBody: Block after block af historical and ornate buildings.  The Basilica is worth a visit as are many of the closeby churches.  A very busy and bustling area with lots of restaurants, shopping, banks and nice views.

402635163.name: Architecture from the 18th century and earlier.
402635163.author: a TripAdvisor user
402635163.reviewBody: Even the most commercial areas are interesting because the buildings that house the businesses are ancient.

400585676.name: Historical
400585676.author: a TripAdvisor user
400585676.reviewBody: A great place to walk around enjoy the weather and learn more history. If you are visiting and it starts to RAIN! your day is NOT OVER. Go in a restaurant or bar hang out and wait for the water to calm down, everyone does the same thing. Beautiful architectural buildings

397114088.name: Beautigul
397114088.author: a TripAdvisor user
397114088.reviewBody:
Morelia is an amazing city. Full of history. Full of beautiful places to discover. The cathedral has fireworks every Saturday night at 20:45 when the light are putting on it. It's completely beautiful. Also the Sunday morning you can rent a bike amor walk to discover all the historical center. 
It's a beautiful, safe and unique place. 

You will never regret to come to Morelia.

396723041.name: Pehaps this is the most beautiful colonial city in M\u00e9xico!!!
396723041.author: a TripAdvisor user
396723041.reviewBody: Morelia is one of the most beautiful colonial cities in M\u00e9xico, with a wonderful scenery and a great weather most time of the year. \nThere are good restaurants and coffee shops so if you feel a little tired of walking, you can always take the time to rest while eating or having a good cup of coffee.

396235320.name: loved the scenery
396235320.author: a TripAdvisor user
396235320.reviewBody: my wife and I were staying at a hotel just in front of this wonderfully beautiful catedral, centro hist\u00f3rico a place u got to visit also get the time to wander around.

392165559.name: Excellent stroll
392165559.author: a TripAdvisor user
392165559.reviewBody: Many options for having food or coffee. The place is full of people. It is really nice on sunset becasue the sun brights on the cathedral.\nTake your time for a walk. Try helados, elotes, fruta

386223091.name: Morelia\'s Centro Historico is clean and beautiful
386223091.author: a TripAdvisor user
386223091.reviewBody: Loved Morelia, a clean city with infrastructure that seems to work. Its founders, from Valladoid, Spain, reproduced Valladoid in Mexico. Beautiful architecture, avenues, gardens, fountains, parks, trees. See of much of it as you can. It is easy to navigate.

385328947.name: Wonderful
385328947.author: a TripAdvisor user
385328947.reviewBody: Morelia is a very special city. Its centro historico or downtown is one of the most beautiful in Mexico. There are small cozy streets, pretty hidden plazas and grand buildings around the cathedral. It is a must to go.

381422190.name: One of my favourite spots in Mexico
381422190.author: a TripAdvisor user
381422190.reviewBody: Morelia without doubt is one of the most romantic places I have been in Mexico. Lots of historic building and nicely distributed, best to explore by bike.

373763001.name: Nice place, very crowded
373763001.author: a TripAdvisor user
373763001.reviewBody:
Is the center of Morelia. Where everything is and one of the safest places around morelia, as there is a lot of police, tourists, bars, restaurants and museums.
This is where almost every local has gone to meet some friends or to see its partner and have a nice walk
If you are looking to buy something, you can find the most variety and almost the lowest prices around here.
Every Saturday in the afternoon 7:00 PM to 9:00 the guvernment holds a fireworks spectacle where the chatedral starts to light from none to all lighted.
The local speciality is called Gaspacho (its not the cold Spanish soup), but i would recommend you that you see if the place is clean before you consume it. There is a local major brand which makes this dish and its the cleanest.
Also go to the candy - market, in which you will find a lot of mexican and michoacan traditional candies and souvenirs at a nice price.
Every sunday through the main avenue -Madero Avenue- there is a cycling program which lends you a bicycle so you can see all the avenue and if you rent a bicycle somewhere else, you can go to lots of other cycling courses from here to the rest of the city.

364984842.name: There\'s SO much to see!
364984842.author: a TripAdvisor user
364984842.reviewBody:
We spent a week in the Centro Historico, so we saw it at various times of day, weekday and weekend.  It was enjoyable at all those times.
By all means, if you're able to rake in the fireworks over the Cathedral on a Saturday night, do not miss it!  Have coffee at the Virrey de Mendoza, or a meal if you have time.
We saw some dancers in Perebecha dress.  The dances were fascinating.  We saw reenactors in colonial costumes, who were happy to take time to explain who they were representing, and details about the historic time period.  We saw members of a "tuna" who also spent a lot of time with us, explaining their historical roots, and the kind of music they sing.  They were gracious about posing for pictures.
We spent lots of time around the acquaduct, at various times of day, as well as the Tarascas statue.  The Villa Longin is a pleasant, relaxing plaza for people-watching, and there are several little cafes in the area.
If you have time, visit as many churches as you can:  Nuestra Senora de Carmen, San Jose, the Cathedral, Guadalupe, Santa Rosa de Lima.  The colonial architecture is magnificent.  
Do not leave the Centro Historico without having at least one gazpacho!
Spend a few minutes near the statue of Morelos, and stroll through the Bosque de Cuahtemoc.
On this visit, I didn't get to the Museum of Modern Art, nor to the Palavio de Justicia.  You always need to save something for next time!

670309696.name: Gold, gold and more gold
670309696.author: a TripAdvisor user
670309696.reviewBody: Beautiful interior that is more gold than you would believe  One of the nicest churches in this city of many churches.

656992726.name: Fascinating experience
656992726.author: a TripAdvisor user
656992726.reviewBody: This the site of the shrine of the Virgin of Guadalupe. Our visit coincided with Candlemas Sunday was extremely emotional!

646458874.name: Sanctuary of Our Lady of Guadalupe
646458874.author: a TripAdvisor user
646458874.reviewBody: The Sanctuary of Our Lady of Guadalupe is a stunning blend European and Meso-American architectural sensibilities. Prepare to have your senses dazzled with color, design, and texture. The plasterwork is like nothing I\'ve seen anywhere. This is one of 249 Unesco status buildings in Morelia that must be seen in person to be truly appreciated.

646167223.name: Humble Exterior, AMAZING Interior!!!
646167223.author: a TripAdvisor user
646167223.reviewBody: This is an amazing church!  My wife and I visited Morelia while on vacation, and this was one of the places we absolutely had to visit.  The exterior is nice, but not flashy at all.  Prepare to be awestruck once you step inside.  It might be the most impressive church we have ever visited in all of our travels through Mexico.

645843764.name: An overdose of baroque
645843764.author: a TripAdvisor user
645843764.reviewBody: This early 18th century church is baroque at its finest. It\'s definitely must-see when you\'re in Morelia. Walk there via the beautiful Ctz. Fray Antonio de San Miguel, which is a pedestrian walkway paved in stone and lined with trees. For excellent coffee, pastry, or a meal, stop at Origo, which is across the street from the Sanctuary

639548670.name: Very nice church with a very surprising interiroir
639548670.author: a TripAdvisor user
639548670.reviewBody: form the outside it looks like any other church actually kind of small but the moment you walked through the doors you will be surprised all the interior is covered with gold leaf, so its shinny and beautiful, lots of work and it has a nice dome that gets the light in, very nice visit and just across the caballito square

636180178.name: I started to tear up
636180178.author: a TripAdvisor user
636180178.reviewBody: I kid you not. I actually started to cry.  It was/is the most beautiful church I have been in many churches throughout\nMexico. Ive been to Santa Prisca in Taxco Gurerro, the Cathedral in Merida Yucatan, Ive been around Mexico.  I don\'t know what it is.  Maybe because it looks so unassuming from the outside, but on the inside.......shockingly gorgeous.  Words can not do it justice. Our bus tour only gave us 10 minutes.  I could have stayed much longer, and when I go back next time, the Guadalupe Sanctuary is the first stop on my list of places to go in Morelia.\nJust Go!

634222773.name: You have to see this church in person to believe it
634222773.author: a TripAdvisor user
634222773.reviewBody: Simply stunning interior, very moving painting/hige, almost murals on the wall.  Started in 1706 I believe - there is a sign in the west courtyard in spanish and English with a brief history of the church.

633421612.name: A must see in Morelia!
633421612.author: a TripAdvisor user
633421612.reviewBody: This is an extremely ornate baroque church that overflows with gold and golden leaf ornaments. Is worth the trip a bit out of downtown when visiting Morelia. Try to go during a service, so you can appreciate the intricate ornaments while they are lit.

631944777.name: WOW
631944777.author: a TripAdvisor user
631944777.reviewBody: This is a must see in Morelia in the city center and full of history.  I wish I could have stayed there longer.

627066437.name: A must for all visitors
627066437.author: a TripAdvisor user
627066437.reviewBody: Second visit to Morelia and it would not have been complete without visiting Guadalupe once again. I like sitting inside.

620859161.name: Stunning
620859161.author: a TripAdvisor user
620859161.reviewBody: A perfect walk down an avenue to what looks like a plain church from the outside. Inside is jaw dropping. Worth a visit. Just another amazing building in Morelia which is a fantastic city to spend time in.

577389901.name: Amazing inside decoration!
577389901.author: a TripAdvisor user
577389901.reviewBody: This is definitely a must see if you are visiting downtown Morelia. This temple is the perfect example of the Spanish baroque style decoration inside churches. As soon as you get in you are impressed with all the details in gold and different colors. The art pieces are also interesting to see. Definitely recommend it!

572967622.name: A must see
572967622.author: a TripAdvisor user
572967622.reviewBody: Unbelievably beautiful. I took photos but discretely as this is a church with people trying to pray.

568969534.name: Mesmerizing. Enchanting. Historical.
568969534.author: a TripAdvisor user
568969534.reviewBody:
Traveled to Morelia for business.
As a gourmet vegan health advisor & chef I travel to some of the most remote & Beautiful places on earth.
This Historical piece of Art is like something out of a story book. 
A must see.

565945571.name: Most Beautiful Church in Mexico
565945571.author: a TripAdvisor user
565945571.reviewBody: My wife is from Morelia and one of the 1st places I visisted was the Cathedral in Centro. Walking inside is an experience I will never get tired of and is truley breathtaking. This is truely the most beatiful church in all of Mexico! Then experiencing Mass is something my spirit will never forget. Words cannot explain the detail or beauty of this landmark. Then every Saturday Night there is a show and fireworks in front! This is a must see and then you can relax in the main square. It is the central point in Morelia. So everything you need or want is in walking distance.

561983446.name: A thoroughly Mexican knockout!
561983446.author: a TripAdvisor user
561983446.reviewBody: We strolled along a side street and through the arches to the tree-shaded but irregularly cobbled pedestrianized lane to the Sanctuario de Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de Guadalupe. My husband commented that it would have been bested by most village churches in Italy, but I was charmed. Adorning the rose and blue walls were rows of ceramic passion flower blossoms, creating a distinctively Mexican style of Baroque. The altar, of course, was grandly gilded and curlicued.

560509659.name: Hate to be the one who has to polish all that brass.
560509659.author: a TripAdvisor user
560509659.reviewBody: A unique church where no expense was spared in decorating. I\'ve never seen a church like this and I\'ve visited hundreds of churches in Mexico. A beautiful walk from the centro too. It\'s a must see.

559850699.name: This place is amazing.
559850699.author: a TripAdvisor user
559850699.reviewBody: It\'s like some sort of Baroque explosion happened here. Honestly, I\'ve never seen a church quite like it. Really striking. And totally empty when I visited. The giant paintings of the conversion of the natives are a little cringe-worthy. A bit of a walk from the bulk of the other tourist sites, but worth it.

559211167.name: Amazing!
559211167.author: a TripAdvisor user
559211167.reviewBody: I can\'t put into the words the beauty of this sanctuary. Simply Amazing.  I did feel awkward "being a tourist" while others were there for a church service.

558665985.name: Go inside!
558665985.author: a TripAdvisor user
558665985.reviewBody: The door was a little tricky to find but once you\u2019re inside your eyes will be amazed. There was so much to look at and admire!

557926884.name: Gorgeous interior
557926884.author: a TripAdvisor user
557926884.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful church inside and you really should take a stroll through the beautiful streets of Morelia to see it.  It\'s also I a really nice part of town with lovely buildings and of course the viaduct to see while you are there\n

551627794.name: Gorgeous gilded floral interior!
551627794.author: a TripAdvisor user
551627794.reviewBody: This chapel has a fantastic interior full of gilding and flowers.  It is very much worth the walk from centro historico.  In fact, if you walk from the cathedral area, you can see / shop at Museo Del Dulces, see the Fuente de Las Tarascas, the Aqueduct, and stroll the beautifully decorated street that ends at Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe.  (All those sites are worth maybe ten minutes a piece).  Please be sensitive to the parishioners as this is an active Catholic Church.  While the people were welcoming, they show up early for mass, so be sensitive about what day / time you go, especially if you want to take photos.

506476943.name: The most beautiful church
506476943.author: a TripAdvisor user
506476943.reviewBody: The most beautiful church. I have not word to describe this church! Guadalupe Sanctuary is not over the downtown.

505588505.name: A real example of craftsmanship...
505588505.author: a TripAdvisor user
505588505.reviewBody: A beautiful and very ornate church. Take the city tour that leaves from near the Cathedral and this is one of the stops.\n\nI think that it is a must see when you visit Morelia. The workmanship is truly amazing. Make sure that you take lots of pictures (without your flash).

500473363.name: Beautiful church
500473363.author: a TripAdvisor user
500473363.reviewBody: Located central Morelia mast see inside !  Beautiful details architecture. Really recommend to visit this see yourself.

485961425.name: Stunning architecture and details
485961425.author: a TripAdvisor user
485961425.reviewBody: We visited while on the city tour that leaves from in front of the cathedral, well worth a visit, you can take photos without a flash.

485142062.name: The Ornate Details Left Me Speechless!
485142062.author: a TripAdvisor user
485142062.reviewBody: I got teary eyed looking at the images on one wall. I\'m not catholic so I don\'t know the proper wording. Maybe it\'s called "stations of the cross"? The one showing Jesus being lowered from the cross after his crucifixion, caused me to choke up a bit. On the picture I took, it is "Bajado De La Cruz" XIII.

484799881.name: Small church worth the walk and visiting
484799881.author: a TripAdvisor user
484799881.reviewBody: Doesnt say anything on the outside but just step in and youll be awed. You can\'t take enough pictures of all the details. Don\'t forget to check out the paintings along the sides. They show how catholicism was introduced to the Aztecs. Interesting. Realistic.

484642693.name: Great experience
484642693.author: a TripAdvisor user
484642693.reviewBody: This is classic church with beautiful architecture and colors. Y really recommend to visit this sanctuary.

484519733.name: ASTONISHING
484519733.author: a TripAdvisor user
484519733.reviewBody: Simply beautiful, it\'s and architectural jewel. A must visit place in Morelia. Near Villalongin park and font "las Tarascas"

480737644.name: Mesmerizing!
480737644.author: a TripAdvisor user
480737644.reviewBody: I am not a religious person and could care less about any type of sanctuaries, but this Cathedral was truly stunning!

480011902.name: Stunningly Beautiful
480011902.author: a TripAdvisor user
480011902.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful churches on the planet. The craftsmanship of the ceramic + plasterwork was awe-inspiring. Often it seems that if you\'ve seen one church, you\'ve seen them all; however, this is one that looks nothing like any you\'ve ever seen. Filled with color and amazing skill, this sanctuary is AMAZING!

475688930.name: A must see!
475688930.author: a TripAdvisor user
475688930.reviewBody: Beautiful! This is a beautiful church that anyone visiting Morelia must visit. It is a lovely street. We took the Tranvia and it has a short stop at this place.

474215146.name: Colorful!
474215146.author: a TripAdvisor user
474215146.reviewBody: Of course when traveling to colonial or European jewels, you have to go to the churches. No matter your feelings about Catholicism, the churches are key to understanding the area. What\'s different about this one is the colorful design. Usually I would use the word "ornate" - and yes, this one is ornate - but it\'s almost seems moorish with its vibrant colors. I loved it.

467775556.name: impressive old church
467775556.author: a TripAdvisor user
467775556.reviewBody: The amount of gold leaf was surprising given the rather non-descript exterior of the building.  The amoumnt of detail and art within was truly amazing. We enjoyed the beaurtiful walk from our hotel to the Sanctuary.  There are a number of public parks along the way and in the vicinity.  Definately a high light of our vist to Morelia.t

464529967.name: Soaring twin towers
464529967.author: a TripAdvisor user
464529967.reviewBody: Located in the center of Morelia the cathedral dates from the 1500\'s. It is a quiet place to rest and reflect but also a place of celebration.  We saw two weddings which were a charming insight into Mexican culture. The church bells pealed out the joy!

460938243.name: Beautiful Sanctuary
460938243.author: a TripAdvisor user
460938243.reviewBody: We stopped here on a tour of the historic district. It was beautiful with many murals and glitz .Unfortunately I don\'t speak Spanish so the information about the sanctuary was lost to me but it didn\'t detour from the enjoyment. Peaceful.

460628732.name: I was not expecting the Awesomeness inside!
460628732.author: a TripAdvisor user
460628732.reviewBody: Truly I was expecting an old church like any other but once I entered I almost lost my breath with the colourful and over-saturated interior. I think this architectural style is called "churrigueresco" por something like that.\nIt is a "do not miss spot" while in Morelia.

459810630.name: Breathtaking
459810630.author: a TripAdvisor user
459810630.reviewBody: When in Mexico I love to enter as many churches as I can. This was definitely one of the most breathtaking I have ever seen. Make sure to check out all of the side rooms and corridors. I highly recommend for anyone visiting Morelia.

457451287.name: It is pink just like the city :-)
457451287.author: a TripAdvisor user
457451287.reviewBody: If you are in Morelia you might want to visit the Guadalupe Sanctuary. \nYou can take a little city tour with a small bus and they would take you here as well. The bus collects the tourists in front of the big cathedral. But it is only for Spanish speakers!!!

452146141.name: Wow!
452146141.author: a TripAdvisor user
452146141.reviewBody: This particular church reminded us of the many we had seen in Portugal.  Very ornate and a lot of gold.....\nThe ceiling/dome were absolutely made for photos.....stunning, so intricately and delicately adorned.\nIt was awesome enough to stun the two grandkids into absolute silence!

451821004.name: Beautiful church
451821004.author: a TripAdvisor user
451821004.reviewBody: This unique church is located in the heart of "historical down town morelia" The baroque style is characteristic of the whole area, but this particular church is well preserved and still in regular used. Its beautiful and a very good stop point in your trip even if you are not catholic, the history in art is well worth it. Excellent place

446631796.name: Interesting decorations
446631796.author: a TripAdvisor user
446631796.reviewBody: The church does not look much from the outside, but is fascinating from the inside. Apart from the gold and flower decorations, we liked the huge paintings showing how the Spanish Conquistadors submit the local population -  it looks so real. Definitely worth a look.

441999884.name: Built 500 years ago, a place not to miss
441999884.author: a TripAdvisor user
441999884.reviewBody: Beautiful inside, take your camera, lots of gold on the walls of this beautiful and ancient church.  The ceiling is a must see and unique.

441629619.name: Must see !
441629619.author: a TripAdvisor user
441629619.reviewBody: This beautiful church is must see in Morelia.  Very nice detail and interior not have to religious to visit this place ! \nAbsolutely beautiful !

437823138.name: A must in Morelia
437823138.author: a TripAdvisor user
437823138.reviewBody: You cannot visit Morelia and miss El Santuario de Guadalupe. A beautiful example of barroc religious architecture, among Santa Prisca (Taxco) and El Rosario (Puebla).

433717860.name: A gem!
433717860.author: a TripAdvisor user
433717860.reviewBody: We missed this church first time we visited Morelia but I am glad it was opened on our last visit.  It is absolutely beautiful, the interior of the church is breath taking.

429102859.name: Guadalupe\'s Sanctuary
429102859.author: a TripAdvisor user
429102859.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places in Morelia, is a little church decorated with many flowers plastered in the wall and some covered with gold paper. The place is dedicated to virgin of Guadalupe and is one of the most visited places in Morelia.

422370410.name: Beautiful cathedral.
422370410.author: a TripAdvisor user
422370410.reviewBody: A must see. The building is several hundred years old and is where the Pope came when he visited Morelia.

412076618.name: Beautiful
412076618.author: a TripAdvisor user
412076618.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful church! The interior is marvelous and you can see the great artisan work in all the walls. A must see if interested in religious buildings

405492573.name: Visually shocking
405492573.author: a TripAdvisor user
405492573.reviewBody: It\'s hard to describe the amount of color and image that you get when you enter this beautiful sanctuary.

401510053.name: Beautiful interior with a folk art decoration
401510053.author: a TripAdvisor user
401510053.reviewBody: The ornate decorations inside this sanctuary are painted in a shade of pinkish lavender and feature hibiscus flowers on the ceiling, quite a departure from the more European style of the Cathedral.  It is a lovely small scale and the realistic floral designs in this sanctuary make a very personal impression.  It is a beautiful example of a New World church.

400577927.name: fascinating
400577927.author: a TripAdvisor user
400577927.reviewBody: If you like to see luxury architectural ceilings this is an ideal place to visit. A beautiful piece of art. Your eyes will be amazed with the painting and all the detail art work.

376801103.name: Absolutely breath-taking
376801103.author: a TripAdvisor user
376801103.reviewBody: This was the most beautiful church I have ever laid eyes upon - the decor was simply breath-taking.\n\nWe took a trolley tour of the historical city and stopped here to visit.  It is a MUST see when visiting Morelia

367508306.name: Too much beauty in a small place...
367508306.author: a TripAdvisor user
367508306.reviewBody: Mexican Culture can not be understood without "La Virgen de Guadalupe". Millions of people have her image in their houses, millions of workers have "altares" to her in their works. Millions of people pilgrimage every year (mostly on december the 12th) to see her in the temples, the must important one is in M\u00e9xico City, the name of the temple is: Insigne y Nacional Bas\u00edlica de Santa Mar\u00eda de Guadalupe. Hundreds of temples all over the mexican republic have a special place to her, the devotion is not only all over M\u00e9xico, but all over the world. Even in the Vatican they have many special places in which prayers are said, the Rosary is the best known prayer to say hi to her, and to ask for favors, miracles, etc. Morelia could not be far from this national tradition, even though every single temple in Michoac\u00e1n have a super special place for Her, but in Morelia is the best (by far) temple of the state. Barroco\u00b4s style, invite the visitors to see the beautiful and stunning ceiling, the colors, shapes and forms take our breathe for moments. A time for the beauty, the sacred...A must see place in Morelia.

358126573.name: You must see this gem!
358126573.author: a TripAdvisor user
358126573.reviewBody: This is such a beautiful little church, with a mostly pink interior.  Large murals depict monks educating indigenous people, teaching them carpentry skills, etc.  Beautiful tiles, and dazzling gold.\nThe church is almost adjacent to the colossal statue of Morelos, and within view of the Aqueduct, so you can make an afternoon of sightseeing in a small area.

357384289.name: Small and beautiful
357384289.author: a TripAdvisor user
357384289.reviewBody: It\'s amazing how can the builders were able to put so many details in such a small church. Lots of golden panels and ornaments everywhere. Nice...

355348541.name: Don\'t miss this incredible Sanctuary
355348541.author: a TripAdvisor user
355348541.reviewBody: One does not have to be Christian to appreciate the incredible beauty of this Sanctuary.  Small, but significant - this by far, outranks all other Cathedrals I\'ve visited.\n\nI cannot help but be in awe of the workmanship that was put into this incredible structure - and wish there was documentation about the architects and artists who put this masterpiece together.

353951304.name: Spectatcular Church
353951304.author: a TripAdvisor user
353951304.reviewBody: Have seen many churches in Italy, however, this Mexican church is unique all on its own.  No marble but plenty of gold.  Absolutely a must to see while in Morelia.

352387298.name: Beautiful!
352387298.author: a TripAdvisor user
352387298.reviewBody: I have visited many churches around Mexico, this one is really worth to see. It\'s not big like others but It\'s colorful and with gold details.

352383307.name: Not like every other church
352383307.author: a TripAdvisor user
352383307.reviewBody: Yes there is a church in almost every block in Morelia but this one is definitely worth a visit!! Gorgeous interior high above every other. Don\'t miss it just because it\'s not in the Centro.

351665022.name: This is a spectacle to behold!
351665022.author: a TripAdvisor user
351665022.reviewBody: Quite spectacular and a must see if you are in the area .... near the Aquaductos!  A beautiful church to sit and ponder!  Just stunning!  An area of beauty to walk around ...... we had a beautiful day with blue sky and a bit of rain in the afternoon.

349638783.name: City visit
349638783.author: a TripAdvisor user
349638783.reviewBody: Simply amazing Sanctuary!!! So Beautiful! One could just sit & look at this Santuary all day. It is mesmerizing!

347657673.name: Church with internal gold
347657673.author: a TripAdvisor user
347657673.reviewBody: I could not imagine what is attracting people to visit here from its facade.But I could understand that ; the church hold the internal brightness. \nI think this view is over description.

342902787.name: Beautiful interiors
342902787.author: a TripAdvisor user
342902787.reviewBody: This is definitely worth a visit as the interiors are beautiful and quite different from other churches. It\'s also located near a lovely small park and the aqueduct passes close by, so you could combine all of them together.

342383165.name: Unbelievable Ceiling
342383165.author: a TripAdvisor user
342383165.reviewBody: I have been to many churches and catredrals, but this one is very unique.  The detail of the walls and ceiling are hard to describe!  Go there!

335842680.name: Golden ornate wall adornments
335842680.author: a TripAdvisor user
335842680.reviewBody: We walked about 30 mins from the central chruch via the Acqueduct route and spent some time in this chruch

335726366.name: Amazing
335726366.author: a TripAdvisor user
335726366.reviewBody: Beautiful place in the middle of city center of Moreila. Easy to access and enjoy this amazing building and decoration.

334272321.name: Nice small church (most reviews and photos describes Morelia Cathedral!)
334272321.author: a TripAdvisor user
334272321.reviewBody: This is a very nice baroque church outside the main square, which is very ornate with gold and painting. There is a great confusion as many reviewers describe the Morelia Cathedral (which is probably the most visited attraction of Morelia but it is not on TripAdvisor!) It is more intimate and original than the cathedral and worth a visit.

331928836.name: Petite beautiful church
331928836.author: a TripAdvisor user
331928836.reviewBody: Beautiful church in downtown, communion table and furnished are all plated in gold, which gives a unique cozy-over weighted sensation when you are there. It\u00b4s dedicated to one of the most importants saints in mexican ideology. The virgen of Guadalupe, it also known as "antiguo templo de San Diego".

326967077.name: Worth taking the time to see
326967077.author: a TripAdvisor user
326967077.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful cathedral that rivals churches in Europe. Very ornate. Free entry and sits adjacent to the centre square.

325765262.name: Great church full of history and architecture smack in the middle of Morelia!
325765262.author: a TripAdvisor user
325765262.reviewBody: Great church full of history and architecture smack in the middle of Morelia!\n\nGreat to walk around and admire ...

318812331.name: Highlight of Moreila
318812331.author: a TripAdvisor user
318812331.reviewBody: If you see 1 site in Morelia this is gong to be it. Make sure you set it during the day and night as it\'s really beautiful when lit up

294969105.name: You must visit
294969105.author: a TripAdvisor user
294969105.reviewBody: What a beauty! you should not miss this place, one of the must beautiful churches I`ve ever seen, take the time to enjoy the details all around, Perhaps a perfect place for celebrations as weddings, etc.

287355648.name: Small Church but Packed with Splendor
287355648.author: a TripAdvisor user
287355648.reviewBody: Mexico is full of beautiful churches and they seem to have stopped having such an impact on me, but this church is just beautiful. The light from the cupola floods the nave and the gold just shimmers beautifully.

285147185.name: Absolutely Stunning
285147185.author: a TripAdvisor user
285147185.reviewBody: Being inside of this sanctuary is like traveling inside of a Faberge Egg. Every description I had read made this sound like it could be the gaudiest experience and yet, somehow, it\'s just perfect. Even if you are not the kind of person who puts \'popping in and out of historic churches\' on their list of favorite activities, this is one that you shouldn\'t miss. The altarpiece boasts one of the goriest Christ figures that I\'ve seen and it stands out particularly given the delicate beauty of its surroundings. Four heroic scale paintings illustrate the conversion of the indigenous people in what can only be described as blatant sentimentalism, but given the sanctuary\'s dedication to the Virgin of Guadalupe, a dark skinned Virgin who appeared to Juan Diego and became an effective tool for connecting with indigenous religious beliefs, it is not that surprising to find that theme central to the decorative scheme. \n\nGiven the sumptuous beauty of the interior, it is somewhat surprising to find that it is generally uncrowded, offering a place for quiet reflection and plenty of opportunities to sit and stare at the glittering surroundings.

282430911.name: A must to know place
282430911.author: a TripAdvisor user
282430911.reviewBody: It is a beautiful architectural place you must know in Morelia. One of the best temples in the city.

281965373.name: A gem of artistic expression
281965373.author: a TripAdvisor user
281965373.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most beautiful places to visit in Morelia. The interior walls and the artistic expressions of "arte mestizo" are two experiences for everyone who is looking for an artistic religious spot in a small gem of architecture.

278390965.name: Gorgeous church
278390965.author: a TripAdvisor user
278390965.reviewBody: I hand never seen such a beautiful church in Mexico. When I originally took the tour, I had no idea what I was about to see. From the outside is one thing, but on the inside, I just became speechless. This place is a must if you go to Morelia whether you\'re catholic or not.

273476399.name: Magnificent church (don\'t judge it by the outside)
273476399.author: a TripAdvisor user
273476399.reviewBody: I was born in Morelia and lived here all my life. And I can tell you that the Guadalupe Sanctuary is the most beautiful church of all. The outside is sober and doesn\u00b4t impress very much, but once you enter, you will see a magnificent interior full of golden details in the French Rococo style. It is worth the visit and also once you are there, I recommend to take a walk through the "Calzada" which starts right outside the sanctuary. Is a pedestrian street that will take you to the tarascas fountain and to the end of the acueduct archs.

264356499.name: Atypical Beauty
264356499.author: a TripAdvisor user
264356499.reviewBody: The Facade, in a very sober baroque style from the XVIII C, collides with the opulent decoration full of colors and forms done by a local artisan in 1915. It is a combination of clay sculpture technique of indigenous tradition with european plasterwork.

257381812.name: Amazing
257381812.author: a TripAdvisor user
257381812.reviewBody: It is definitely the most important place to visit in Morelia.  Morelia is a beautiful city with many interesting sites but the Sanctuary is the most beautiful church you will see.

256069274.name: Beautiful centerpiece to Morelia
256069274.author: a TripAdvisor user
256069274.reviewBody: Great Place, everything is within walking distance and this is the center of activity and entertainment all weekend long.

248716935.name: Wow
248716935.author: a TripAdvisor user
248716935.reviewBody: I\'ve never seen anything quite like this place in my life. Go inside and it will take your breath away in an instant.

243514866.name: Inside by day, outside by night
243514866.author: a TripAdvisor user
243514866.reviewBody: This place its a must be there in Morelia, it has a colonial architecture, beautiful paints and gold walls. I recomended visit it inside by day and go back for the night to dinner in some place around and enjoy the view outside.

242513634.name: Lovely place
242513634.author: a TripAdvisor user
242513634.reviewBody: This was an amazing, cozy ad beautiful Cathedral a must see attractions while in Morelia. keep in mind if you go on weekend, there non-stop masses so it makes hard to visit it.

240775486.name: Gorgeous
240775486.author: a TripAdvisor user
240775486.reviewBody: This place can\'t be described in words. You must see it for yourself. It\'s over 10min  walk away from the cathedral.

238902674.name: Daughter visit
238902674.author: a TripAdvisor user
238902674.reviewBody: Totally a must see In a RC country that has drug issues this is a refreshing sight and totally over top\nGreat church that has been kept up\nWell considering it was built over 300 years ago

238450415.name: Golden church
238450415.author: a TripAdvisor user
238450415.reviewBody: When I read how much gold was in this church, I though it be too glitzy.  However, it is a beautiful church.  The paintings in the church are unusual, too.    They weren\'t paintings of Christ or the apostles but of the Christianizing of the local peoples.

231256860.name: Mind-boggling
231256860.author: a TripAdvisor user
231256860.reviewBody: This over-the-top church, built ibid the very early 1700\'s, has an interior virtually 100% decorated with gold or ornamentation. It may sound horrid, but it is actually quite beautiful of overwhelming. Most churches frankly run together in my mind, but not this one.

226018093.name: The golden church.
226018093.author: a TripAdvisor user
226018093.reviewBody: One of the nos beautiful churches in Morelia and in M\u00e9xico!! The golden walls are just amazing! In late november and early december alot of people pay a visit to the Virgen de Guadalupe. You can see some pilgrimage but on december 11th it can get really crowded!!

216704161.name: Mindblowing
216704161.author: a TripAdvisor user
216704161.reviewBody: This church is a complete piece of Work. I loved it. It is absolutely awsome!\nYou will never see anything like this in your life

206266906.name: The decor is unusually elaborate. Do not miss this one!
206266906.author: a TripAdvisor user
206266906.reviewBody: It is safe to say you will be amazed by this church. It is common to marvel at the elaborate woodworking around altars. The stained glass is always beautiful. The paintings and murals deserve awe. Churches of a certain vintage in Mexico are world-class for certain. This place is in a league apart from the rest. The interior will put a wide grin on your face in an instant, for it so alive. One does get the sense it is breathing and pulsing. Yes, the plaster work is repetitive, but it is still so rich and tasty. The colors are brilliant. See this church upon visiting Morelia. It is unique.

202650611.name: Beautiful
202650611.author: a TripAdvisor user
202650611.reviewBody: A must see! Its worth your time. Beautiful.The architecture and decorations are amazing and make this place unique.

195835438.name: Very unique interior
195835438.author: a TripAdvisor user
195835438.reviewBody: From the outside this church looks like just another substantial church. Go inside and you will probably be amazed at the interior\'s appearance with colors and decor not seen elsewhere. Its striking colors are really different and it is known for its unique look. \nTo get there from the center of town walk all the way east along Madero (the main drag through town). Eventually you will reach two fountains and one end of the aqueduct. Then walk along the aqueduct or even better walk along the wide tree covered walk way that parallels the aqueduct until you come to a very large plaza. At the far end there is a huge statue of Morelos on horseback but at the end that you will come to there is a church. Go inside and check it out. Sit back and just look at the interior for a few minutes and soak up one of the most unusual churches you will ever see. The decor is hard to describe. It\'s one of those things you need to see for yourself. And if you want go inside the building to it\'s right that is connected to the church. You are entering the former monastary/convent that is now the Law School of the university.

194572913.name: One of Mexico`s Finest
194572913.author: a TripAdvisor user
194572913.reviewBody: This church will not disappoint.  The bizarre but incredible colours are breathtaking.  This is one of Mexico`s finest.

193296001.name: Amazing interior
193296001.author: a TripAdvisor user
193296001.reviewBody: We toured the area of Morelia near the Aqueduct and included a stop at Guadeloupe cathedral.   The ornamentation, decoration and painting in the interior were stunning.   Some might find it gaudy but we were amazed at the artistry.

191722317.name: One of the best...
191722317.author: a TripAdvisor user
191722317.reviewBody: I have been to a LOT of cathedrals, both in central America, Europe and in the US.  This one isn\'t large - but it\'s STUNNING. We were on a tour so we didn\'t have a lot of time here, but I could have stayed for at least an hour just to look at the ceiling! We got a little lost finding it, but it\'s worth finding.

190651313.name: Stunning interior
190651313.author: a TripAdvisor user
190651313.reviewBody: You can get used to the glitzy interiors of Catholic churches but this one is a bit different and is quite stunning.  The pink and gold interior is very interesting and very beautiful and there is some stunning artwork on display.  We were pleased we made the walk to check it out.

190461933.name: Worth the visit
190461933.author: a TripAdvisor user
190461933.reviewBody: The outside of this church gives few clews as to how amazing the inside is.  The detail is stunning.  It is a joy to walk around and look at every piece of the church.  I would have liked to have visited more than once or gone to a service just to study it more. \n\nThe walk to the church is very pleasant.  We walked one way, saw the church, went to the adjacent park where there is a wonderful playground and took a taxi back to the center of town. Nice outing.

177459840.name: Beautiful cathedral!
177459840.author: a TripAdvisor user
177459840.reviewBody: So big and charming. Comparable to those in Europe! I visiting during a service and the setting is amazing. Very close to many hotels and restaurants.

166524538.name: Esstunning!
166524538.author: a TripAdvisor user
166524538.reviewBody: Over the top plaster moldings, gilt and decor. Rose motif here does Juan Diego proud. Even if you have seen a jillion churches in Mexico this one is unique.

151017347.name: Super baroque
151017347.author: a TripAdvisor user
151017347.reviewBody: This is one of the most visually stunning churches in Mexico, in my opinion. It is like a jewel box. I believe the style is called churrigueresque, but it is super baroque at its best.

149437363.name: Wonderful Saturday night light show
149437363.author: a TripAdvisor user
149437363.reviewBody: At night time, this church is not to be missed. It glows. If you are in Morelia on a Saturday night make time to watch the lights turn on. When I was there at the end of December, people gathered on the street in front of the church at around 8pm. I don\'t remember the exact time the lighting started, but it was sometime between 8 and 9pm. And then the music started and the lights slowly turned on one part at a time until the finale when there were fireworks that went off. It was really fun to see and not to be missed if you are there on a Saturday.

147009888.name: magnificent
147009888.author: a TripAdvisor user
147009888.reviewBody: Beautifully decorated church. very humble look on the outside.\nGot to see how the lights work (with a remote control), was amazing to see the play of light. \nA nice little market place outside.

146783408.name: Fantastic - Not to be Missed!
146783408.author: a TripAdvisor user
146783408.reviewBody: Incredible church - looks humble on the outside, but fabulous gold interior, seriously - do not miss it!

145198755.name: A must see!
145198755.author: a TripAdvisor user
145198755.reviewBody: Beautiful church, very close to the aqueduct. While the outside of the church is pretty plain, the inside of this church is just fantastic!! While church is currently under renovation, place is open for visits and visitors can still admire this incredible site.

131406649.name: Beautiful at Night!
131406649.author: a TripAdvisor user
131406649.reviewBody: The Sanctuary is still being worked on but try to see it from the street at night. It\'s beautiful all lit up, as is the Aqueduct near it so you can see both!

130193970.name: Very beautiful and interesting architecture
130193970.author: a TripAdvisor user
