130193970.reviewBody: loved the way the sanctuary was done as well as the courtyard. When we were there the church was under reconstruction so we did not get to really enjoy what was there. But the architecture designed by the indigenous is quite distinctive

122439329.name: wedding
122439329.author: a TripAdvisor user
122439329.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful churches that are in morelia apart from the cathedral, My husband and i got married here just last month in December and it was just amazing..

121555890.name: Wonderfull architecture
121555890.author: a TripAdvisor user
121555890.reviewBody: The art used in the build was unique, you can\'t leave Morelia without visit this place

675389154.name: Spectacular Light Show
675389154.author: a TripAdvisor user
675389154.reviewBody: I \u201chappened\u201d to be here for the 478th anniversary of Morelia!  The fireworks show outshined Paris\u2019 Eiffel Tower Extravaganza!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

670310019.name: One Huge Church
670310019.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310019.reviewBody: Well of course, it\'s beautiful!  If you\'re into this sort of thing, you need to see this beautiful cathedral.  It\'s nice just wandering the outside, too.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

668892949.name: Stunning Cathedral
668892949.author: a TripAdvisor user
668892949.reviewBody: Simply stunning, even more so when lit up at night .The surrounding area is open and welcoming to visitors. Plenty of shopping and food choices on the plaza.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

667956264.name: Iconic view of Morelia
667956264.author: a TripAdvisor user
667956264.reviewBody: This is a central point of Morelia, the cathedral looks beautiful at different times of the day, make sure to take photos during the day, at sunset and at night when is illuminated and looks gorgeous!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

658284684.name: Beautiful at night
658284684.author: a TripAdvisor user
658284684.reviewBody: Apart from having one of the largest pipe organs in Latin America this church is a huge and beautifully built cathedral. It is especially worth seeing at night all lit up.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

657853686.name: Catedral Saturday Show
657853686.author: a TripAdvisor user
657853686.reviewBody: Our first night in Morelia, and people are dressed up in period costumes for the 9:00 pm show every Saturday. An amazing firework display, especially as the public are so close to the action. The main street was closed to traffic and street sellers are selling all sorts of stuff.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

650011491.name: A Must When Visiting Morelia
650011491.author: a TripAdvisor user
650011491.reviewBody: The Cathedral is very impressive and a must see when visiting the historic city center of Morelia. There are many vendors outside, and many visitors praying inside. Use your best discretion when visiting and taking photos inside as to not disturb those who are in prayer.\n\nSaturday nights are especially exciting as the streets are shut down and a fireworks display is put on to celebrate the beauty of the Cathedral. Also, be sure to visit as night as the views are absolutely breathtaking!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

649752520.name: A Must-See
649752520.author: a TripAdvisor user
649752520.reviewBody: Morelia is known for its beautiful historic cathedral - and for good reason. It\'s a stunning place both during the daytime and night.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

646472500.name: Wonderful architecture but gloomy interior
646472500.author: a TripAdvisor user
646472500.reviewBody: How the craftsmen and masons erected buildings like this always amazes me. This is another example of incredible workmanship that could not be duplicated today.\nBut inside the cathedral is gloomy and oppressive. Explicit pictures of Jesus suffering and being  tortured do nothing to lift my spirits but just emphasize the cruelty of the human race. Why a loving god would allow his son and thousands of others to be put through this is beyond my comprehension.\nWe were accosted by an official guide while were sitting down and, in an attempt to get us to join his tour, mentioned that the altar contained half a ton of gold and silver. Meanwhile, outside the cathedral, hundreds of teachers were demonstrating in support of their claim for unpaid wages. Obviously the glorification of an ancient religion is more important than education of today\u2019s children and the future leaders of Morelia to the church.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

636215973.name: Weekend nights are spectacular
636215973.author: a TripAdvisor user
636215973.reviewBody: Was fortunate enough to be in Moerlia for the weekend.  At night they have a light and fireworks display to please the tourists, as well as the locals. The Cathedral its very nice and centrally located. So much to see and do all around it.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

634957775.name: The city of my dreams!
634957775.author: a TripAdvisor user
634957775.reviewBody:
Morelia, one of the biggest cities in Mexico, is a city in which you’ll immerse yourself on it’s culture, food, places, and friendly people. If you visit this amazing city, you must go to some of its museums, in which you’ll learn about the foundation of the city, the Spanish conquest, and the Purepecha culture. Some of them are Palacio Clavijero, Antiguo Palacio de Justicia, and Casa de las Artesanías de Michoacán. 

If you’re hungry, there are a couple of delicious places you should go. If you want to have a good breakfast, go to Sopes de la Vasco, which is characterized for having the best sopes in town. If it’s the afternoon, go to Lu, a restaurant of the best Michoacan food, and if it gets night, go must go to Cenaduría Lupita, in which you’ll find the best Enchiladas Morelianas in town. 

If you come to the city, there are a couple of places you cannot lose. You need to visit our beautiful cathedral, our emblematic aqueduct, the Tarascas fountain, the Romance Alley, and some more places in downtown. Finally, if you visit the city on a Saturday, don’t forget to go the Cathedral lightning spectacle, which starts at 8:45 PM. So, don’t wait any longer to visit this amazing place. We promise you’ll not regret of visiting it.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

634224747.name: Beautiful!  Huge! Architectural wonder.
634224747.author: a TripAdvisor user
634224747.reviewBody: Just go in, sit in a pew midway and consider when this was built - the craftsmanship, the engineering, the design and aesthetic of this beautiful church.  Think of all the prayers and offerings that have transpired there.\n\nCalming respite.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

631944974.name: The Best
631944974.author: a TripAdvisor user
631944974.reviewBody: Right in the city center and amazing to see.  Tons of history and you have to see it at night to appreciate the cathedral even more.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

627076394.name: Irresistible at Night!!
627076394.author: a TripAdvisor user
627076394.reviewBody: Lovely during the day but irresistible at night.  Enjoy the inside, but sit on the plaza and enjoy the view from the Lu.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

624575225.name: Mesmorizing
624575225.author: a TripAdvisor user
624575225.reviewBody: A family I stayed with took me to this cathedral during the day, outside and inside was beautiful architecture, but inside the biggest organ I had ever seen started to play, the sound and acoustics of the music was absolutely mesmorizing, I thought I had died and went to heaven. This actually was many years ago. I wish I had a phone to record the music back then. Again amazingly heavenly!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

624232924.name: One of the most beautiful church you ever see
624232924.author: a TripAdvisor user
624232924.reviewBody: I believe this is the most iconic place in Morelia and definitely worth to explore any corner of this magnificent and historic place

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

618068054.name: Memorable
618068054.author: a TripAdvisor user
618068054.reviewBody:
I have, in the course of my travels, visited many, many cathedrals, on four continents plus New Zealand.

Most are forgettable. Morelia's is not.

It is, for starters, huge, and it has an outstanding organ, which, out of the blue, started to play when I was there and the building was dark and seemingly empty.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

579118852.name: Saturday night show
579118852.author: a TripAdvisor user
579118852.reviewBody: Drove through this beautiful city and we didnt even know how lucky we were to arrive on a saturday...\ngo see the fireworks show.. worth the one night stop when youre around mexico by car.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

575662096.name: Impressive church illuminated at night
575662096.author: a TripAdvisor user
575662096.reviewBody: This is certainly not one more church in Mexico; but a Catholic monument! The construction started by Italians on 1660, is now the third most important Cathedral of Mexico, with a Cardinal in charge from 2016. Thinking of the size, this one is the second tallest bell towers of the country. Try not to disturb the locals as you walk inside looking at the 4600 pipe organ & the silver sculpture  made by Mexicans dated before 1800, at the main altar. Years ago, the city is the project to light up the buildings at night and the Cathedral was the one with a night show of lights, music & fireworks on Saturdays. From last march 2018, this building is a new show of led lights!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

564956794.name: Large and Lovely
564956794.author: a TripAdvisor user
564956794.reviewBody: This pink-stone building, lit at night, is astounding. The organ is the third largest in Mexico. Adjacent buildings house an exquisite library and a school. Outside this, as well as other buildings in Centro, note the beautiful trees with their interesting trunks.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

558867420.name: Spectacular At Night
558867420.author: a TripAdvisor user
558867420.reviewBody: We were staying in the Hotel Virrey on the Plaza de Armas and we had a suite overlooking the Cathedral. In the evenings, the cathedral was adorned in floodlights and provided a spectacular view. It was even more special one evening when they set off a magnificent fireworks display for about 20 minutes.\nThe interior of the church is quite beautiful but the night time view is what we most remember.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

480109794.name: Great architecture
480109794.author: a TripAdvisor user

But I struggle to get any emotional response from the exterior or the interior of the building itself. I\'m sure it is me and my baggage. The Cathedral, the plaza and the city are immaculate.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

249137053.name: Best place on Earth
249137053.author: a TripAdvisor user
249137053.reviewBody: If I could describe Morelia in two words, it would be extraordinarily beautiful ! , it has everything someone can ask for. Its population is young, vibrant and energetic. The historical downtown is a jewel of the Spanish baroque period. I highly recommend to visit Morelia.. you will fall in love with the city.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

228197890.name: Spain in the middle of Mexico!
228197890.author: a TripAdvisor user
228197890.reviewBody: Morelia\'s landmark Cathedral with its twin towers and tiled domes is the centerpiece of a fantastically beautiful, ancient city made of stone.  It is precisely like being in Spain, but it is full of Mexicans--and we\'re having Mexican food for dinner!  What could be better?  The feel of this vibrant university city is somehow simultaneously tranquil and energizing.\n\nThe Cathedral is the heart and soul of the city, and you will return to it time and again as you explore Morelia.  It\'s a breathtaking experience, not to be missed.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

221358374.name: Breathtaking
221358374.author: a TripAdvisor user
221358374.reviewBody: First time going to the beautiful city of Morelia and I fell in love with it! The downtown area of Morelia is majestic, beautiful, and full of history! Look forward to going back very soon. This city has so much to offer!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

209539354.name: It has it all
209539354.author: a TripAdvisor user
209539354.reviewBody: Everything is so close to the cathedral. There is many shops, including coffee shops and clothing. You can also take tours on the bus that is located right besides the cathedral, there is the history related tour & the "scary" one. I have been on both and I can say they will not disappoint. The cathedral itself is very very beautiful, it\'s a must see.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

169665064.name: beautiful
169665064.author: a TripAdvisor user
169665064.reviewBody: The cathedral in downtown Morelia is definitely beautiful and majestic, with one of the two working giant organs in the world, on one of my visits I got to hear it working and in music festival they do concerts, definitely a beautiful place to visit with all it has to offer. I highly recommend this place to every one.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

143116022.name: Lunching in Morelia
143116022.author: a TripAdvisor user
143116022.reviewBody: Not far away in time, I remember there used to be no more than 5 good restaurants in the colonial city of Morelia, named world heritage site by UNESCO from 1991. Nowadays, not only the number of good restaurants but the gastronomy festivals organized here are calling me to try the good local cuisine. Last time, I was in town for the Traditional indian cooking festival (december 2011) and was delighted with the variety of tacos, enchiladas & pescados no to mention the desserts! Surprinsingly I discovered that the state of Michoacan produces most of the ingredients for the local cooking, leaded by best avocado in Mexico. So this year I am back in Morelia for the same festival (october) and I keep in my mind the flavors of mexican cooking. I plan to get back to local restaurants, San Miguelito, Emilianos, Los Mirasoles & Lu included.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

140111341.name: Fantastic piece of baroque art
140111341.author: a TripAdvisor user
140111341.reviewBody:
Together with the many exquisite colonial style buildings in Morelia centre, the beautiful baroque Cathedral really emphasizes why the city centre is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The cathedral took more than 80 years to build from the beginning in about 1640 (there seems to be a certain ambiguity on the exact start of the construction) and is a perfect example of the colonial baroque style - which has made it widely acclaimed as one of the most beautiful churches in Mexico.
Getting there is not hard (aside of getting a parking space - but valet parking is widely available), and all the fuss about security should of cause not be underestimated, but I never for a minute felt insecure or uneasy, when strolling the streets in the evening. Just do as every other big city - avoid the obvious seedy places and streets - get some local advise.
The cathedral is of cause beautiful from the outside (the pink hues in the volcanic stone it's build from is best seen in daylight) but on the inside it excels with a remarkable room with a impressive acoustic. The interior is not overly ornate - as it was refurbished in the late 1800's. 
When I visited the cathedral, there was a concert starting, featuring the impressive German-build organ (1903) and a local symphony orchestra. This was really something - so do check the program - if there any concerts, it's definitely worthwhile to attend. No need for Spanish - music is universal.
On Saturdays there should be fireworks and lighting effects - this I unfortunately missed - but I might get back some other time.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

136312581.name: Saturday NIght Lighting of Cathedral and Fireworks too
136312581.author: a TripAdvisor user
136312581.reviewBody: During your visit to Morelia you must take in the impressive cathedral lighting and firework display on Saturday evening at 9:00 p.m.  Locals and tourists alike all crowd into the historic city center for this tremendous weekly event.  The Avenida Francisco I. Madero or the Plaza de Armas is packed with people eager to enjoy this spectacular production beginning with classical music, the image of the cathedral projected onto a large screen, and the gradual lighting of the Cathedral followed by a gorgeous display of colorful fireworks that light up the evening sky.  The audience uhs and ahs in appreciation.  Afterwards you can sit at one of the numerous sidewalk cafes to enjoy a beverage or desert.  Take in the free concert at the Plaza Park featuring diverse musical offerings such as a talented woman folk singer accompanied by an accomplished guitarist one week followed by a a young boy rock band the next week.  This is truly a community event that is appreciated by all, irregardless of age or place of origin.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

134263443.name: Great time to go. Very safe and friendly
134263443.author: a TripAdvisor user
134263443.reviewBody: Just got back from a road trip to Mexico which included Morelia. We had read all the bad stories before we went. We were careful, but we had no problems. There were street protests and rallys before the election and the university proffessors were having a dispute with the goverment, but people were extremely kind, helpful and we never felt unsafe. I went with my 65 year old mum and 70 year old step dad, so it wasn\'t just young nieve people.\nHighly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

128678905.name: Morelia dedicated the whole holy week to Jesus.
128678905.author: a TripAdvisor user
128678905.reviewBody: I was amazed to see purple flags with white crosses all over the main streets of Morelia\u00b4s Centro. They also draped most windows with the Mater de Dolorosa Flag, on main streets.\nThere were so much family visiting many churches, during the whole holy week. They walked too for the Silent Walk of Morelia eve of Good Friday. Over all, the Cathedral is so beautiful as well as the many Priest and especially the Archbishop for making it a very Holy week indeed for me and for all residents of Morelia! Plus oh I almost forgot. There were few Music Concerts for free sponsored by the City. One was the amazing Morelian Choral who did the Passion of Christ so very well, and they also did have on Black Saturday, Drama of the Passion Live at the St Francis square. Morelia is definitely a place to visit especially during Holy Week!

address.streetAddress: Av Francisco I Madero Pte S/N, Centro Historico

670310132.name: Yup, that\'s an aqueduct
670310132.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310132.reviewBody: Seemingly going on for miles, this is an interesting old structure in the almost middle of Morelia.  It\'s nice to walk down the side and see how it seems to change elevation, when it\'s actually the road that is changing for the most part.

667955937.name: Iconic!
667955937.author: a TripAdvisor user
667955937.reviewBody: It might look pretty simple, but it actually is functional and important for life and history. This acueduct is an iconic landmark of Morelia, is located quite near the cathedral, you can take nice photos there.

646473222.name: Not worth the walk
646473222.author: a TripAdvisor user
646473222.reviewBody: It was a thirty minute walk for an old couple from our hotel but disappointing to see the aqueduct that is, perhaps, 25 metres high and has one end, at least, that stops with no connection to the next piece of ground. Odd, \nA nice park of grass, trees and pathways is on one side but we could find nowhere for lunch in the vicinity.

645521298.name: interesting, but the park alongside it is more of the attraction than the actual aqueduct
645521298.author: a TripAdvisor user
645521298.reviewBody: the aqueduct is not that special, but park on the street next to it and saunter along the park adjacent.  At the end, there is a beautiful church across the street.  There is a terrific cafe/bakery there as well.  Nice way to spend an hour.

644624056.name: Viaduct? Vy not a duct?
644624056.author: a TripAdvisor user
644624056.reviewBody:
As the author of a Roman era novel called “Aqueduct to Nowhere,” I was of course delighted to find a Morelia’s aqueduct to everywhere.

All of the city tour trams and buses will drive along the magnificent mile-long structure. If you don’t have much time in town that’s probably good enough. If, however you have a couple of days and are looking to take a very nice walk, I highly recommend starting at either end and walking down the beautiful and tranquil stone pedestrian street that parallels the aqueduct. 

At one end you’ll find Plaza Morelos, the History and Contemporary Art Museums, and the amazing Shrine of Our Lady of Guadalupe. 

At the other end, you’ll find the Fuente Tarascas and the delightful Callejon del Romance. 

We spent the better half of a day walking along the Aqueduct and still need to return to see the museums.

644036237.name: Nice acquaduct
644036237.author: a TripAdvisor user
644036237.reviewBody: We saw the acquaduct on a tour bus where the commentary was in spanish.  I wouldn\'t go out of my way to see it, but if you are bored and speak Spanish it is worth a view.

639292734.name: El aqueducto, Morelia
639292734.author: a TripAdvisor user
639292734.reviewBody: This beautiful aqueduct was built during the Colonial Period.  It is considered one of the most important aqueducts in Mexico today.  It really is something to see!

636210806.name: Great architecture
636210806.author: a TripAdvisor user
636210806.reviewBody: Did not have the time to fully enjoy the Aqueduct as I was on a tour bus when we passed it.  Considering it\'s age, it is in great condition.  Makes a great picture for sure.

634224041.name: Quite a sight/site!
634224041.author: a TripAdvisor user
634224041.reviewBody: Despite the car5s whizzing by, you realize the beauty of this engineering feat.  It is like stepping back in time - a marvel considering the age.

631945257.name: History at its best
631945257.author: a TripAdvisor user
631945257.reviewBody: The Aqueducts make you feel like your in Europe.  The best way to see them is on a bus tour of the city.  Great history in Morelia.

631448472.name: interesting historical location
631448472.author: a TripAdvisor user
631448472.reviewBody: The aqueduct is an interesting historical feature that was built, and then rebuilt as a necessity for bringing water into the city.  Nothing else of interest

631416336.name: A well preserved piece of history
631416336.author: a TripAdvisor user
631416336.reviewBody: This is worth seeing; in good condition and an interesting piece of local history. Worth the short and pleasant walk out to see it.

627066621.name: Fabulous to see it still standing!!
627066621.author: a TripAdvisor user
627066621.reviewBody: One of most amazing parts of Morelia is the still standing aqueduct. Whether you are driving by or walking by, it is wonderful to know that this bit of history has survived so long..

620859294.name: Impressive
620859294.author: a TripAdvisor user
620859294.reviewBody: Good idea to walk the city and check this out while you\'re exploring all the other brilliant things in Morelia.

614927924.name: Cool
614927924.author: a TripAdvisor user
614927924.reviewBody: This is a must see sight in town. I compare it with the aqueduct in Quer\u00e9taro, and the one here is longer. They are both interesting in their use of gravity to supply water and the associated history.

594677322.name: A gem from the past.
594677322.author: a TripAdvisor user
594677322.reviewBody: The aqueduct sorta places you in an unknown past, when times were simple, stress low, and people weren\'t afraid to smile.  Walking along this beuty one sees shops, restaurants and hotels.  I preferred Morelia when it was a smaller city but it still has lots to offer

587045447.name: A sight to see
587045447.author: a TripAdvisor user
587045447.reviewBody: Close to old central and a wonder.\nNice wide sidewalks with sculptures and fountains.\nMorelai is a must visit place.

565949261.name: Famous Aqueduct of Morelia
565949261.author: a TripAdvisor user
565949261.reviewBody: This is a true Aqueduct that runs from the center of Morelia to the west. It goes for miles and you can drive beside in either direction. To see how it declines and inclines. When it rains you can see the water still running through as it has for hundreds of years. This is a must see in Morelia and it runs into other famous sites in Morelia. The Engineer or Architeq in the familia will absoluely adore this. Also as a photographer I love watching the different arches and the curves. Simply Amazing!!!!

560936800.name: If you like walking around and seeing interesting things, this is your spot
560936800.author: a TripAdvisor user
560936800.reviewBody: We made a point of finding our way to the Aqueduct in Morelia and we weren\'t disappointed.  It is well preserved and is in a very interesting part of town.  There are many things to do around that area, including the Bosque park, and the Virgin of Guadalupe church.  The Aqueduct is very scenic and provides several impressive view points.  Don\'t miss this if you\'re going to Morelia!

559003182.name: An Impressive Landmark
559003182.author: a TripAdvisor user
559003182.reviewBody: I don\'t know much about this impressive landmark but appreciate its form and function.   The aqueduct is a pleasant walk from the central square and is next to (in apart) the pleasant Bosque park.

558665751.name: Beautiful
558665751.author: a TripAdvisor user
558665751.reviewBody: I saw the beginning and end of the aqueduct. It\u2019s worth the walk, especially on the Calzada. A must see!

551628297.name: Nice engineering to view in a walk
551628297.author: a TripAdvisor user
551628297.reviewBody: The aqueduct is fun to view on a stroll, as it has a sign to read, with a good explanation of the engineering of the aqueduct.  Worth about 10 minutes on a historic walk around Morelia, as you also view the Tarascas Fountain and the Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe Chapel.

550944105.name: Incredible how old it is and it was used to get water in to the city
550944105.author: a TripAdvisor user
550944105.reviewBody: You have ti visit this acueduct from the biginig were smaller arcs\nweare made its 1.8 km long, used to live there 47 years ago and when we were young walked the hole acueducto now you can not do that...

544515903.name: Worth a visit
544515903.author: a TripAdvisor user
544515903.reviewBody: We returned from the contemporary art museum via this way, we had terrific Quesadillas at one end, And enjoyed a stroll with the happy crowd along this peaceful place.

538917696.name: This is one of three iconic sites in the beautiful Colonial, UNESCO, capital city of Michoacan.
538917696.author: a TripAdvisor user
538917696.reviewBody: This is so beautiful to see and it is charming to walk along its lit pathway at night.\nVery romantic!

522067758.name: Birthday party
522067758.author: a TripAdvisor user
522067758.reviewBody: What a wonderful city. Stayed at the Real Inn. Decent place, priced right. Took lots of side trips with the family we were visiting.

521784967.name: Beautifully restored and maintained structure
521784967.author: a TripAdvisor user
521784967.reviewBody: Definitely a must-see for anyone visiting Morelia. Stop off for a drink or meal at any of the numerous cafes, restaurants, Nd bars. They\'re at all price ranges

521771906.name: Beautiful landmark
521771906.author: a TripAdvisor user
521771906.reviewBody: Morelia\'s acueduct is a lovely landmark of the city, it is worth at least seeing it from the car, but you can walk all through it. At the end (or beginning) there is the Tarascas fountain, also another landmark and worth seeing or taking a picture in it.

520865286.name: Wonderfully preserved
520865286.author: a TripAdvisor user
520865286.reviewBody: Worth a walk alone the aqueduct.  And there is lots to see around that area too!  Sundays are great bcz people are walking around.

518551767.name: Well Preserved Landmark
518551767.author: a TripAdvisor user
518551767.reviewBody: The Aqueduct runs from the outer limits of the historic district on Hwy #15 or Av. Acueducto going east toward a very popular residential district, Chapultepec.,  The height of the Aqueduct diminishes the further out it goes until it ends at a statue honoring the laborers that constructed this marvelous elevated water-trough. This amazing architectual structure is in excellent condition and can be view by car or by walking the paved sidewalks on either side.

500475592.name: Amazing structure
500475592.author: a TripAdvisor user
500475592.reviewBody: Little off from central but nice to see actual aqueduct!  It\'s amazing still stand nicely. From tarascas fountain nice place to relax.

494592298.name: Amazing Aqueduct
494592298.author: a TripAdvisor user
494592298.reviewBody: Coming from a life lived with NEVER having a beautiful Aqueduct to look at everyday....I just can\'t stop staring at it! I love how their is the clash of old and modern while watching modes of transportation travel through the aged arches. It fascinates me.

492031435.name: Very interesting history for water
492031435.author: a TripAdvisor user
492031435.reviewBody: This is very well restored and runs through a large part of the city.  It is really beautiful and an engineering marvel.

489749353.name: One of the city icons
489749353.author: a TripAdvisor user
489749353.reviewBody: This beautiful XVIII century construction it\'s one of the most important aqueducts in the country. With a total of 253 arcs, this is one of the icons of Morelia. It\'s definitely worth seeing, especially if you can take a photo including the Tarascas fountain.

484405697.name: A glimpse of the past.
484405697.author: a TripAdvisor user
484405697.reviewBody: Amazing to be so close to history. What is really cool about this area is how tready it has become. The park is lovely and the nearby shops are upscale. Eateries are geared to young people and are delicious and hip. The wallkway is close by, and it is beautiful.

480735361.name: Blown Away By It!
480735361.author: a TripAdvisor user
480735361.reviewBody: Unbelievable story behind the construction of it and worth walking along the 253 arches. Truly stunning architecture and incredible story behind the construction of it!

467776236.name: Impressive Structure
467776236.author: a TripAdvisor user
467776236.reviewBody: It was fun to walk along the aqueduct and take in the sites along the way.  Interesting that such an endeavour was undertaken so long ago in Mexico

465608434.name: Lovely to learn the history and see this amazing structure
465608434.author: a TripAdvisor user
465608434.reviewBody: We passed by the Aqueduct on foot and in the car. It is impressive to drive the length of it and learn it\'s history. Don\'t miss seeing it while you are in Morelia.

465402157.name: Pleasant place
465402157.author: a TripAdvisor user
465402157.reviewBody: Aqueduct built in 1750. Attractive park nearby. Walk down the nearby pedestrian street the the church at the end.

464639134.name: Interesting feature of this historical city
464639134.author: a TripAdvisor user
464639134.reviewBody: Many parks and greenspace near the aqueduct with lots of attractive casas in the neighborhood and incredible where it did carry water from

461175859.name: They should make more of this monument i think
461175859.author: a TripAdvisor user
461175859.reviewBody: I think it would be nice to make more of a feature of this great monument to drinking water and the engineering feat it was and the solving of some unemployment issues at the time........but dont know quite what ? any ideas?

461005698.name: Great Archetectural Detail
461005698.author: a TripAdvisor user
461005698.reviewBody: The aqueduct is just a long row of arches coming into Morelia. Its beautiful to see and located alongside nice green areas. Its by the Tarascas fountain ( a wonderful water sculpture) making the area pleasant to view and sit by.

460256272.name: A great place to see
460256272.author: a TripAdvisor user
460256272.reviewBody: The Morelia aqueduct had 365 arc and there is a myth over it, a nice one if a couple kiss in each arc they would be in love forever. Maybe, maybe not but really nice to try.

459171527.name: Great place to walk
459171527.author: a TripAdvisor user
459171527.reviewBody: The aqueduct is about a mile from the historical center.  One can only imagine how they used to get water when looking at them.\n  The arches run fur quite a ways and make for a peaceful walk,\n

457248878.name: Going through the town
457248878.author: a TripAdvisor user
457248878.reviewBody: Pools like an ile Roman ones. Od is not of course but crosses the Town do driving iii to several Times jako the arcades. Impressive

457005842.name: Beautiful city
457005842.author: a TripAdvisor user
457005842.reviewBody: We took a comfortable bus from Ixtapa that was arraigned by our hotel to Morelia - beautiful.  Good Resturants, crafts and architecture between the zocalo and the aqueduct.

447474563.name: A nice walk

447474563.reviewBody: Good to visit in the late afternoon.\nTake a walk along the aqueduct while the sun sets. It\'s a must see in Morelia, but you can also not get around it when visiting this city.

445693668.name: morelia\'s icon
445693668.author: a TripAdvisor user
445693668.reviewBody: it is a beautiful colonial aqueduct built in the 17th century that runs from the center of the Acueducto avenue, that used to bring water to the city

443165742.name: Nice hangout
443165742.author: a TripAdvisor user
443165742.reviewBody: The Aqueduct is impressive but its also just an integral part of the city. Go to the end (start?) of the Aqueduct at the Jardin Villalong\u00edn. The Jardin is a nice small hang out, wonderful by itself with its crazy manicured "doughnut trees" and the beautiful Tarascas Fountain.  See from the Jardin how the Aqueduct is integrated into the buildings and disappears out of view. Around the Jardin and under the Aqueduct you will find several nice local bars and restaurants with very good local food. Great hang out for evenings.

442865263.name: Surpricing good conditon
442865263.author: a TripAdvisor user
442865263.reviewBody: We where only passing by, but stopped to take good look at this Aqueduct. It is in extremly condition. Well worth visiting.

442754828.name: Longest I\'ve Seen
442754828.author: a TripAdvisor user
442754828.reviewBody: One of the longest I\'ve seen. If you follow it, you get to see some cool plazas, a park where I saw a camp of homeless people living and an art museum.

442000797.name: Old aqueduct
442000797.author: a TripAdvisor user
442000797.reviewBody: This aqueduct built long ago is pictured on every $50 peso bill.  Interesting historically and culturally.\n

441628542.name: I can not believe I see this !
441628542.author: a TripAdvisor user
441628542.reviewBody: The Aqueduct run though downtown ! I see one in Rome but did not think in Morelia Mexico and very nice shape !!

437897772.name: Visually stunning piece of history
437897772.author: a TripAdvisor user
437897772.reviewBody: The Aqueduct runs through downtown Morelia. The fact that this structure is older than the United States of America and in fantastic condition is a testimony to the quality of the workmanship.

437521394.name: The beauty of Morelia
437521394.author: a TripAdvisor user
437521394.reviewBody: Definetely is one of my favorite places in the beautiful Morelia Michoacan, really wanna live there instead the traffic

437094004.name: 300 years old
437094004.author: a TripAdvisor user
437094004.reviewBody: If you have seen the ones in Rome, why see this one?  It is on a busy street with not much else to see.

430888338.name: picture spot
430888338.author: a TripAdvisor user

414679909.name: It looks beautiful!
414679909.author: a TripAdvisor user
414679909.reviewBody: At night the view is amazing! There are little Mexican parks with benches, so you can sit and relax. The weather was around 76 Fahrenheit in July.

413134028.name: Colonial history
413134028.author: a TripAdvisor user
413134028.reviewBody: Within easy walking distance of the historic center, the Aqueduct is an interesting part of the city\'s history

412189971.name: Sunset perfect picture spot
412189971.author: a TripAdvisor user
412189971.reviewBody: This is a really cool area to walk and take pictures .\nI had lots of fun with my brother and sister. You can find churros spots along the way ;-P

410239259.name: Zig zag walking...
410239259.author: a TripAdvisor user
410239259.reviewBody: Morelia has many places to visit, a must one is the "Acueducto". If you like to walk I invite you to do it in a zig zag way, passing behind his arcs, and every time you do admire the other side of the boulevard. You can start the visit in front of "Venustiano Carranza" sport center and from there to downtown...you can walk all the way to the Cathedral, and then have breakfast in one of the many nice restaurants placed just a few steps from there...

402661648.name: Beautiful Landmark!
402661648.author: a TripAdvisor user
402661648.reviewBody: You can drive right along the route of the Aqueduct and snap some amazing pics! It is a must see in Morelia, about 10 minutes from downtown. There are plenty of nice restaurants near the aqueduct and a lovely sculpture entitled "Las Tarascas"\n

397625134.name: 3 mins and you are done.
397625134.author: a TripAdvisor user
397625134.reviewBody: Go. Look at it. Done. Not really much I can say. I am not an architect or engineer so cannot comment on the difficulty or uniqueness of the structure.

395497501.name: Impresionante
395497501.author: a TripAdvisor user
395497501.reviewBody:
Una obra arquitectónica con gran contenido en historia y cultura, lo malo es que si quieres admirarlo todo, será por medio del automóvil o un tour guiado, ya que es bastante largo y no hay lugar para que puedas estar tomándole fotografías.

An architectural work with great content in history and culture , the trouble is that if you want to admire everything will be by car or guided tour, because it is quite long and there is no place for you to be taking her pictures.

393395465.name: Beautifuk
393395465.author: a TripAdvisor user
393395465.reviewBody: It\'s such a beautiful place. If you can read a little about the ancient place and how it works could be really useful to understand better this beauty.

374881325.name: Gorgeous!!!
374881325.author: a TripAdvisor user
374881325.reviewBody: It is beautiful to see/walk and drive. At night the Aqueduct is lit up. The surrounding areas are beautiful parks, homes and a lively downtown scene.

373754024.name: Well cared, too much traffic
373754024.author: a TripAdvisor user
373754024.reviewBody: Morelia seems to have a huge traffic and a potential big pollution problem. The Aqueduct is really pretty but cars go everyday at its side. At night, when there are almost no cars, its a very pretty view.

368069328.name: Night time vist
368069328.author: a TripAdvisor user
368069328.reviewBody: My wife was rather keen to via the aqueduct but we ran out of time and were due to leave early in the morning. The solution was to visit after dinner. Viewing during the night proved to be a worthwhile experience; it is very impressive.

367590243.name: Beautiful
367590243.author: a TripAdvisor user
367590243.reviewBody: My parents grew up here so we come to Morelia like every 2 years and that is and has always been one of my favorite places to drive by or walk by at night.\n

361874192.name: Must wacht!
361874192.author: a TripAdvisor user
361874192.reviewBody: Definitely you must visit it ! . You can walk around and get some rest in the park and just chill. See my pictures of it.  Is a beautiful attraction of Morelia. Worth it .

361507494.name: so beautiful at night
361507494.author: a TripAdvisor user
361507494.reviewBody: This place is a lovely and important thing to see while being in Morelia, good to be seen at night, must go!

360371808.name: Beautiful at all times of day
360371808.author: a TripAdvisor user
360371808.reviewBody: During the day, the streets along the aqueduct are very busy. The juxtaposition of colonial architecture and modern traffic is quite striking.\nAt night, the aqueduct is lit up so that the stones take on an almost golden appearance. It\'s very beautiful!\nIf you have opportunity, try to see this landmark at various times of day.

356585276.name: An important part of the city history.
356585276.author: a TripAdvisor user
356585276.reviewBody: The western and of the Aqueduct is a short pleasant walk from the cathedral area along a beautiful street. Saturday nights and Sunday the street is closed to traffic and it is a pedestrian dream.

353948908.name: Felt like I was back in Rome
353948908.author: a TripAdvisor user
353948908.reviewBody: This Acueduct which is not in use today is such a beautiful replica of the original.  We have previously been to Rome and the sight of the Acueducto brought back memories of Rome.

352393328.name: Grand
352393328.author: a TripAdvisor user
352393328.reviewBody: Roman archs, cantera stone, many years provided water for the city. It\'s great to see. My kid 11years knows about the roman archs so she appreciated the engineering, my 7y was like meh...

345463107.name: Worth a Walk to
345463107.author: a TripAdvisor user
345463107.reviewBody: The structure is beautiful and the city has done an impressive job of incorporating it into the street system with beautiful fountains and outdoor cafes. Worth a stroll to as the lines of the aguaducto are impressive to view.

342383586.name: Nicely Done
342383586.author: a TripAdvisor user
342383586.reviewBody: I am so glad that they did tear this down or allow it to deteriorate.  Yes, it is just an aqueduct, but it is very historic and the entire area is beautiful.

336791150.name: Aqueduct is aqueduct
336791150.author: a TripAdvisor user
336791150.reviewBody: This landmark is situated right in the city centre and of course it\'s easy to find it. As for me, there is nothing interesting there but my hotel was really close to this place and I had walked to see it. If you\'re far from it, don\'t waste your time.

335568766.name: Surprisingly beautiful!
335568766.author: a TripAdvisor user
335568766.reviewBody: We walked towards it not expecting much, but as soon as we got there we were taken aback by how lovely it looked. It\'s worth going there, and walking along the trees.

334265718.name: Well preserved landmark
334265718.author: a TripAdvisor user
334265718.reviewBody: This is a relatively new structure which was built as the ancient roman aqueduct and dissect a large part of Morelia. it is very well preserved and adds some originality to the city and a pleasant landmark

333032905.name: nice walk
333032905.author: a TripAdvisor user
333032905.reviewBody: Using the Aqueduct as a landmark, you can take a wonderful walk around a great (university) neighborhood on the inside edge of the historic district.

330516519.name: why go?
330516519.author: a TripAdvisor user
330516519.reviewBody: This aqueduct is no doubt interesting historically, but can be viewed in a few minutes from a taxi on your way somewhere else.  Morelia is a huge, busy city, and the aqueduct passes through a high traffic area.  We had no interest in trying to walk near it, as there is nothing to see or learn.  The public "bosque" or forest, that is nearby is a lovely place to walk on a hot day, and you can see the aqueduct from there.

325764591.name: Icon of Morelia is a must see if you are visiting this wonderful colonial city!
325764591.author: a TripAdvisor user
325764591.reviewBody: Icon of Morelia is a must see if you are visiting this wonderful colonial city! Great stop close to the aqueducts ... a look into the history of the city!

318811825.name: Alright
318811825.author: a TripAdvisor user
318811825.reviewBody: Close to centre of town you don\'t see many aqueducts in this part of the world do that\'s different but it\'s not particularly exciting. You look at it for few second and that\'s really it.

307990992.name: Amazing
307990992.author: a TripAdvisor user
307990992.reviewBody: This beautiful aqueduct of quarry pink, measure 1810 meters and consists of 253 arches and two boxes of water. It is amazing. Very beautiful.

307469724.name: It\'s an aqueduct all right
307469724.author: a TripAdvisor user
307469724.reviewBody: How do you review an aqueduct? Well, it\'s an architectural and engineering matter of some centuries old, and it was designed to transport water from Point A to Points B, C, etc.\n\nIt\'s quite attractive.

302575095.name: Water transportation
302575095.author: a TripAdvisor user
302575095.reviewBody: This construction was used to transport the water from one point to the another. Its a important point bin the city, but it also have a lot of traffic; I like the style its a area b of the city that you most visit

297818338.name: Impressive!
297818338.author: a TripAdvisor user
297818338.reviewBody: Amazing how this aqueduct decorates the city, and the evening illumination of it is just spectacular! We stayed in Casa San Diego which looked through the aqueduct onto the park. Simply beautiful!

297694004.name: Great evening stroll along the aqueduct
297694004.author: a TripAdvisor user
297694004.reviewBody: The sidewalks along the aqueduct provide a very pleasant stroll any time of day or evening.  Nearby sites of interest add to the experience.

288940679.name: Yet one more site to see in a beautiful, historic colonial center
288940679.author: a TripAdvisor user
288940679.reviewBody: This review of the aqueduct is really just an excuse to alert the traveler to Morelia, Michoac\u00e1n. The city center is beautifully preserved, with a cathedral made of pink granite, a vast Casa de Cultura with indigenous artistry for sale, including guaranteed shipping, innumerable chapels dating from colonial times, and great restaurants. Even in the summer, the weather is wonderful, owing to the high altitude of the city at over a mile above sea level.

287356265.name: Masterfully Incorporated into to City Landscape
287356265.author: a TripAdvisor user
287356265.reviewBody: This aqueduct is much more impressive than the one in Queretaro; the way its architecture is integrated into the fabric of the city is just beautiful.

273221186.name: One of the best architecture in the city.
273221186.author: a TripAdvisor user
273221186.reviewBody: Beautiful place ! You can just walk around, take some pictures, find some restaurants, bars and also there is a park called "Bosque Cuauhtemoc" where You can find museums, food and a BMX and Skate Park.

267157970.name: Be careful of Morelia
267157970.author: a TripAdvisor user
267157970.reviewBody: The city is special because the center conserved the historical look of Spanish heritage of 16-17th century. The back side of the coin is lack of trees, traffic and air polluted by cars. Be careful to pay by card. I used mine at bus station to buy ticket and in 3 star hotel, the card data was stolen by employees in one of the places and used to watch adult videos some days later. I had to argue with my bank for a long time to get a refund. Cash is safe way to pay your bills in Morelia. Think twice before you present your Visa there.

259178312.name: fantastic structure 2100 mtrs long
259178312.author: a TripAdvisor user
259178312.reviewBody: Not one scratch of grafiti....Mark or molest the aqua duct and you get 8 years of prison! As it should be.

257381892.name: A little piece of Europe
257381892.author: a TripAdvisor user
257381892.reviewBody: They look terrific, especially at night.  They really add to the atmosphere of this beautiful city.  It reminds me of my visits to Europe.

255877846.name: All Aqueducts get a 5 Star
255877846.author: a TripAdvisor user
255877846.reviewBody: Visit this by gem day and walk from its point in town where it ends (don\'t forget the little shops beneath it) outward and see it grow taller. For sure don\'t miss it at night when it is light up, and again walk away from town. The lights shine up to the top. The only problem with walking in the area to see the aqueduct is the traffic. Be careful and do not get run over.

251776565.name: Impressive
251776565.author: a TripAdvisor user
251776565.reviewBody: A good,easy walk down the main street you will find this architectural sight. It\'s very impressive and still in use.

246245987.name: A beautiful city
246245987.author: a TripAdvisor user
246245987.reviewBody: We were driving from the west coast to Mexico City.  This town is in the mountains and I was amazed at the nature of the forests nearby. It actually felt cool and northern (pine trees).  The architecture is very Spanish and beautiful.

240269082.name: Graceful
240269082.author: a TripAdvisor user
240269082.reviewBody: Many Mexican cities have aqueducts, but to my mind, the one in Morelia is the most graceful of them all. Beautiful.

238619177.name: A nice walk at night
238619177.author: a TripAdvisor user
238619177.reviewBody: We walked both at day and night, and night was very pleasant. There is traffic along the route but it is not too bad,  nicely lit at night.

233665463.name: An interesting walk in colonial Morelia
233665463.author: a TripAdvisor user
233665463.reviewBody: The walk of the aqueduct to the east section of colonial Morelia is a complete experience when touring this world heritage site. Starting at the famous \u201cTarascas\u201d fountain, I walked the avenue following the line of arches on the right side after which I saw the old country homes now located in the Cuauhtemoc park. one of them is now the Contemporary art Museum. Once I turned left, across the avenue, I saw the statue of local hero \u201cMorelos\u201d in a large beautiful plaza. All across this plaza & monument, I saw a church next to the Franciscan monastery. \u201cIt looks like a cake! I heard a child talking about the handmade decoration inside church, in which the ceiling, dome and walls show ornate work with flowers and gold leaf details. After this last, I walked back to downtown so I could see some of the old colonial homes on both sides of the pedestrian street, with large benches along so I sat there for a while. I ended my walk with a great picture of the arches and the fountain in the middle, taken from the walking street. Just when I thought that was it, I went across the street to the right on the way to callejon del romance, to find a table outdoors for the view of the aqueduct and the beautiful garden around, so I got a coffee time. Don\u00b4t miss this walk in town.

232599442.name: Unexpected treat
232599442.author: a TripAdvisor user
232599442.reviewBody: I didn\'t realize Morelia had such an amazing landmark. Very intact, the Aqueduct is runs across half the town and is fun to see.

228198139.name: Spain in Mexico
228198139.author: a TripAdvisor user
228198139.reviewBody: The Romans taught the Spanish to build aqueducts, and they passed it on Mexico... the effect is well and truly like being in Spain.  It is said that Puebla is the most Spanish of Mexican cities, but we are thinking Morelia is more like it.  The aqueduct is something to see, particularly at night.

226011929.name: The most beautiful landmark in Morelia!
226011929.author: a TripAdvisor user
226011929.reviewBody: The Acueducto is gorgeous! I say as a local and as a tourist. Don\'t just watch it.....walk it! If you start at the end of Av Madero you can see the Tarascas fountain, the beautiful Villalongin square and some old colonial houses full of strange histories. You can take a detour a have some delicious makis from the Hospitales street or finish the Acueducto and have some Gourmet tortas, amazing salads and delicious bevarages at the MX. Walk it!! It\'s really not that long. And with the light on at night it\'s better!!

222410360.name: Beautifully Maintained and very Scenic.
222410360.author: a TripAdvisor user
222410360.reviewBody: A delightful place for a walk. Wonderful to see how well everything is kept. Morelia is a very clean city and there is clearly a concern to maintain the wealth of historic features.

215440059.name: like it
215440059.author: a TripAdvisor user
215440059.reviewBody: we did a touribus during our honeymoon stay at la soledad, it was great much info and history.the bus stops just in the middle of el callejon del romance with words of lucas ortiz, crossing the street there is la puente de las tarascos, also la carcel demujeres, the aquaduct is about 1800 meters longand with 253 arcs its the longest in mexico el abrevadero is a worth visit for refreshments.

213070807.name: The Aqueduct.
213070807.author: a TripAdvisor user
213070807.reviewBody: Going to see it was a nice walk around town.  It\'s nothing special, but it\'s there and should be looked at.

209538938.name: Beautiful
209538938.author: a TripAdvisor user
209538938.reviewBody: It is extremely beautiful along with all the other things to see. Morelia is such an amazing city & if you ever have the chance to go visit definitely do it.

202838966.name: An amazing week
202838966.author: a TripAdvisor user
202838966.reviewBody: Has to be the worlds GREATEST Aqueduct...you could literally spend days there!!Bring the family, friends, business metting, you name it....and it can be done. Atruely unmissable experience!

196766276.name: Incredible length
196766276.author: a TripAdvisor user
196766276.reviewBody: The aqueduct of Morelia is stunning in lenght. I was really surprised that so much of it was still preserved. In the past, it started in a lake, that is now apparently dried out.

195836054.name: It\'s worth a good look
195836054.author: a TripAdvisor user
195836054.reviewBody: We saw the lovely aqueduct in Queretaro a few years back and when we were recently in  Morelia their aqueduct was definitely on our list of things to see. It is a nice walk from the center of the city. Just walk east on the main street, Madero, until you come to two fountains which is the end of the aqueduct. The fountains are worth a look in themselves and there are restaurants and cafes all around. You can walk along the aqueduct for quite a ways and it does run for a few miles/KMs but most visitors just walk about half a KM to a plaza with the large statue of Morelos. You can walk right next to the aqueduct but it is next to a busy street. Walk instead on the wide pedestrian only wide walk way that is sheltered all the way by trees. On the other side of the aqueduct is a city park with a couple of museums and a hospital on the edge of the park grounds. It\'s also nice to see the fountains and the aqueduct after sunset when they are lit up. \nMany years ago the aqueduct was originally made of wood and later with stone. It brought needed water to a growing city a couple of centuries ago. Now it is just something for visitors to enjoy seeing.

192148240.name: Best preserved aqueduct
192148240.author: a TripAdvisor user
192148240.reviewBody: This is by far the best preserved aqueduct I\'ve seen. Sure it is less than 300 yrs old but still impressive. Blends perfectly with the city. Not many places in the world that have such an impressive complete/preserved architecture within the city. Certainly nothing like it in the US.

190462194.name: It isn\'t in ruins!
190462194.author: a TripAdvisor user
190462194.reviewBody: I was surprised the see the Aqueduct as one that looks strong and as if it could still work - not in ruins.  The walk there was pleasant and it isn\'t far from the center of town.

190166796.name: Facinating
190166796.author: a TripAdvisor user
190166796.reviewBody: It\'s a privilege to see this anticuated work preserved and maintained.  Lighted at night makes it magical.

187570116.name: A very interesting sight
187570116.author: a TripAdvisor user
187570116.reviewBody: The aqueduct is a very unique sight with all of its arches. The surrounding area with its parks and sidewalk tiendas was a great way to spend an afternoon

184857956.name: A great walk
184857956.author: a TripAdvisor user
184857956.reviewBody: I enjoy walking down Madero Street to the Aqueduct.  The fountain and park there are beautiful. It is a great place for people watching.

182505673.name: The trademark of Morelia
182505673.author: a TripAdvisor user
182505673.reviewBody: The lovely colonial aqueduct is really the symbol of old Morelia. It will be encountered going and coming from the city, but is not right downtown. Photo op.

182234131.name: Amazing structure
182234131.author: a TripAdvisor user
182234131.reviewBody: Incredibly preserved aqueduct. Very accesible for detailed view and photos. Ask where it starts and follow it all the way down to the stunning colonial style downtown of Morelia. A must see.

159716194.name: When built is was on the outskirts of the city
159716194.author: a TripAdvisor user
159716194.reviewBody: Walk from the Tarascan Fountain to the Sanctuary of Our Lady Guadalupe Church.  December 12th is the annual celebration of Our Lady of Guadalupe which includes a procession along this pedestrian only avenue.  It is a lovely stroll with large shade trees and old mansions which are now restored to house museums, offices and schools.  It is just more example of amazing Spanish infrastructure construction from the early 1700\'s.

157295164.name: Beautiful
157295164.author: a TripAdvisor user
157295164.reviewBody: The Aqueduct was a very pleasant surprise. I expected to see something in ruins which would be located somewhere at the edge of the city but it was far from that. The walk around the Aqueduct takes you to park area, interesting churches and by stately old homes. Wonderful!

155289518.name: One of the most well preserved aqueducts in Mexico
155289518.author: a TripAdvisor user
155289518.reviewBody: The construction of this aqueduct started in 1549 and its lenght is of 1,700 meters with 253 arches. It has been renovated several times, last one was made in 1998.

151017245.name: Fascinating and historical
151017245.author: a TripAdvisor user
151017245.reviewBody: A good representation of the ingenuity of the Spaniards. Too trafficky to really be able to appreciate it up close, but wonderful to look at.

150883959.name: Looked lovely in the light of dusk
150883959.author: a TripAdvisor user
150883959.reviewBody: What an amazing piece of engineering, looks lovely and made a nice part of a walk around the old city.

149523003.name: Interesting historic monument
149523003.author: a TripAdvisor user
149523003.reviewBody: Quoting history as we heard it: The aqueduct was built at a time of drought. The people were angry about the lack of work and dry farms and were probably about to rebel, when the Spanish rulers figured out that an aqueduct would solve all their problems - it gave employment to a lot of people and brought much needed water to the city. \n\nIt still remains as it was built and thankfully is well preserved.

147009572.name: humble but picturesque
147009572.author: a TripAdvisor user
147009572.reviewBody: The Acueducto blinds in so charmingly with the rest of Morelia, quietly making its way above the street to vanish quietly into the streets.\nVery pretty walk and a nice site. A picturesque walkway runs parallel with it and ends into a beautiful Marketplace ( may be seasonal) and a gorgeous church.\nWalking distance from the cathedral so don\'t miss it.

146519814.name: Stunning by day and night
146519814.author: a TripAdvisor user
146519814.reviewBody: This is worth seeing by day and night. At the Tarascas Fountain end, there\'s a small park and a nice little terrace bar where you can enjoy a beer in the afternoon sun.

145198548.name: Worth visiting!
145198548.author: a TripAdvisor user
145198548.reviewBody: Really like this part of Morelia, it is very neat and well maintained. Also nice to walk around this area.

144343004.name: Fantastic!
144343004.author: a TripAdvisor user
144343004.reviewBody: Great piece of colonial architecture. This aqueduct is the iconic symbol of Morelia, which I believe has the most beautiful colonial architecture in all of Mexico. Visit this city... you won\u00b4t regret!

142786830.name: Calzada walkway along the aquaduct worth the walk...
142786830.author: a TripAdvisor user
142786830.reviewBody: A quiet walkway ending at the Tarascas fountains. Was the old road to the east and Mexico DF. Sat in the shade on the stone benches alongside this old road that has been here since the 1600\'s - I couldn\'t help but think of the many that sat in this same place over the centuries watching the parades that used to pass along this route...

140754535.name: Aqueduct - take the walkway next to it
140754535.author: a TripAdvisor user
140754535.reviewBody: The Calzada (walkway) next to it is a lovely tree shaded walkway with gardens, alongside this historic and well-preserved aqueduct.

140279262.name: Very impressive
140279262.author: a TripAdvisor user
140279262.reviewBody: Didn\'t like the fumes from the cars - virtually no smog control for cars here. Made walking less pleasant than it could be, but the place is so impressive, with little parks, fountains, fabulous building everywhere.

139070051.name: a beautiful walk through historic center
139070051.author: a TripAdvisor user
139070051.reviewBody: follow the aqueduct through the historic center of the city past shops, churches, wonderful places to eat and a handful of museums and universities. A lovely walk and great photo opportunities

134404137.name: Nice spot for pictures
134404137.author: a TripAdvisor user
134404137.reviewBody: Saw it while on the trolly guided tour. I heard the history of it and it was interesting.

134172335.name: Aqueduct at NIght
134172335.author: a TripAdvisor user
134172335.reviewBody: Don\'t miss visiting the 253 arches of the aqueduct.  Go at night and maybe during the daytime too.  It is really beautiful all lit up at night.  Morelia has done a wonderful job featuring their architectural attractions with excellent nighttime lighting.  Stroll along the tree lined street on the pedestrian walkway.  Stop for a rest on one of the many Baroque benches.  Enjoy the park and please don\'t miss a visit to the Museum of Contemporary Art with its interesting and engaging exhibits.

131870990.name: Lovely park to sit and watch the world go by
131870990.author: a TripAdvisor user
131870990.reviewBody: The aqueduct itself is interesting because it is very old and quite beautiful. The park that it runs around on two sides is lovely with sloping lawns, fountains, huge trees and benches all around the perimeter. A great place to take a book and read or just sit back and people watch.

131311046.name: A Historical Sight and it\'s Free
131311046.author: a TripAdvisor user
131311046.reviewBody: On our first day in Morelia, we decided to check out the Aqueduct, having seen the one in Zacatecas a year ago. We saw it on a Sunday which I highly recommend since they close the streets around it on that day. We started at the Tarascas Fountain and walked alongside the Aqueduct, passing the Contemporary Art Museum and ending at the Plaza Morelos. We then walked back down the Calzada Fray Antonio de San Miguel, which is an old walkway always closed to vehicles. We encountered a group of musicians from a local church singing worship songs. Nice touch on a Sunday morning, as well as families with children, young lovers and people watchers. The next day we returned to walk to the end of the Aqueduct where there is a statue and a plaque honoring the workers who constructed it.

130807487.name: Pretty and Alongside a Wonderful Long Outdoor Walkway
130807487.author: a TripAdvisor user
130807487.reviewBody: The aqueduct is extensive, and only a 15 minute walk from the heart of the centro hist\u00f3rico.  It runs alongside an attractive park, and is close to the museum of contemporary art, a must.  There\'s a long pedestrian walkway running beside it; quaint, quiet, yet filled with lots of student activity, and comfortable for a nice afternoon walk.

130782985.name: NICE part of Morelia
130782985.author: a TripAdvisor user
130782985.reviewBody: around and along the aqueduct,part of Morelia with a lot of trees,quite place,very diferent of mineral center !!!

130348799.name: beautiful
130348799.author: a TripAdvisor user
130348799.reviewBody: As with many parts of Morelia...beautiful. Worth seeing.

129529037.name: Beautiful
129529037.author: a TripAdvisor user
129529037.reviewBody: Very beautiful, especially when it is all lit up an night

128355027.name: Something to take a look at, not to spend the whole day at.
128355027.author: a TripAdvisor user
128355027.reviewBody: It is located on one of the main roads. Nice to take a picture, it is the back side of the 50 peso bill.

127569627.name: Beautiful
127569627.author: a TripAdvisor user
127569627.reviewBody: Night or day, what a wonderful sight to behold. Truly defines the city. Love how all the old stuff here is preserved so well.

127506995.name: Breath taking
127506995.author: a TripAdvisor user
127506995.reviewBody: just breath taking architecture just to think it was all done without the help of cranes and tractor and so on...

126426719.name: 253 arches!
126426719.author: a TripAdvisor user
126426719.reviewBody: Not as tall as Queretaro\'s but this way you see it better.

125002122.name: very easy to walk to
125002122.author: a TripAdvisor user
125002122.reviewBody: The aqueduct is 2 km long with a beautiful fountain near the start of the aqueduct.

123740905.name: Very cool.
123740905.author: a TripAdvisor user
123740905.reviewBody: It is a cool place to walk.  You can walk from the historic district out to the Museum of Contemporary Art (also recommended).

123734652.name: Impressive
123734652.author: a TripAdvisor user
123734652.reviewBody: It\'sa a visit that will take an hour, noit more. It\'s the engineering feat which is impressive but it is something you can inly look at.

122964730.name: Humble in from of genious work
122964730.author: a TripAdvisor user
122964730.reviewBody: we followed the aqueduct from the start right up to the monestary where the water was going to be distributed.  Great lesson on how they lived back then

122744847.name: Lovely way to spend your morning whilst exploring the city
122744847.author: a TripAdvisor user
122744847.reviewBody: This is what i most enjoyed about the city. Woke up really early one morning and walked beside it for a good amount of time, admiring how it has been kept in such an a great condition and how it gives the city character. To me the aqueduct is the city\'s most prominent emblem.

122740013.name: Nice
122740013.author: a TripAdvisor user
122740013.reviewBody: Interesting for a visit...but at the far end of Morelia.

122439261.name: romatic city
122439261.author: a TripAdvisor user
122439261.reviewBody: My husband and i took a trolly tour of the city and it took us by the aqueduct all i have to say it is beautiful and the architecture is just incredible

121150657.name: Very well conserved
121150657.author: a TripAdvisor user
121150657.reviewBody: Its beautiful architectonic aqueduct, but lots of traffic around it.

116589762.name: A place for long walks
116589762.author: a TripAdvisor user
116589762.reviewBody: This place is great!. They are arches that start from very small ones, then they start to growi, then become small again. The go all the way at the middle of the street from one point to another one around 3 miles. I loved to go running there back and forth to the downtown, you can find a park, some other cute little hotels, the San Diego church which is a gold church from inside. The Acueduct it used to be the only way to provide water to the people in the 1900\'s.

650004847.name: Overpriced Candy Store
650004847.author: a TripAdvisor user
650004847.reviewBody: My wife and I visited this location on a Sunday morning. We arrived at their scheduled opening time and waited, and waited, and waited. We could hear the staff getting things ready inside so we continued to wait. Another couple that was waiting with us eventually left. The store finally opened about 10-15 minutes later than their scheduled opening time. Workers were still mopping and setting stuff up as we walked through the store.\n\nUpon entering I realized that this is not a museum as much as it is a retail store. They do have some unique candies, but they are drastically overpriced!!! I would highly suggest walking down the street to the Mercado de Dulces y Artesan\u00edas and buying items for a fraction of what they are charging at the \u201cmuseum.\u201d

633500689.name: Informative
633500689.author: a TripAdvisor user
633500689.reviewBody: Went with my wife because she loves sweets. The employees are all great in garbs of the period. The store is in the front, museum in the back. The downside is....if you don\'t speak Spanish, you\'re out of luck. If you do....great. They have original tools and machinery, as well as a candy making demonstration on the museum tour. Very well explained.\n  Candy is a little pricey, but you\'ll never get it fresher. \n

631414619.name: Candy store
631414619.author: a TripAdvisor user
631414619.reviewBody: This was basically a place to buy candy. I wouldn\'t call it a museum by any stretch of the imagination. And there were no demonstrations of candy making.

594534455.name: Nice and sweet!
594534455.author: a TripAdvisor user
594534455.reviewBody: This is a must visit when in Morelia. You will have the chance to see how a traditional sweet from Morelia is made and you can also taste it!. The place is full of history with photographs and old machinery. There is also a shop to buy some typical sweet from the area.

565952487.name: Candy Factory in Central Morelia
565952487.author: a TripAdvisor user
565952487.reviewBody: This is a great place to tour in central or downtown area of Morelia. Located on the main drive going through dwontown Morelia is the candy factory. This is cool because they still make the candy like it was made over 100 years ago. You also can get a chance to make some and then taste it while it is still warm. Made with simple, organic, and natural sweetners the candy is great! Then after the tour you have a huge assortment of candy to choose from. This is one of the best tours for kids and families in Morelia. Some of the tourbuses actually drop you off and then pick you back up after the tour. Or you can just walk a few blocks back to the main square and Cathedral of Morelia.

556208543.name: Interesting experience
556208543.author: a TripAdvisor user
556208543.reviewBody: When you enter the Museo del Dulce you enter the store and another room with toys. We asked about the tour and demonstration in broken spanish. The cost is 26 pesos/person. The staff do not speak english. Our guide, Brian, took us through a door which lead us into the photo gallery, a small theatre, dioramas, old machinery and a demonstration kitchen. There are 2 videos with english subtitles shown in the theatre which explain the photo gallery and the candy making history in Morelia. It is worthwhile and interesting.

550989684.name: A must
550989684.author: a TripAdvisor user
550989684.reviewBody: This is a must if you visit Morelia, a nice shop to buy some typical mexican candy. \nThe museum is really interesting and just about 1 dollar to get in.

545044772.name: Tour
545044772.author: a TripAdvisor user
545044772.reviewBody: Very interesting history of the company and demonstration of candy making from it\u2019s beginning. Staff was dressed in period clothing and very helpful.

531868660.name: Cool place to check out while in Morelia!  Museo Del Dulce
531868660.author: a TripAdvisor user
531868660.reviewBody: I really loved Morelia, the Museo Del Dulce was on my list before I went and I am glad I checked it out. I got a bottle of the crema de cafe. It went perfect in my coffee! Also I love the Morelianas.   Also visit the Cafe de Ao

528369506.name: Yes, there is a museum and a candy shop!
528369506.author: a TripAdvisor user
528369506.reviewBody: I have visited this place twice now, it is always a good experience. I have read some reviews where they didn\'t find the museum in the shop, but it is there, you just need to ask or find the entrance at the rear of the candy store. There is nice photographic exhibit, it includes a guided tour, videos of the candy manufacturing process and an actual demonstration of candy manufacturing (tasting included).\nYou can of course purchase a few sweets after the tour and take some home.\nAlways a good visit for family and friends.

523000768.name: I\'m confused... is there a museum?
523000768.author: a TripAdvisor user
523000768.reviewBody: We didn\'t find a museum here, just a shop. It was also very hard to buy anything. One star often seems callous or even silly. We just had a one star experience. Which is to say, we arrived and had no experience.

521782620.name: Candy and ice cream
521782620.author: a TripAdvisor user
521782620.reviewBody: A cutesy shop with delicious local candies packaged for the traveler. Perfect for gifts to take home

520865908.name: Not really a museum
520865908.author: a TripAdvisor user
520865908.reviewBody: A cute little candy shop with an extra touch.  You can try some of the local candy before you buy.  Enjoy!

500774221.name: Yummy
500774221.author: a TripAdvisor user
500774221.reviewBody: Michoacan dulces or sweets are delicious. Here you can learn more about how they are made. The place is right in the centro and well worth the visit.

489434541.name: Worth visiting.
489434541.author: a TripAdvisor user
489434541.reviewBody: We did not take the tour, but we did buy the crema de cafe and some candy. I highly recommend the Crema it was amazing. Its similar to rompope but of higher qualify.

485094004.name: Dont bother
485094004.author: a TripAdvisor user
485094004.reviewBody: This is just a market with every stall offering the exact same thing. No production or demonstrations going on. Just kiosks of sweets.

480093156.name: Charming, interesting, amazing variety
480093156.author: a TripAdvisor user
480093156.reviewBody: This is the company store for perhaps the oldest candy maker in Morelia. The shop is very large and stocks a huge variety of sweets, cakes, cookies and hot chocolate including sugar free varieties and many with macadamia nuts which like the regions rich volcanic soil. The "museum" is at the back and there is a small fee of a little over US$1. The live human explanation is only in Spanish but they show you a diorama of the old fashioned candy making facility and run the old style equipment for you, then show how some of it was cooked by hand and give you a taste. There\'s also a tiny cafe on site for coffee, cocoa and sweets. The place is easy to miss as the shop front is very small. Look for a young person in Victorian clothing selling sorbets (Nieves) at the front. The shop prices are higher than in the mercado de dulces but the quality is superb and they give taste tests.

480012403.name: More Store Than Museum\u2014Yet Worth a Visit
480012403.author: a TripAdvisor user
480012403.reviewBody: Technically there is a museum area in the way back that I heard was fun, yet not a requirement of the visit. The store itself is like a boutique you might find in any major city in the world--the branding, package design, and product display is spot on! The candies are excellent.

467865754.name: cute and tiny
467865754.author: a TripAdvisor user
467865754.reviewBody: We took the tour, it was nice and short, it was in Spanish, I\'m not sure it they have it in English.  Although it\'s small and the tour is short the place is very beautiful especially if you like taking pictures.  they also have lots of candy for you to sample.  This is a one time visit, no need for more that that

460256095.name: Candies
460256095.author: a TripAdvisor user
460256095.reviewBody: You can find delicious handmade regional candies like guava rolls with milk candy, fruit jelly, and many more.

457450715.name: Tasty history! (If you have food allergy, please read it.)
457450715.author: a TripAdvisor user
457450715.reviewBody: Morelia is an amazing city to visit and if you are there you should go to this museum where they show you how they produced the sweets long ago. We had a friend who translated for us. I\'m not sure if the staff speaks English. We watched a short film about the history of the place with subtitles and it was interesting. You just have to read super fast because the Spanish talk is very "rapido". :-D \nIf you ever had allergy for food or any kinds of fruit, please take antihistamine with you to Mexico. They use a fruit for one of the sweets that we didn\'t know before. My friend had an ice lolly made of this fruit earlier and she had allergic reaction. Later on we realised that in the museum in Morelia they use the same fruit for the demonstration of the sweets making process. If you don\'t know the fruit they use and you had food allergy problems earlier, please be careful.

452441303.name: Good sampling of specialty candies
452441303.author: a TripAdvisor user
452441303.reviewBody: Interesting to try and taste candies we are not accustomed to.  The variety is good and you can taste some of them before buying.

449656396.name: Excellent
449656396.author: a TripAdvisor user
449656396.reviewBody: You can find all kind of souvenirs for everyone, the prices are very good and people is very helpful.  Is not too far from downtown so you can walk. This place is also know as mercadito de dulces. Is well know in the city, so any taxi can take you there as well. You will also find good food and beer around here so is a good place to visit before you leave the city.

446632935.name: Interesting , tasty, informative and attractively arranged
446632935.author: a TripAdvisor user
446632935.reviewBody: the place includes a shop selling a huge variety of sweets - all locally produced based on the family knowledge. Make sure you get to join the tour of how they produce their finest sweet - fruit Ate. It is delicious and you actually get to do it yourself in their spacious and attractive old style kitchen.
