All is done on open fire in brass utensils. They have an attractive coffee shop and probably the finest and highest-quality selection of sweets. Try the sugar-free ones - the sugar is substituted by natural Agave honey. The only downside is that there is no English spoken. But if you do speak some Spanish, they will take their time and patiently explain again and again until you understand. It was a great experience for us.

439552355.name: interesting
439552355.author: a TripAdvisor user
439552355.reviewBody: the candies are very delicious  and cheap, the tour is very interesting.The only down side would be that the guides and video show has no English subtitles

439077715.name: Come for the candy not the tour
439077715.author: a TripAdvisor user
439077715.reviewBody: Lots to buy, but the museum visit led by a worker was rushed. Normally I can understand Spanish, but the tour guide was speaking so fast to rush us through the visit. While there was a video, we were not shown it (or at least I wasn\'t), and so based on other comments I missed out on the one thing I might have understood. There\'s really not much to the museum - some tiny models, a quick show of some of the candy making machinery, and then a taste test of a pectin based treat. It\'s really just a vehicle to get you to buy stuff I think. \n\nI did end up having a chocolate moreliano (hot chocolate) and a piece of cake that was quite good, though.

420553915.name: Quick stop to take a selfie!
420553915.author: a TripAdvisor user
420553915.reviewBody: Established over ten years ago, the Candy shop & Museum is worth a quick stop to try the local fruit candies, sit at the table to taste local coffee and chocolate on winter time, or enjoy ice cream in the spring days. All personnel attend customers wearing suits & dresses that will remain you the Victorian era so, think about the chance to wear a fancy hat to get a selfie in this place!

412189026.name: Tasty and Interesting
412189026.author: a TripAdvisor user
412189026.reviewBody:
If you're into sweets and history, it's worth the visit!
I actually had very low expectations but was pleasantly surprised on how cute the museum was and how knowledgeable and kind their staff is.
The only down side would be that the guides and video show has no English subtitles. If you understand Spanish or u just care about the sweets you will enjoy!
Also perfect place to buy some chili sweets as souvenirs for my friends in China.

412076280.name: A trip to the past
412076280.author: a TripAdvisor user
412076280.reviewBody: It\'s a great scenery you imagine yourself in the past. The employee are all dressed up, the coffe and dessert are really nice. Their have fabulous sweets typical from Michoac\u00e1n.  The morelianas are exquisite

397623342.name: Interesting info!
397623342.author: a TripAdvisor user
397623342.reviewBody:
My wife and I visited the museum and really enjoyed it. Is is about $2 per person to get in. There are turn of the century dressed employees guiding you to different stations in which they tell you about the history of Morelia and it's delicious candy products. 
The tour is short but very interesting. They even make a batch of candy from scratch for you to try.
The visit will take you probably 30 minutes, including time for purchasing all kind of sugary delights.
I would definitely bring my kids in the future.

386220637.name: Fun to see...
386220637.author: a TripAdvisor user
386220637.reviewBody: Good way to understand candy making from a century or two ago thru today. If you eat sweets, you\'ll be in candy heaven. They also have a bakery. Nice staff. Guide was lovely.

353456481.name: Don\'t bother
353456481.author: a TripAdvisor user
353456481.reviewBody:
This attraction is pretty, and kind of charming and nostalgic -- but it's basically commercial.  Staff wear turn-of-the-century costumes in an effort to make more sales of candy, baked goods, and liqueurs.
When I visited, it was the off season for tourism.  I was told that tours last about 1/2 hour, and they only begin when there is some minimum number of visitors -- "and you, ma'am, are the first".  It was clear that there was going to be no tour that day, as there would never be the critical mass of visitors.  That was perhaps understandable.
But the staff were involved in some kind of inventory control, or maybe they were changing some displays. At any rate, they were too busy to be bothered to answer questions, give samples, etc.
If this shop is on your way to some other destination, by all means drop in for 5-10 minutes.  But certainly don't go out of your way to go there.  You could spend your time much more profitably in a church, the Cathedral, a market, or the Bosque de Cuahutemoc.

352937955.name: Quirky must-see museum
352937955.author: a TripAdvisor user
352937955.reviewBody: The Museo Del Dulce is an easy walk from the main square in Morelia and is surprisingly well put together for a relatively tiny museum. Women in period costumes recount the history of candy making in the city and there is a very well done video presentation with English subtitles that shows the larger history of candy making from pre-Columbian Meso America to present day. The tour includes an actual candy-making facility complete\nwith belt driven components used in the early days. The tour concludes with a candy making demonstration followed by delicious free samples of one variety of a pectin-based candy. The shop in front of the museum offers hundreds of varieties of candies and sweet liqueurs. The whole tour lasts about an hour and the cost is 30 pesos.

352384228.name: Worth the 20 peso tour
352384228.author: a TripAdvisor user
352384228.reviewBody: The dressed-up staff gave an excellent explanation of the history of candy-making in Morelia. The tour includes a large collection of photos of old Morelia, a short but interesting video, old machines in action and a hands on display of how to make the popular candy atole.  Finishing with a tasting of all their popular rom popes, definitely worth a stop! Candy is more expensive here so we bought what we wanted at the mercado del dulce.

349639518.name: City Visit
349639518.author: a TripAdvisor user
349639518.reviewBody: Found this "little gem" accidently! Very happy we found it. Very interesting & worth the visit. Delicious coffee & cake & the museum that is in the back of the restaurant is very informative.

324908289.name: Not really a museum...
324908289.author: a TripAdvisor user
324908289.reviewBody: Not really a museum, more like an extension of the candy store, prices are greatly inflated. You can buy similar candy elsewhere for a fraction of the price. It\'s a cute place, but I don\'t recommend buying anything here.

670310800.name: Nice, quiet alley
670310800.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310800.reviewBody: A nice little alley to get away from the hubbub.  A couple of restaurants, but we just walked down it and enjoyed the feeling.  A fountain or two along the way makes it even nicer.

614940455.name: Terrific for Romance
614940455.author: a TripAdvisor user
614940455.reviewBody: This is a great place if you are inclined to or participate in romance. It\'s a 100-meter or so alley that is nicely architected and designed. It has the famous collection of locks ("locking in" your everlasting relationship) at one end. It would be maybe the most romantic thing to do ever to have one of the estudiantinas serenade you as you walked with your one and only along this historic street.

576600378.name: Pretty pedestrian walkway livened
576600378.author: a TripAdvisor user
576600378.reviewBody: What a beautiful old pedestrian walkway behind the lively Mercado de San Lucas and several other restaurants. Upstairs is a unique modern space with half a dozen food stalls surrounding a casual bar. You can get one of the best burgers in Morelia. Or a German sausage sandwich. Or very good fish tacos. Etc. It\'s a comfortable space usually crowded. Or sit in the outdoor courtyard in the shadow of the aqueduct. There you have a few dining options including fairly good food at the largest restaurant or pizza from another, or simple burgers at another. One evening we were serenaded with an aria by a soprano from the music conservatory.

558668583.name: Corner of love
558668583.author: a TripAdvisor user
558668583.reviewBody: This is very close to the aqueduct. The walls and flowers make it a very special place! Check out the love locks.

501371000.name: Nice old streets <3
501371000.author: a TripAdvisor user
501371000.reviewBody: This is a small street were used to lived working people. The houses now are pretty well cared and it have several restaurants. \n\nBesides it is a small street now is complete a walking alley, with fountains and you can visit this place that invokes a long past era.

483732692.name: Cute
483732692.author: a TripAdvisor user
483732692.reviewBody: The Callejon de Romance provided a nice turnaround spot for our walk out from central Morelia.  It is cute, but don\'t expect to spend more than 5 or 10 minutes there.

469520187.name: Romantic Spot
469520187.author: a TripAdvisor user
469520187.reviewBody: This is a small romantic passageway which has several restaurants and cafes to suit any taste. There are poems written on the walls, which lighten up the mood.

457451519.name: Cute site for couples
457451519.author: a TripAdvisor user
457451519.reviewBody: Lovely street for couples to hide away. Really nice site with poems on the walls. Don\'t miss out. :-)

446631910.name: Do not expect much
446631910.author: a TripAdvisor user
446631910.reviewBody: A small alley, with not much to see. We were not impressed. It is nice only when you get to see newlywed in their marriage attire getting their photos taken.

442001463.name: Ancient lover\'s lane.
442001463.author: a TripAdvisor user
442001463.reviewBody: Located in what long ago used to be the outskirts of the city, this narrow street was used for flirting in the old style.

441630416.name: Nice walk
441630416.author: a TripAdvisor user
441630416.reviewBody: Really lovely place near fountain and aqueduct nice walk see lots of romance and keys !! This alley is nice place for couple !!

437520634.name: A place to fall in love
437520634.author: a TripAdvisor user
437520634.reviewBody: Really really really lovely! I went with two of my friends and we tought that place was perfect to go with our couple. Romance describes this place

434170693.name: Lovely! Especially for D\u00eda de Muertos!
434170693.author: a TripAdvisor user
434170693.reviewBody: For D\u00eda de Muertos, this alley is transformed into something spectacular.  The fountains and planters are covered in flowers and sparkly skulls--colored by school kids--hang above and blow in the breeze.  Go at a quiet time, early in the day, and sit and relax.  We sat while the baby played and it was relaxing, after a few busy days. Passersby were friendly and would chat for a moment. Beautiful spot!

412192910.name: Romantic indeed, if that\'s your thing.
412192910.author: a TripAdvisor user
412192910.reviewBody: After having a couple drinks and a nice pizza in a restaurant nearby a friend took us on walk to this cute alley where people have left their engraved names on the old walls and even the trees. Cute spot for engagement pictures as we saw some photoshoots going on.

409049249.name: Amazing place.
409049249.author: a TripAdvisor user
409049249.reviewBody: Quiet and marvelous. You just have to pass through. A little but incredible alley with good architecture and fine traditional dinning.

408057686.name: Lovely
408057686.author: a TripAdvisor user
408057686.reviewBody: I\'ve done beautiful walk all over it, it\'s really cute and nice for taking pictures (it\'s rather shorter) and really close to la Catedral and perfect if you are looking for a place to rest, and it wasn\'t crowded. \ud83d\udc95

408037956.name: Short street
408037956.author: a TripAdvisor user
408037956.reviewBody: Though interesting architecture with a very few bars, the street was just a street.  It is a cut through street to other more interesting sights.

393396678.name: Really cool
393396678.author: a TripAdvisor user
393396678.reviewBody: Really a cool and kind of hide place. There is some beauty stories about it. Cool to go. \nThere are a couple of restaurants around. And good places to drink something. It\'s cool to go during the day or night.

373724606.name: This is a place not to visit, but to be with your partner
373724606.author: a TripAdvisor user
373724606.reviewBody: Do you want to kiss with your partner but you dont want all that amount of eyes on you? you need some privacy or do you want to be with your partner alone or in a quiet place? This is the place you are looking for. Its quiet, there are no cars, motorcycles or bicycles passing by, only other couples kissing each other or chatting or having a nice time there.\n\nI wouldnt recommend to visit this place at night.

363081937.name: Lovely for a walk
363081937.author: a TripAdvisor user
363081937.reviewBody: Visited this place with my fiance and it was lovely and full of couples. It was like a walk through history. Loved the romantic feel of it.

360373004.name: Overrated
360373004.author: a TripAdvisor user
360373004.reviewBody: Not sure what the fuss is about.  The Callejon del Romance is charming and quaint.  It has classic colonial architecture, and when I was there the jacaranda trees were blooming.\nBut that\'s true of dozens of places in the historic center of Morelia.\nIf you\'re in the area, by all means take a stroll down the "Callejon" -- but don\'t go out of your way.

356910673.name: Charming street nearby square happening nightlife
356910673.author: a TripAdvisor user
356910673.reviewBody: One of the more picturesque streets in Morelia although there are many. Anyways, it\'s a 10 minute walk from the central square and the Cathedral and has it\'s own little nightlife close by, so it\'s worth a detour.

351667602.name: Such a lovely walk thru and great scenery for picture taking!
351667602.author: a TripAdvisor user
351667602.reviewBody: This is our 2nd visit and it was as beautiful and peaceful as it was 4 years ago!   Great walking area right near the Tarascas Fountain!  You often times find professional photographers there taking formal pictures and it\'s great to snap a photo yourself.  Lots of beautiful bouganvillias too!  If you happen to be in the area to see the Fountain, you might as well see this too......it\'s a great little detour!

346880222.name: Nice walk
346880222.author: a TripAdvisor user
346880222.reviewBody: A short walk near Tarascas fountain. It could be better if more clean and benches. However it is interesting and romantic.

342384281.name: Pretty Little Alleyway
342384281.author: a TripAdvisor user
342384281.reviewBody: Hmm, very nice and quaint, but I would have walked right by it!  Not a lot to see or do there!  Guess that it worth a look.

338000868.name: Beautiful corner hidden from the crouds
338000868.author: a TripAdvisor user
338000868.reviewBody: As soon as you see it when passing by you already fall in love with the picture and magic surrounding this place.\nJust a few steps from the alley you find another corner with restaurants and bars at open air that match perfectly this the environment.

335842834.name: Christmas Day visit ensured no tourists there!
335842834.author: a TripAdvisor user
335842834.reviewBody: we had a lovely experience getting there at around 4.30 pm and enjoyed clicking pictures as there was hardly anybody on this street.

327168450.name: Family oriented and relax time
327168450.author: a TripAdvisor user
327168450.reviewBody: This is a great place to seat and enjoy a cup of capuccino, relax and walk around, you can do whatever you want is beautiful place, colonial style. Love it!\n

325694647.name: nice walk
325694647.author: a TripAdvisor user
325694647.reviewBody: A nice placeto walk in the afternoon. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants. Veru close ti main plaza.

321930582.name: A place for lovers
321930582.author: a TripAdvisor user
321930582.reviewBody: It is not a hotel or a restaurant, although there is a lovely Italian restaurant on the callejon, it is a gorgeous little walk in the heart of Morelia--no traffic, no hassle, just beautiful and quiet and pleasant. You will likely see many lovers billing and cooing and maybe even a bride or two having her photo taken. Quite worth the visit.

297819684.name: Pretty and romantic
297819684.author: a TripAdvisor user
297819684.reviewBody: Very pretty and romantic. In a nice area too, near the aqueduct and fountain de Terazcas. Some lovely little features and gorgeous flowers. Shame people have started doing the signed padlock thing; I\'d urge people not to do this as it spoils the historical beauty of the Callejon. Otherwise, very charming.

297694861.name: Pretty nice callejon, but just that
297694861.author: a TripAdvisor user
297694861.reviewBody: This is a short, pretty callejon that probably has more \'reputation\' than actual value as a "site/sight to see."  Most of the real \'romance\' in Morelia takes place in the Bosque a few blocks away.

287358936.name: Quaint, Charming Side-street
287358936.author: a TripAdvisor user
287358936.reviewBody: This street is very reminiscent of the Alley of Kisses inn Guanajuato; it\'s a picture perfect side-street full of charm and old world personality.

250818540.name: Restored city houses
250818540.author: a TripAdvisor user
250818540.reviewBody: This is a restored living area near the aqueduct. The little alley holds small homes and now bars and night spots. Be sure to enjoy a great cup of tea or expresso coffee at Therai nearby on Calz. Fray San Miguel, Col. Centro. It\'s reasonably priced and very tranquil.

197728283.name: Great picture spot for couples
197728283.author: a TripAdvisor user
197728283.reviewBody: Loved this "callejon".  The beautiful bugambilia trees in full bloom and pretty fountains make for ideal picture spots.

196326355.name: Cute alleyway that is one more thing in this neat part of Morelia
196326355.author: a TripAdvisor user
196326355.reviewBody: If you walk down Avenida Madero towards the east you come to several great tourist sites in this part of the city. Two fountains (Villalongin and Tarascan), the end of the aqueduct, a rather large park with two museums, and a wonderful walkway that leads you to the Plaza Morelos (and his large statue) and the Guadaloupe church. But there is also this little alleyway or Callejon en Espanol. It\'s not very long and rather narrow and is lined with little homes and lots of flowers. Even if you walk as slowly as you can and back again it won\'t take you but a few minutes to walk the entire alleyway. Don\'t think of it as an alley behind houses and filled with garages. It\'s cute and perfectly fine for a very short stroll. And think romance!

195841059.name: It does bring out the romance!
195841059.author: a TripAdvisor user
195841059.reviewBody: We had fun walking down this charming calle; the cobblestones and bougainvileas. We especially enjoyed the restaurant La Fontana; the food and wine, but the piano music made it a memorable evening we won\'t forget. It does bring out the romance, even for a 60+ yrs couple.

165753425.name: Definitely Romantic
165753425.author: a TripAdvisor user
165753425.reviewBody: Near the Tarascan fountain, near the aqueduct, near villalongin and near the calzada. This little callejon is a place to visit if you like poetry. Read the poems that are on the walls as you walk through the callejon. Just be careful because there are some steps that are hard to see as the are not to tall but if you are distracted reading you can trip. The bugambilias fountains and the pink color of the cantera stone of the walls make this place uniquely intimate. There is a small cafe with a pianist playing making our visit to this callejon even more magical. This little fancy cafe has delicious snacks and beer, good place to recharge and refresh. Please visit the bathroom, you will be pleasantly surprised. The decoration is very tastefully done and the service is very good. Our friend played two songs for us in the piano. This was a breath taking experience!

155287923.name: It is said that it takes its name from Romance de mi Ciudad writte by Don Lucas Ortiz
155287923.author: a TripAdvisor user
155287923.reviewBody: I liked it all.  The "Callejon" small and narrow street is very close to the Tarascas Fountain and looks clean and renovated. It reminds me of those ancient European lanes.

143124846.name: Small pedestrian street with not much to see or do.
143124846.author: a TripAdvisor user
143124846.reviewBody: It is just a calm street to walk and enjoy the quietness  next to a busy environment. Not much to do, but nice stone houses and fountain.

133488215.name: Great romantic spot!!
133488215.author: a TripAdvisor user
133488215.reviewBody: It\'s a great spot to go with a couple definately not alone, great for pics, nice to sit back and relax, a few options for coffee, bars and restaurants are located within the "Callejon", on the downside, if you drive here leave your vehicle on the main street, during the day a ton of teenagers and after 10 pm not the safest place to be.

675395603.name: Lovely Respite from the Center
675395603.author: a TripAdvisor user
675395603.reviewBody: I happened upon this place, and heard a group of young student musicians providing an A-class concert. At one of the garden side eateries.  I especially enjoyed empanadas de rajas ar one of the Gardens eateries.  Look at menus before you sit down.

670310439.name: My favorite place in Morelia
670310439.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310439.reviewBody: Reminded me of a small square in Madrid or Paris.  A quiet spot in the busy hubbub of Morelia.  A nice fountain, some good restaurants and just fun people watching, all can be had here.

669656097.name: Quiet, serene
669656097.author: a TripAdvisor user
669656097.reviewBody: Off the main drag of the colonial historic center.  Nice sidewalk restaurants.  A nice change from the busy central plaza.  Green & clean.

639294931.name: El parque de las rosas, Morelia
639294931.author: a TripAdvisor user
639294931.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite parks in Morelia!  It was once shown in a "novela."  The park is outlined with rosebushes.  It is like a little plaza & around the outside of this park are little shops.

618971383.name: Lovely to walk
618971383.author: a TripAdvisor user
618971383.reviewBody: This place is small but has a particularly awesome charm, you can have a cigarette in one of their benches or grab a cup of coffe in one of the various cafes (they all are expensive and every weekend it\u2019s a mess of people), a few steps from the jard\u00edn de las todas you can find the centro hist\u00f3rico Cin\u00e9polis, the heart of the cinema festival of the city, and of course maybe bump into a less known national movie star from time to time.\n\nAny other weekend you can also find small acts or street performers or artists in this plaza and it\u2019s common to find students exiting from the conservatory across the street or locals from one of the churches.

618247551.name: Best Public Jardin in Morelia
618247551.author: a TripAdvisor user
618247551.reviewBody: We love Jardin de Los Rosas.  Enjoy a refreshing beverage at one of the restaurants.  Our favourite is Gueracita (best chai tea in Morelia).  The Jardin is a great place to relax and enjoy the vibe of the Centro while people watching.  Always some local musicians or singers to entertain you.  Signs explaining the significance of the two prominent statues in the park are available in Spanish and english as well as a map.

617407108.name: Great atmosphere to cool off, or chill out.
617407108.author: a TripAdvisor user
617407108.reviewBody: No matter how hot and dry you get discovering the Centro, this is a beautiful place that is always shady and cool.  Late morning coffee and breakfast is a must.  Late afternoon beers and snacks a relief.

609368573.name: Great cafe area with outside seating and good ambience
609368573.author: a TripAdvisor user
609368573.reviewBody: This is the place to go for an early evening drink before dinner. Enclosed area opposite the historic Music Institute with four cafes in a pretty garden area serving drinks and tapas. Happy hour pricing. Free live guitar performers later in evening. Very poplar with the locals. Close to the center of downtown. Not to be missed!

578696081.name: Relax and have a beer (or two) en el Jardin de las Rosas
578696081.author: a TripAdvisor user
578696081.reviewBody:
So, you are in the middle of your visit to Morelia, you have visited the "Conservatorio de las Rosas" (the music school) and maybe "Palacio Clavijero", you may be loaded with candies from the "Mercado de Dulces y Artesanias" and it's the middle of the afternoon, lunch is way past and dinner is still a couple of hours away, but you are thirsty, what to do?, relax my friend, sit down at any of the cafes on the side of this beautiful "Jardin" (I'll recommend Cafe de las Rosas), have a couple of beers, (most afternoons it's 2 x 1) and enjoy the scenery.
If you are an Instagram (or other social media) devotee, by all means take a selfie with the statue of Miguel de Cervantes Zaavedra (who wrote Don Quijote, or if you are into theater, you may know him as the writer of the book on which "Man of la Mancha" is based) on the west side of the Jardin or with "Tata" Vasco, (Google it) on the east side.
One or two hours later, your traveling "Zen" will be restored and you can continue exploring this wonderful colonial city.
I speak from personal experience, having done all of the above on April 27th of this year.

576591346.name: Early dinner at sidewalk cafe before free performance
576591346.author: a TripAdvisor user
576591346.reviewBody: A lively yet tranquil park lined with cheap sidewalk restaurants on one side. Happy hour is every evening; 2 for the price of 1 beer. Have an early dinner on Thursday before the 8:00pm free performance across the street at the Las Rosas music conservatory.

562949734.name: Nice to walk through.  OK, not great, for dining.
562949734.author: a TripAdvisor user
562949734.reviewBody: We have eaten a few meals at the Jardin, usually breakfast.  Ambience is nice, food and service so-so.  If getting a good, cost effective meal is your goal, many places in central Morelia are better options.

560536831.name: Great place for a meal
560536831.author: a TripAdvisor user
560536831.reviewBody: This park is beautiful. Located across from the institute of music, it has a street lined with little cafes. We had lunch there one day and it was so nice to be seated outside sipping a 2 for 1 cerveza and watching the comings and goings of the students across the street. we saw a wedding there one day too.

558666263.name: Pretty, but no roses
558666263.author: a TripAdvisor user
558666263.reviewBody: This is a nice little garden in the centro. I thought that I was going to see lots of roses, but I saw other flowers. The walk to get there is beautiful!

555706692.name: Great place for Brunch in Moreli
555706692.author: a TripAdvisor user
555706692.reviewBody: Jardin de las Rosas mophs between the morning and evening. In the morning, it\'s this laid back, tranquil place to have brunch and watch local artists setup their wares. The menu is typical Mexican breakfast cuisine, although you can also have crepe. The coffees and hot choclate are good. Their smoothies too. Great place for families. Towards the evening it converts to a college student artsie sortoff of place with 2 x 1s etc. Hard to find a table in both phases.

551874841.name: Go for a beer or art statues nearby, not a garden experience
551874841.author: a TripAdvisor user
551874841.reviewBody: At least this time of year, there are no particularly interesting vegetation aspects to this garden.  However, just up the hill half a block are some very interesting statues, and there are friendly outdoor / indoor cafes that offer 2 for 1 beers.  So it is worth the walk, just not for the garden itself.  Maybe Spring or Summer is different.

550989252.name: Excellent place to grab a bite and a beer
550989252.author: a TripAdvisor user
550989252.reviewBody: My family and I really loved this place, it has several restaurants to choose from. We ate at Viandante and it was delicious.

549192123.name: Good place for an afternoon cerveza
549192123.author: a TripAdvisor user
549192123.reviewBody: Nice place to people watch and have a drink in the afternoon. Many of the places are smoke free, which is a real plus. Go there!

544515701.name: Afternoon fun
544515701.author: a TripAdvisor user
544515701.reviewBody: Relax with a drink, and if you\'re lucky, Carlos or one of the many talented musician\'s in this area will show up and make your day.\n\nGreat vibe, scenery and local people.

529285537.name: Nice garden area with cafes.
529285537.author: a TripAdvisor user
529285537.reviewBody: Great area with a few restaurants to have breakfast, lunch or a afternoon coffee. \n\nOn Sunday there were displays of art in the park.  A lovely setting.

511538190.name: Nice place bit
511538190.author: a TripAdvisor user
511538190.reviewBody: The municipality forgot to cultivate roses!!\n\nSurroundings are interesting, including the music academy and temple.

501064232.name: The heart of the students neighborhood
501064232.author: a TripAdvisor user
501064232.reviewBody: It is a beautiful plaza to spend an evening, it had several restaurants and cafes for all styles, tastes and pockets. Morelia is a students city and this plaza is surrounded by the music school a high school and overall the old facilities of the Universidad Michoacana de San Nicol\u00e1s de Hidalgo.

500487254.name: Nice little park with cafe & bar
500487254.author: a TripAdvisor user
500487254.reviewBody: This place is in downtown Morelia. Off from  cathedral. Very nice quiet park with nice cafe and bar.  Little French feel, live music was nice.

499223971.name: Great selection of Cafe Bars
499223971.author: a TripAdvisor user
499223971.reviewBody:
Had the pleasure of lunch here on a Sunday afternoon. There's a good selection of places to eat and drink with plenty of shade if the sun is getting a bit much for you. 

As with most places in Morelia, the price of food and drink, compared to London, is really cheap. A little money goes a long way. 

Lots of musicians will be playing whilst you enjoy your cold drinks or fabulous tacos. 

You've also got a nice Cinepolis cinema just around the corner of you want some air conditioned comfort.

463347491.name: Have a drink on one of the many outdoor patios
463347491.author: a TripAdvisor user
463347491.reviewBody: It is only a block for two from the cathedral and a real nice change of pace from all the traffic.  A short block of bars with outdoor patios perfectly suited for a drink and rest. Just up the next street two doors down is a place Arte and Mezcal that has better snacks, five different mezcals and I think it is the owner/artist who speaks great English who did some creative murals on the walls going into the plaster.  They have live music here some nights, sometimes it was more for a younger university crowd, but I liked the mezcal and cheese.  Go to this area every day to get away from the crowds.

460250408.name: Best Coffee & Bar area in Morelia
460250408.author: a TripAdvisor user
460250408.reviewBody: This is a little gem of a place in downtown Morelia. A couple of blocks from the Cathedral.\nHere you can sit and drink while watching people strolling.\nIt is a break setting with plants and colonial architecture.

456231009.name: Evening diner at las Rosas
456231009.author: a TripAdvisor user
456231009.reviewBody: Lovely little square! \nVery nice atmosphere to have diner. \nLots of nice red flowers, not roses though as you would imagine there to be.

449654209.name: Plaza
449654209.author: a TripAdvisor user
449654209.reviewBody: This is a plaza where you can just admire the well design gardens, while enjoying the people passing by and maybe eating some of the classic Mexican snacks.

438808239.name: Lively place in the afternoon
438808239.author: a TripAdvisor user
438808239.reviewBody: This garden place has a French-feel to it, with outdoor cafes, live music, and history. Across from the Conservatorio de Las Rosas building (Conservatory of Music). There are students always practicing their music in this garden area, they also do impromptu spoken word poetry, or pantomime shows. It\'s also a nice place to drink \'hot red wine\' on a cold day by the cafes, you will be surprised how good it tastes.

408035501.name: Where were the roses?
408035501.author: a TripAdvisor user
408035501.reviewBody: Nice location bordered by numerous outdoor cafes.  The little garden didn\'t have any roses, but the church around the corner had many in full bloom

397677899.name: Nice for a drink
397677899.author: a TripAdvisor user
397677899.reviewBody: A garden near to Morelia Cathedral. There are many cafes and bars for a drink. Also two beautiful churches and a mercado are close.

390068267.name: A park
390068267.author: a TripAdvisor user
390068267.reviewBody: Not really a garden, it\'s a small park slash plaza where students meet and mingle. Many cafes around so a good place to grab a bite and a drink.

373726931.name: A place to chat or to drink a beer
373726931.author: a TripAdvisor user
373726931.reviewBody: There are a lot of fine bars and restaurants in here, there are some benches (almost never avaliable), you can see some hores, but nothing worse. In this place, almost all locals reunite to go anywhere else or to grab a bite or drink a beer in the nearby bars or restaurants. Its a nice place. The bad side of it is that is very noisy from time to time, there are a lot of cars parked and passing by, people around you normally smoke and you get to know a lot of beggars that pass from table to table asking for a few coins.\nI wouldnt recommend you to give them nothing, they clearly work as that and if you give them something, they will surelly return there. Please dont give them any money. Telling them that you dont have spare change will do.\nOther people cook brownies or other things like that, those are normal people trying to start a stablished business, if you are felling charitative, you can give them a coin.

361041506.name: An amusing waste of time.
361041506.author: a TripAdvisor user
361041506.reviewBody: This place is a small plaza in front of a church with a few rose bushes scattered about.  It was a nice, quiet place but largely empty.  Char, perhaps. Interest: zero

358582312.name: Nice smal Square
358582312.author: a TripAdvisor user
358582312.reviewBody: Very cute  small Square, with huge trees  giving such a nice shadow to sit  on one of the few benches. Lots of small caf\u00e9s around  with the beautiful "Conservatorio  de las Rosas" or "Santa Rosa de Lima\'s Church in front of it, and the "State Museum" by its side. Very crowded by couples and students on week- ends.

358177028.name: Happy hour
358177028.author: a TripAdvisor user
358177028.reviewBody: A friend of mine told me she had a favorite restaurant in the Jardin de las Rosas, for breakfast.  By the time I got there it was almost 4:00 PM so I decided to have a very late lunch. I ordered a flavored michelada to start with , and was shocked -- shocked, I say! -- when my waiter served me two micheladas.  I protested that I had only asked for one, and the waiter allowed as how it was two-for-one "happy hour".  Oh, my goodness!\nSo there was nothing for it but to sit and sip my drinks over a couple of hours.  In that time, I saw a young brother and sister pair playing in and around the bubbling fountain; strolling musicians; American tourists (perhaps Roads Scholars; they looked to be retirement age) speaking English; a young boy selling coconut candy; some young lovers; more strolling musicians; Mexican family groups and friends gathering for happy hour; and finally, a couple of vendors with buckets of toasted grasshoppers.\nGREAT time and place for people-watching, all under the bougainvillea and graceful trees.

356886904.name: Student crowd and cultural meeting point.
356886904.author: a TripAdvisor user
356886904.reviewBody: A charming square that hosts many concerts and other events in the heart of Morelia\'s nightlife with lots of bars, small restaurants and food until late, at least on weekends until well past midnight, The surroundings are also very busy with old-style and trendier new bars, but the square has its own appeal due to a strong student presence.

355348853.name: Lovely School
355348853.author: a TripAdvisor user
355348853.reviewBody: Walk into this beautiful school during the day and you are bound to hear students practicing.  As a former music student, I am envious of those who have the opportunity to study here!

351973247.name: Travelers
351973247.author: a TripAdvisor user
351973247.reviewBody: We went to the garden based on a review we read on trip advisor but it didn\'t seem at all like the review.   It was very quiet and we were virtually the only people there.  Maybe it was just the wrong day.

348336432.name: The centre of the Centro.
348336432.author: a TripAdvisor user
348336432.reviewBody: A hub of activity, a bit like a carnival, the garden has vendors and foods of all kinds. Fascinating and fun.

346397821.name: Beautiful and relaxing place to hang out
346397821.author: a TripAdvisor user
346397821.reviewBody: Nice shady jardin with selection of caffes serving 2 for 1 beers. When we were there very good tango duo were playing music, it was very nice.

345246278.name: A delightful small urban park
345246278.author: a TripAdvisor user
345246278.reviewBody: This lovely block long park has green space, flowers, statues and a fountain. Most of the time local artists and artisans are displaying their wares in the center walkway. Along one side are several sidewalk cafes. As you sit at the tables enjoying a meal or a drink, you can look across to the historic ex-convent housing the Conservatorio de las Rosas, an internationally recognized school of music. It is a popular spot for meeting friends for a meal or a coffee.

337998966.name: Ideal for a glass of wine while you enjoy the bohemian atmosphere
337998966.author: a TripAdvisor user
337998966.reviewBody: This Plaza is so beautiful that you have to stop by and enjoy it at least for a couple of hours. There\'s a line of restaurants and bars and on the sidewalk there is always an art demostration. So peaceful.

334447345.name: Great Place for Al Fresco Dining
334447345.author: a TripAdvisor user
334447345.reviewBody: Jardin de las Rosas is located just next to the church where it gets its name. The convent of the church has since been converted to a conservatory (music), so this garden, which is lined with restaurants is a great place to hang out and soak in the atmosphere of Morelia.

333102046.name: Nice quite spot for picnic
333102046.author: a TripAdvisor user
333102046.reviewBody: This is a great little park in the neighborhood of the aqueduct.  Good people watching with nice benches to rest or have a snack.

328724688.name: Bistro cafe style restaurants in a artistic park setting
328724688.author: a TripAdvisor user
328724688.reviewBody: I walked by this area everyday durning my 10 day visit to Morelia. It was always lively and many times there were artists and art vendors selling beautiful and interesting pieces of artwork and paintings. The food in the cafes was very good but many people were there just to meet friends and family to share a drink or coffee and just talk and is it. I enjoy flowers so the flower garden was beautiful for me and the trees were nice and give lots of shade to sit on nearby benches and people watch.

325765070.name: Great garden for walking around the historical center of Morelia!!
325765070.author: a TripAdvisor user
325765070.reviewBody: Great garden for walking around the historical center of Morelia!!\n\nNice for a stroll and nearby there are some nice restaurants for beers!

319689058.name: The best of Morelia in one place
319689058.author: a TripAdvisor user
319689058.reviewBody: Is a perfect place for know the culture,enjoy street performances, have a nice talk, meet new people

313272985.name: Beautiful well kept gardens!
313272985.author: a TripAdvisor user
313272985.reviewBody: Such a lovely and tranquil jardin. There are many little restaurants behind it and it seems to be a busy place at night for happy hour among the younger generation. It was relaxing even though it was very busy. Beautiful flowers and well kept gardens. Also, the entire area offers free wifi!

306658628.name: Must visit
306658628.author: a TripAdvisor user
306658628.reviewBody: We spent a lovely Sunday afternoon here, having a drink at one of the local restaurants, watching artists sketching a model and a festival from the church opposite.

287356777.name: Small Charming Park
287356777.author: a TripAdvisor user
287356777.reviewBody: Named after the music conservatory and not for the flower, this park is small but shady and quiet. It\'s a nice stop for a drink to give a break to your day.

273063649.name: Good place for a beer or a coffee also
273063649.author: a TripAdvisor user
273063649.reviewBody: Great place for dinner or just a coffee or beer. You will find a nice garden to stay, noisy but with fresh air at the open square. :)

251776744.name: Cafe area
251776744.author: a TripAdvisor user
251776744.reviewBody: A lovely place in which to have a drink and people watch. Near the artisans market. Lovely on a warm sunny day.

247844633.name: Great spot for food and drink.
247844633.author: a TripAdvisor user
247844633.reviewBody: Garden like area with several small restaurants.  It reminded me of European neighborhoods and was near the Museo del Estrado.

232599846.name: Sweet little outdoor spot
232599846.author: a TripAdvisor user
232599846.reviewBody: This has a charming feel with many cafes and a nice park. It\'s surrounded by historical, colonial buildings to view while you enjoy a  cervesa and nice meal.

228198671.name: Tranquil spot for a coffee
228198671.author: a TripAdvisor user
228198671.reviewBody: Beautiful little plaza with good cafes and young people rehearsing music or juggling acts... what a great city!

222411104.name: Fascinating History and Beautiful Site
222411104.author: a TripAdvisor user
222411104.reviewBody: There are no roses! The name comes form the young nuns who were sequestered there in earlier times. I really enjoyed the visit and the chance to learn more about the history of life in Morelia. I would have liked to have a bit more explanatory information posted.

205883819.name: Great coffee plus bohemian environment
205883819.author: a TripAdvisor user
205883819.reviewBody: One of my favorite places in the city. Yes, it is usually crowded on weekends because they have good deals on beer and other drinks, but try going there earlier for a cup of delicious coffee or to have lunch (Viandante restaurant has the best subs in the whole city). It\'s a nice place to meet with friends or even go on your own to read or write as you watch Morelia\'s artists passing by. A piece of advise, there are beggars all around downtown and they often go there to ask tourists for money, so just ignore them or tell them you have no change on you at the moment. They are harmless, but if you start giving your change away at the end you will realize you could have bought a couple of beers with that.

197727826.name: Crowded, smoke-filled, not much of a "garden"
197727826.author: a TripAdvisor user
197727826.reviewBody: Based on the recommendation of others, we visited the "Jardin" at night.  VERY DISAPOINTED!  It was crowded with people, filled with smoke (cigarette and "other"), and really not much of a garden.  More bars than coffee shops.  We walked through and decided to head back to the main square for a cup of coffee in a much nicer environment.

193248168.name: Lovely, lively setting - great coffee shops
193248168.author: a TripAdvisor user
193248168.reviewBody: Children played in the park, with the backdrop of beautiful historical buildings and a string of sidewalk coffee shops.   We enjoyed delicious mocha coffee while watching the world go by.

191174391.name: Very nice place
191174391.author: a TripAdvisor user
191174391.reviewBody: It is a very nice place to rest after sightseeing. Here you can enjoy outdoor seating and its cocktail.

190651224.name: Great place for a drink
190651224.author: a TripAdvisor user
190651224.reviewBody: Busy and full of university students this is a fun place for a drink over happy hour.  Our bar had two for one drinks (which we weren\'t expecting) so we ended up very happy indeed.

182505486.name: Little stretch of plaza with outdoor cafes
182505486.author: a TripAdvisor user
182505486.reviewBody: Small tree-festooned plaza with tiny outdoor cafes and sometimes open air art exhibits. Close to the cinema, downtown, many hotels, and the Centro Clavijero.

160308641.name: Wonderful Garden, Food and Art
160308641.author: a TripAdvisor user
160308641.reviewBody: Centrally located in the heart of Morelia, Jardin de las Rosas has it all! The enchanting gardens, sculptures and fountain are breathtaking, they have art shows on the weekend and a lovely variety of places to choose to eat and or drink. A wonderful was to spend an afternoon in Morelia!

159654058.name: Busy Weekends
159654058.author: a TripAdvisor user
159654058.reviewBody: Apart from the charming gardens, the great overhanging trees and the fountain, apart from the charming little tables for cold or hot drinks, you get the influx of some of them most innovative artists setting up their works in the main walkway. While other sidewalk sales abound, this one always has eye catching pieces. And then the musicians, the students, the families, the couples, all pass by just as you do to be engaged in the scene.

153743995.name: Wonderful area!!!!
153743995.author: a TripAdvisor user
153743995.reviewBody: There are lots of restaurants there but every Sunday there are artist there who display their works, and if you are interested you can take free art classes on that same day. There are 2 or 3 artist who teach while they display their works. So you can have coffee or lunch and enjoy the  local artisans works on display, or you can take classes. PERFECTO !!!!

150884054.name: Travel doesn\'t get much better than this
150884054.author: a TripAdvisor user
150884054.reviewBody: A beautiful square, with cafes along one edge. Fountains, trees bouganvillea, and statues. A great place to chill out and people watch.

148865251.name: Jardin de las Rosas in Morelia
148865251.author: a TripAdvisor user
148865251.reviewBody: A very pleasant spot, just a block from the main plaza, to sit and enjoy a beverage. If you\'re a sucker for arts and crafts, like I am, there are a couple of stores that carry lovely stuff from around the state of Michoacan.

146563505.name: Centro Oasis
146563505.author: a TripAdvisor user
146563505.reviewBody: The jardin is a block off the main street and is a well maintained park with several sidewalk cafes.  We visited during the day of the dead celebrations and the park was even nicer with all the decorations, art work and artists in attendance.  A relaxing place for lunch and a cerveza.

146519756.name: Nice little plaza with bars and restaurants
146519756.author: a TripAdvisor user
146519756.reviewBody: This is a cute little plaza right by the sweets and handicrafts market. It has several bars and restaurants to choose from - look out for the ones that offer 2 for 1 beer!

143125661.name: Our favorite spot to hang out
143125661.author: a TripAdvisor user
143125661.reviewBody: We love this wonderful plaza with fountain and cafes. A good place to relax and enjoy  the students of music  hanging out. The outdoor cafes have good simple Mexican food. You go there to enjoy a quiet time. The music conservatory across the street is worth a visit. It has a lovely garden and it is nice to hear the students playing.

140181645.name: Nothing exceptional.
140181645.author: a TripAdvisor user
140181645.reviewBody: No roses, but nicely kept small garden areas.  Pleasant place to hang out, mostly for the younger crowd.  Food here is undistinguished..

139069918.name: great place to go
139069918.author: a TripAdvisor user
139069918.reviewBody: great spot at night with lots of live music, good drink specials and a lively crowd most nights of the week. outdoor seating as well as indoor seating in inclement weather. Right next to amazing venues for concerts and cultural events.

133488033.name: A must for anyone visiting or living in Morelia!!
133488033.author: a TripAdvisor user
133488033.reviewBody: A perfect place to relax after a long day of walking around the city, great for pictures, socializing, $1 USD beer, great snacks, good coffee, live music (bohemia, trova, jazz, rock), free WiFi. safe at night, tons of parking, you can\'t beat it!!

133456556.name: Night time sitting spot
133456556.author: a TripAdvisor user
133456556.reviewBody: What a great place to sit and enjoy the company of friends.  2 for 1 drinks and wandering musicians.  You might even catch the performance of a belly dancer.  wonderful cafes offering salads and tortas.

131870928.name: Shade, outdoor tables, great restaurants...not to be missed.
131870928.author: a TripAdvisor user
131870928.reviewBody: I love this square, shaded as it is by huge leafy trees even during the hottest part of the day it is a comfortable and peaceful place to have a drink or something to eat and watch the world go by. If it is raining or chilly in the evening the square is still great to visit for the food and atmosphere indoors at one of the many restaurants.

131574502.name: great little place
131574502.author: a TripAdvisor user
131574502.reviewBody: having lunch outdoors and enjoying the weather, plus the architecure

131373711.name: Take A Break Here
131373711.author: a TripAdvisor user
131373711.reviewBody: When walking around Centro Historico in Morelia, you\'re bound to get tired. The Jardin de las Rosas is the perfect place to rest. there are outdoor cafes where you can order a cerveza or a coffee or you can sit on a park bench and admire the gardens and watch the people. When we were here, there was a strolling couple singing to the cafe patrons. A very nice touch!

130807268.name: Outdoor Drinks and Relaxation
130807268.author: a TripAdvisor user
130807268.reviewBody: It\'s only a few blocks from the Plaza de Armas and Cathedral and other sites in the centro hist\u00f3rico. Mostly young university age kids hang out there, but it is comfortable for all with its gardens and outdoor caf\u00e9s.

130193891.name: beautiful place to walk
130193891.author: a TripAdvisor user
130193891.reviewBody: I really liked walking in this area with the fountains, the surrounding architecture, and the eclectic crew of people there. Loved the gardens

129180970.name: Lovely resting place in quiet area
129180970.author: a TripAdvisor user
129180970.reviewBody: We found this Jardin while walking the city on a Sunday and loved the smaller jardin size and artsy atmoshere. A few of us had cappuchinos at one on the small cafes and enjoyed some local artists displaying their work. I bought a couple small pieces and enjoyed talking with the srtists. A very lovely place to mingle and spend some quiet time in a rather busy city.

127569660.name: Nice vibe
127569660.author: a TripAdvisor user
127569660.reviewBody: Young people, cafe dining and drinking, artisans, and flowers - what else can you ask for. A great place to hang out and have a sip or a bite.

127339707.name: Very pleasant plaza
127339707.author: a TripAdvisor user
127339707.reviewBody: Outdoor cafes and restaurants, very pleasant setting. Artists display paintings and other arts and crafts in the plaza, while estudiantiles play their music. Very relaxing.

126426726.name: Peaceful
126426726.author: a TripAdvisor user
126426726.reviewBody: And you can eat well in one of the 3 restaurants under the trees.

123181068.name: By far the best place in morelia to eat and drink
123181068.author: a TripAdvisor user
123181068.reviewBody: Jardin de las Rosas is a series of restaurants on a plaza that have indoors and outdoors sitting.  The food is outstanding and the ambiance is very nice.  They have 2x1 beers almost every evening.

670310309.name: Really a sales area more than a museum
670310309.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310309.reviewBody: Very few museum pieces here, but lots of top quality artisanal products from all over Michoacan.  If you want copper, straw baskets, Catrina statues, guitars, etc., this is the place.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

651903264.name: Most enjoyable browsing
651903264.author: a TripAdvisor user
651903264.reviewBody: The downstairs contains high quality items at very reasonable prices. My wife definitely plans to return to purchase something during our stay in Morelia.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

651205743.name: Interesting shopping
651205743.author: a TripAdvisor user
651205743.reviewBody: There is a small museum section upstairs but this is mostly a store and really great store it is. Great high quality products from all around the region on the ground floor. There are some small regional stores upstairs too mostly closed but they seemed to be lower quality than that shown downstairs. Had a marvellous time browsing downstairs and I will be going back

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

646152639.name: Artisanal Museum Gem
646152639.author: a TripAdvisor user
646152639.reviewBody: This amazing collection of artisanal work from Michoac\u00e1n is a true must see.  Overall the collection is delightful and illuminating in equal measure.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

636185069.name: Very disappointed by last buy
636185069.author: a TripAdvisor user
636185069.reviewBody: I love this crafts display in Morelia and came specially to visit it again. I bought a vase that turned out to be porous and spilled water. No one has answered my complaint so far. Management, please get in touch with me to sort this out.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

634223552.name: Must see if in Morelia
634223552.author: a TripAdvisor user
634223552.reviewBody:
A great combination of a museum of the ARTS AND CRAFTS OF THE SURROUNDING SMALL VILLAGES as well as special exhibits at times.  Organized in such a fashion that you understand the specialties of the surrounding towns - to top it off there are working artist from these towns in the original monk's quarters.

Last but not least - one of the better gift shops I have come across!

GO!

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

634208991.name: The Shop To Buy The Wonderful Handicrafts of Michoacan
634208991.author: a TripAdvisor user
634208991.reviewBody: When I am in Morelia, I always stop by this wonderful shop featuring the best handicrafts in Michoacan. All their items are of top quality, and I usually buy a rebozo in the hard-to-fine Patzcuaro style. There are also gorgeous jewelry, china, glassware, musical instruments, Michoacan ceramics and clothing to tempt you. In my opinion, you haven\u2019t seen Morelia if you don\u2019t spend some time in this amazing store.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

631449497.name: best artisans
631449497.author: a TripAdvisor user
631449497.reviewBody: This site has examples of the best artisans in the state of Michoac\u00e1n, most for sale at reasonable prices.  There are artists studios upstairs and a nice square in front with a fountain and benches.  During the day of the dead, there is a huge carpeta of flowers around the fountain.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

631414226.name: Crafts of the area
631414226.author: a TripAdvisor user
631414226.reviewBody: This was a good place to see all the crafts made in Patzcuaro. The building is lovely and historic.\n I enjoyed going thru all the different types of crafts and the areas that they are from.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

614928565.name: A Great Review of Local Crafts
614928565.author: a TripAdvisor user
614928565.reviewBody: This is a 6-7 room place that shows off all of the area\'s great artesianas. It\'s billed as a museum, but really, it\'s a big crafts store. Everything from huge copper pots to masks, straw figures, and the famous pi\u00f1as are available for display and purchase.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Michoacano de las Artesanias en Exconvento de San Francisco

address.streetAddress: Plaza de San Francisco Vasco de Quiroga y Valladolid

566387282.name: Aqu\u00ed naci\u00f3 el generalisimo
566387282.author: a TripAdvisor user
566387282.reviewBody: This old building were once a small hospital, Juana Pav\u00f3n the mother of Jos\u00e9 Mar\u00eda Morelos y Pav\u00f3n gave birth to his son in the entrance. Now it is dedicated to the memory of this great man. It has a Morelos robot!! For the historical nerds hearing one of the best speeches of Morelos from a figure of his height and outlook make us goosebumps.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

561733480.name: See both, but the Casa de Morelos is better!
561733480.author: a TripAdvisor user
561733480.reviewBody: Jos\u00e9 Maria Morelos, of course, is the city\u2019s namesake. Before this 1828 acknowledgement of his stature as a revolutionary hero, it was Valloladid. We went first to his birthplace, the Casa Natal de Morelos, a modest house in which his mother had only a single room. More impressive and informative was the Casa de Morelos, the more elegant house a couple of blocks away, that he inhabited in the years before the revolution. This museum was filled with information about Morelos himself and about Colonial Mexico and the Mexican Revolution. The artifacts were interesting, but the thorough explications are the real draw. Walking through and reading the placards was like getting a semester-worth of Mexican history in two hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

516871106.name: An education in the history of Mexican Independence
516871106.author: a TripAdvisor user
516871106.reviewBody: We happened up this museum by chance and decided to visit. Very moving portrayal of a pioneer of Mexican Independence in the early 19th century who was sacrificed (executed) for his noble ideology by the colonial Spanish authority of the day.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

500489325.name: Nice history!
500489325.author: a TripAdvisor user
500489325.reviewBody: I just worked in to this place. Wow they have robot Morelo\'s and show is very short but Mexican history!\n

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

480735850.name: Must See!
480735850.author: a TripAdvisor user
480735850.reviewBody: Loved the reenactment of Morelos\' most famous speeches regarding human basic rights and the place of his birth.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

459214823.name: Very nice and interesting.
459214823.author: a TripAdvisor user
459214823.reviewBody: It is well worth a visit,within walking distance of the main plaza, visit will take you about an hour.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

352386731.name: Enjoyable and important for city\'s history
352386731.author: a TripAdvisor user
352386731.reviewBody: I enjoyed the 1 hour stop we took to enjoy this house and museum. Helps understand more about the life of Morelos and why the city is dedicated to him ("Morelia" comes from "Morelos".)  The side patio is also beautiful. The short show of the Morelos robot was interesting although he hardly moved and the room was extremely stuffy.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

352382705.name: Good History lesson!
352382705.author: a TripAdvisor user
352382705.reviewBody: Morelos was one of the leaders in the Independence war, this house/museum show you his life with letters, maps, paintings, sculptures and signs to explain what and how happened. Most of these are in spanish. \nIt\'s a beautiful and relaxing house.\nMorelos appear in the 50 pesos bill.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

341792956.name: BEAUTIFUL HOUSE AND GARDEN,
341792956.author: a TripAdvisor user
341792956.reviewBody: The historic building is in the corner beside the church of San Agustin, the museum has all kind of antique objects and other stuff, some things are replicas and some are originals, the place is well organized and everithig is marked with signs,I wish I had been guided by a specialist, because it may seem boring just watching.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

287361132.name: Underwhelming
287361132.author: a TripAdvisor user
287361132.reviewBody: I hate to have to write this since the house is dedicated to a hero in Morelia\'s history, but the museum is small and not well lit. The documents are hard to interpret since they are not English friendly and there isn\'t anyone to help or translate. Not a must-see.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

267537980.name: Amazing
267537980.author: a TripAdvisor user
267537980.reviewBody: It was an awesome experience knowing a little bit more of our history. One of the best parts it was free. Morelos house is beautiful still with the traditional building. The best was when we saw Morelis Robot talking about his speech that he gave to the country during their times. Awesome experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

228199143.name: Fabulous architecture
228199143.author: a TripAdvisor user
228199143.reviewBody: The house where Morelos was born was at the time a hospital of sorts, and his mother went there as it was near her home.  It is yet another fabulous old stone construction, interesting enough in itself and filled with information about Morelos, one of Mexico\'s great leaders and national h\u00e9roes.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

202650418.name: Interesting
202650418.author: a TripAdvisor user
202650418.reviewBody: At this museum you get information about Jose Maria Morelos, one of Mexico\'s Independence Heroes and from whom Morelia takes its name.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

197728121.name: Very interesting if you like Mexican history and can read Spanish
197728121.author: a TripAdvisor user
197728121.reviewBody: My husband loves Mexican history and we\'re fluent in Spanish, so we really enjoyed our visit to the home where Morelos was born.  However, I was thinking that if we didn\'t read Spanish it would be quite boring.  Make sure you go to the garden in the back - beautiful with pretty views of the cathedral steeple.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

196237253.name: Nice old historical house
196237253.author: a TripAdvisor user
196237253.reviewBody: This house is where Morelos, the hero to the city that renamed itself Morelia (it had been Valladolid before independence). It\'s a nice old house and certainly was standing in the 1700s when Morelos was born. It does not require much time, especially if your Spanish is limited but we enjoyed the house very much. Its sort of located not far from the backside of the famous  Morelia cathedral. It also seemed that some parties were held there occasionally and one was going on in the courtyard part of the house when we walked past it another time. \nThere is another house (Casa de Morelos) which Morelos bought about a decade before the independence revolt started. If you are interested the house can take non-Spanish speakers much more time to go through since this house is larger than the birthplace house and because his life is written up in both Spanish and English. It especially details the time of Morelos during the independence struggle. Again, it\'s also a nice old house by itself but also focuses on this most important man. I believe there is a fee for this museum but it is free on Sundays which is when we happened to visit it.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

194158560.name: Interesting Info
194158560.author: a TripAdvisor user
194158560.reviewBody: Small museum, but must be seen with an interpreter since everything is in Spanish.  Enjoyed all the different paintings of Morelos and learning more about this famous leader for independence.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

193248418.name: A fine tribute to a founder of Mexico
193248418.author: a TripAdvisor user
193248418.reviewBody: A lovely building in the center of historical Morelia, adjacent to a lovely church.   There are many exhibits and original documents penned by Morelos.  A lovely garden extends from the house to the church.   The only knock is that there are few descriptions in English.   As with most sites, this museum is free.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

182235010.name: A rich history lesson about the city
182235010.author: a TripAdvisor user
182235010.reviewBody: One of the fathers of the Mexican independence, Morelos is the reason why this city is called "Morelia" the museum (former home) is quite interesting as it has a pretty good collection of articles from  the 1800\'s not many belonging to the national hero but interesting nevertheless. Stop by for a visit, we payed $35 pesos which is like USD$3.00 to get in.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

163583703.name: Superb
163583703.author: a TripAdvisor user
163583703.reviewBody: Reading the wall-mounted plaques - enlargements of Morelos\' writings is an astounding glimpse into the thoughts of heroes at the time. They fought not merely for Independence; on their list of values / aims were abolishing slavery and torture, economic equality, democratic elections, three independent chambers of government, etc. For this they were hauled before the Inquisition, condemned and executed by firing squat.

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

157295697.name: Quiet place in the city
157295697.author: a TripAdvisor user
157295697.reviewBody: Although the Casa Natal de Moreles was not open when we  came upon it, we were able to enjoy the out yard and the Hardin. Lovely oasis of quiet!

address.streetAddress: Calle La Corregidora No. 113 Centro Historico

639293837.name: Parque zool\u00f3gico, Morelia
639293837.author: a TripAdvisor user
639293837.reviewBody: This is a very interesting zoo.  It has a wide variety of wild animals.  It is a family friendly place, very enjoyable!

604957912.name: Abhorrent conditions for the poor animals! NOT FUN AT ALL!
604957912.author: a TripAdvisor user
604957912.reviewBody:
If you have any compassion in your heart, this place must be truly avoided! The animals suffer terribly and it is infinitely sad to witness that. 

The only polar bear in the horrible facility has been suffering for more than 25 years, confined in a grossly inadequate, outdated enclosure and locked away in a tiny off-exhibit area for the majority of each day. Finally she had a chance to move to a much more humane place, but the owner of the zoo abruptly broke the deal, obviously for greedy, selfish and inhumane reasons!

Is that the sort of place you want to support? Please consider that before you plan a "fun" day at the zoo...

600258528.name: Well kept gardens. The animals cages look rotted and old.
600258528.author: a TripAdvisor user
600258528.reviewBody: Ticket entrance is is fair. Since Morelia is still not very populous, you can walk around the zoo without feeling packed up or overcrowded. It has several food, beverages and snack stations. Most of the animals look comfortable but there are other that seem to be having a hard time in their small cages. The ride in the train is worthy as well as the entrance to the reptile area. Their lake and gardens offer a very beautiful and pleasant atmosphere.

559464967.name: Excellent Reptile Collection - But Several Large Lonely Animals
559464967.author: a TripAdvisor user
559464967.reviewBody: Regular price 25 pesos but we paid 50 each for access to zoo plus three special areas.   Better to pay the 25 and pay 10 peso entrance fee at each of 3 special areas.   The park area is large and many of the animal appeared to be in pleasant enclosures, with grass, with space to move, etc.   Other animals were alone (one of a kind, eg the white Rhino), or in enclosures with no green plants remaining.   But the zoo does have a fine collection - large mammals from around the world, a good collection of primates etc.   I would prefer if they had 1/4 as many species, each in cages 4 times as large...  Still, it is a good zoo in terms of the variety of animals and the numbers of some species.

539189825.name: A nice zoo, comparable to a typical large city zoo in the USA.
539189825.author: a TripAdvisor user
539189825.reviewBody: A zoo.  Has the usual animals and amenities, and you can get a riding tour on a vehicle.  A zoo is a great place to tune up one\'s Spanish because the local children are excited and talkative.  The zoo has a web site that publicizes various activities that are put on around the year.

483743622.name: Animales well cared for but place needs attention
483743622.author: a TripAdvisor user
483743622.reviewBody: We visit during the dry season and it showed. Everything looked like it does in the African savana before the rainy season, dusty and without much life. I imagine this zoo looks a lot better once it starts raining in Morelia. The animals though looked like they were all well cared for. Non of them looked like they were illed or not fed.

460423633.name: So sad
460423633.author: a TripAdvisor user
460423633.reviewBody: Most animals are in poor conditions, there is a huge Andes Condor and his cage is terribly small, some others animal are in the same poor conditions, the polar bear is green because the horrible conditions.

451820853.name: Good day
451820853.author: a TripAdvisor user
451820853.reviewBody: We spent the whole day here, the kids got to touch some of the baby animals. They took nice pictures and learn about them in the theater and also saw a lot of other animals... the enchanted cabin was very fun too. Your family can eat inside the zoo or you can also bring food from outside and save some money, or have more variety. The entrance fee is not too experience and you can choose if you want to include the special rides, such as the train (takes you around the pond and flamingos among other areas), the truck, (goes closer to more African style zoo area) and the house of snakes. You can buy this at entrance ar pay once you are inside. We have an excellent day here as family and i can recommend this place for  every family. Animals are nothing out of the extraordinary, but this place guarantees a good day with the family.

447476361.name: Fun
447476361.author: a TripAdvisor user
447476361.reviewBody: A big variety of animals and a lot to see. \nQuite clean and definitely a good relaxing day. \nGood after a night out or on a lazy day

649968229.name: THIS IS A MUST-SEE
649968229.author: a TripAdvisor user
649968229.reviewBody: The conservatory is a magical place. If you\'re there for the free Thursday 8pm performance, enter from the street and go to the right, up a few steps to the auditorium. But arrive early and enter from the street and go to the left that will take you to the tranquil and nicely landscaped interior garden courtyard. You\'ll be enchanted by the sounds of music.

631306184.name: Nourishment for all senses
631306184.author: a TripAdvisor user
631306184.reviewBody: Morelia has toooooo much to offer, but you CANNOT miss this place. Is not only that walking inside this astonishing 1595 building gets you back in history, but you will hear an opera singer rehearsing, a violin student practicing or a whole band performing, while you watch enthusiastic music students all over the place. The whole atmosphere is food for the soul.

614928990.name: Good Place to Have a Drink
614928990.author: a TripAdvisor user
614928990.reviewBody: There are no roses here, but there are a number of great places to sit outside an enjoy a beer. The gardens are frequented by many students, and it\'s a happy, lively place. This is a great spot for a couple of hours sitting and watching the world go by.

559465686.name: Mostly An Art School Today
559465686.author: a TripAdvisor user
559465686.reviewBody: Pleasant enough to walk through, with students coming and going.   This visual highlight is probably the garden captured in the photo.   One can walk through in about 10 minutes.

442006029.name: Old convent now transformed into a music institute
442006029.author: a TripAdvisor user
442006029.reviewBody: This convent built centuries ago is now a world class music conservatory where student from all over the world come to as evidenced by the many classical music concerts given throughout the year.  Lovely courtyard with a central fountain filled with rose plants all around.  A must see!

386123557.name: Art and music
386123557.author: a TripAdvisor user
386123557.reviewBody: Beautiful place where new music talent is being harvested. Lots of history in this place. Loved the central patio.

373772716.name: Beautiful and quiet place
373772716.author: a TripAdvisor user
373772716.reviewBody: This place is a music school, one with a National prize for doing it, only the best ones enter it, so as you enter you are going to hear beautiful and peaceful classic mussic as people are rehearsing. Its kind of mysterious and it has a very nice Architecture for the people who love it.\n\nIf you go there with a partner, you can chat, hold hands and its a very romantic and free to stay place.

361507922.name: Wonderful place, the first music school in whole AMERICA!
361507922.author: a TripAdvisor user
361507922.reviewBody: I studied music here when I was young and I always remember this place with joy. Must be seen while being in Morelia.

358130932.name: Quiet, restful and lovely
358130932.author: a TripAdvisor user
358130932.reviewBody: There are actually no roses here -- don\'t want you to be disappointed!  The gardens are named for the nearby Santa Rosa de Lima church.  \nThere is, however, classic colonial architecture, carefully-trimmed topiary, and you can hear the sounds of pianos and strings being practiced.  It\'s a very green and peaceful spot.

239692830.name: Morelia is the first school of music
239692830.author: a TripAdvisor user
239692830.reviewBody: As you walk the historic area you will find the buidling across from a beautiful park just 3 blocks northwest from the main square. The building will invite you to get in the lovely courtyard they have preserve in good shape, with mostly the same look that the Dominican nuns had back to 1743. Just sit there weekdays on a bench around the garden and enjoy the music from the classrooms for some minutes to figure what a peaceful place to built a school of music is this. From late 1940 to present day, this is the home school for the Boys choir in town. Don\u00b4t miss this in your trip.

196070495.name: History and lots of music
196070495.author: a TripAdvisor user
196070495.reviewBody: We wanted to see this very old music school and my wife also had another reason. The school that goes back to the 1700s is in a lovely part of town with other beautiful old buildings all around. This must have been a wonderful old convent once upon a time. We admired the flowering bushes and trees as well. We entered the Conservatorio and wandered around for a while and enjoyed the music being practiced behind many doors. There was a courtyard with a statue of a composer in action. We wound up at the school\'s library where my wife hoped to find sheet music for piano by the Mexican composer Ponce. We were shown a notebook filled with exactly what my wife was looking for and for pennies they would make photo copies of pieces she wanted. We finished our time there by examining some of the posters and notices of various concerts and performances that were coming up and paid special notice of the ones that week since we were only to be in Morelia for one week. it\'s a nice place to visit but especially if you are a music fan.\nLater on we visited the Casa de la Cultura and found more music and my wife found a free piano that they allowed her to play.

169667770.name: nice cultural place
169667770.author: a TripAdvisor user
169667770.reviewBody: The conservatorio de las rosas is beautiful in the summertime there are summer camps so if you walk around you can hear all the students playing an instrument and in time where there isn\'t vacations there are classes if you\'re lucky enough you might even get to see a concert.

165750775.name: Music, magic floats in the air
165750775.author: a TripAdvisor user
165750775.reviewBody: As soon as you walk into this magnificent building, you can delight your senses with the beauty of architecture and music. This is a must to visit, we went with a guide, who helped us notice details that I had not seen befor.

146783489.name: Beautiful Place to Study Music!
146783489.author: a TripAdvisor user
146783489.reviewBody: I have a niece that studied music here last summer, so I wanted to see it. Lovely gardens and  we just loved seeing all the young people hanging out playing instruments and chatting. Really nice park out in front for sipping cafe and people-watching.

144342913.name: Amazing building!
144342913.author: a TripAdvisor user
144342913.reviewBody: Another marvel of Morelia\'s colonial architecture! Well worth the visit, as well as all the rest of the buildings downtown.

134404211.name: Garden lacking roses
134404211.author: a TripAdvisor user
134404211.reviewBody: It is a good spot to hang out and have coffee but there weren\'t many roses to see. Many young couples kissing here.

133456731.name: Excellent Performance Venue
133456731.author: a TripAdvisor user
