133456731.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the marvelous and diverse free concerts I attended in this venerable Music Conservatory in Morelia.  I saw orchestra performances, a blues group and an incredible children\'s choir.  Quality performances at a comfortable and beautiful setting.

131871104.name: A beautiful spot, let the music draw you in.
131871104.author: a TripAdvisor user
131871104.reviewBody: We were heading to the Templo de las Rosas next door but as we passed the doorway to the Conservatory the sound of music drew us in. The passageway from the street opened into a lovely courtyard surrounded on all sides by deep cloisters. We found a bench and sat for a bit, listing to the music and drinking in the peace and tranquility.

131377547.name: Beauty and Music
131377547.author: a TripAdvisor user
131377547.reviewBody: The beauty of the Conservatorio de las Rosas is hidden inside it\'s walls. Walk though the front opening and through the front hall and you will find a lovely little garden with artwork, a fountain and a statue of Miguel Bernal Jimenez, a Mexican composer, organist, pedagogist and musicologist. The students were practicing piano, trumpet and vocals which wafted through the halls while we were there. Lovely experience.

121150767.name: Intresting history
121150767.author: a TripAdvisor user
121150767.reviewBody: A quick visit of its center garden and if you are luck that someone is playing music its a nice visit. Don\'t miss out in front of the Conservatorio the caffe-bar restaurants outside.

26208110.name: El Conservatorio de Las Rosas, Morelia, Michoacan, Mexico
26208110.author: a TripAdvisor user
26208110.reviewBody: I just came back from 2 weeks in Morelia attending spanish classes at Baden-Powell Institute and living with a family. During our stay we frequently sat by the Conservatorio de Las Rosas in the afternoon and listened to piano, violin, celllo, guitar and clarinet music wafting out of 250 year old practice rooms, while drinking coffee at one of the cafes in the Jardin de las Rosas.. But the note I found on your site by a former student was disheartening, if true. They do have a summer music program for extranjeros in July, which I was thinking of looking into for my violin and viola playing high school daughter. However, i have no first hand experience of the instruction or level of students at the conservatory. There are many music students in and around central Morelia. It would be shame if the Conservatorio is a front for something else, or living on past reputation; that is certainly NOT the opinion of many Morelianos and a couple violin students I talked to (in spanish) about it.  Also, the new director was quoted in the newspaper as saying the school needed to reflect the diversity of the population (maybe in reference to rich students from Mexico City?)  and new types of music and composing, while preserving the tradition of classical music.\n\nWhile there we attended a beautiful free concert of the sinfonia orquesta de Michoacan (state orchestra) with a wonderful opera singer in the Catedral de Morelia. The concert was full of young people and music students--way more that you would see at a classical music concert anywhere in the SF Bay Area and they were truly into the music. I hope your other reviewer had just had a bad experience.

472601.name: Bastion of Falsehood and Corruption
472601.author: a TripAdvisor user
472601.reviewBody:
Although the building itself is beautiful--perhaps the most beautiful music school in the world--the pretentiousness of Las Rosas cannot be underestimated.

As a former student, let me assure both tourists and scholars that the place is basically a front for mediocre, money-laundering bankers and equally mediocre musician-types trying to escape Mexico City´s smog or Cuba.

Sadly, the school that once housed the Morelia Boy´s Choir is now basically a rich-kid´s playpen, with poor academic standards and lame performance standards as well.

675389435.name: Majestic Ancient Tribute
675389435.author: a TripAdvisor user
675389435.reviewBody: I was lucky enough to discover this Native tribute on a Sunday, when surrounding roads are closed in order for bicyclists, skaters, skate boarders, and walkers to have at it!

670310234.name: It\'s just okay
670310234.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310234.reviewBody: I wouldn\'t go out of my way to see this, but if you\'re in the neighborhood, why not?  Apparently, this is a copy and the originals were stolen, although how anybody could steal something this big, I have no idea.

668893648.name: Local attractions
668893648.author: a TripAdvisor user
668893648.reviewBody: This is about an hours walk from the heart of the city. Another wonderful day spent walking around the city enjoying the culture.

649967315.name: Landmark in Morelia
649967315.author: a TripAdvisor user
649967315.reviewBody: This fountain is a landmark and has an interesting history that you can read about elsewhere. It\'s at an intersection where the aqueduct makes a turn. You can view the fountain from the beautifully landscaped Plaza/Jardin de Villalongin. Go across the street to the restaurants almost under the aqueduct, including those upstairs in the beautiful Don Lucas. From the fountain, walk to the Guadalupe Sanctuary the magical pedestrian walkway Clz.Antonio de San Miguel, which was built in the 1740s. Stop at the beautiful Origa Restaurant at the end across the street from the sanctuary for excellent coffee, pastries, or a full breakfast, lunch, or dinner

646472650.name: Nothing special
646472650.author: a TripAdvisor user
646472650.reviewBody: A nice fountain, surrounded by an acre or so of green grass and ornamental hedges but surrounded by roaring traffic.

639297502.name: Las Tarascas, Morelia
639297502.author: a TripAdvisor user
639297502.reviewBody: This is a very impressive fountain representing three Tarascan princesses!  It is close to the aqueduct, another must see while visiting Morelia!

636211442.name: A can\'t miss while in Morelia
636211442.author: a TripAdvisor user
636211442.reviewBody: Zipped by it twice on the tour bus, will definitely have to go back next trip to truly take great pictures with the Aqueduct in the background.

631415239.name: A beautiful fountain
631415239.author: a TripAdvisor user
631415239.reviewBody: It\'s a lovely fountain with an interesting history. Worth a trip to see it.\nDon\'t know what else to say...

618068627.name: Overrated
618068627.author: a TripAdvisor user
618068627.reviewBody: I frankly don\'t get why people make such a big deal about this statue. It is neither particularly historic nor particularly attractive. While I was looking at it, however, I met a Morelian native who had lived in the U.S.(Chicago) for many years, and was lonely for the English language. We had a lovely, long conversation, but far from this place.

614938410.name: The Most Famous in Town
614938410.author: a TripAdvisor user
614938410.reviewBody: Representing three indigenous women, it\'s not only lovely but it\'s a great place to view the aqueduct. There\'s a nice church (yes, another one) nearby and it\'s an interesting part of the city to explore- a bit distant from the center.

565947270.name: Famous Statute and Celebration Place in Morelia
565947270.author: a TripAdvisor user
565947270.reviewBody: This place is an icon in Morelia. It is the place where you will see families taking photos for weddings, graduation, special ocasions, and the all important Quinciaera Girl\'s 15th Birthday Celebration. It also is the meeting point when the Monarch\'s Futbol Team wins a big game or something big happens in Morelia. It also is located right next to the Aqueduct of Morelia and the beautiful fountain.

561983777.name: Worth a stop if you\'re passing by
561983777.author: a TripAdvisor user
561983777.reviewBody: For our return, when we reached the arches, we headed straight onto bustling Avenida Madero, past one of the city\u2019s better-known monuments \u2013 the fountain of three topless Tarascan women supporting a broad round roof. It was worth a second glance but wouldn\u2019t have merited a side trip.

558677531.name: Fantastic!!!
558677531.author: a TripAdvisor user
558677531.reviewBody: Gorgeous scenery and worth the visit!!! There\'s a lot of traffic and hard to find parking! \nBe careful because police ticket quickly haha... oops ;)

558666987.name: Next to the aqueduct
558666987.author: a TripAdvisor user
558666987.reviewBody: Sit close and admire the fountain. It\u2019s not a top destination but since it\u2019s so close to the aqueduct, it\u2019s a nice stop

551629047.name: A great piece of history - Women Rule!
551629047.author: a TripAdvisor user
551629047.reviewBody: Okay, all people can rule, but I love strong women depicted in art!  These three strong historic women are clearly holding up the agricultural progress they have wrought from their hard work. As a gardener, I love this fountain.  I needed my daughter to reflect on it.  I think I took 10 photos.  This is a great stop on an historic walking tour through Morelia.  The Aqueduct also crosses the same intersection, and the beautiful chapel of Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe is a few blocks down a gorgeous highly decorated cobblestone street.

539188788.name: A focal point with nice surroundings.
539188788.author: a TripAdvisor user
539188788.reviewBody: This beautiful fountain is a local landmark and reference point for Morelians.  It is near the aqueduct and the area has several bars, restaurants, and places to get a coffee or an ice cream.  On Sunday mornings you can rent a bike at the rental station just across the street and cycle the downtown loop with the locals.

484930284.name: You have to have this picture in your album!
484930284.author: a TripAdvisor user
484930284.reviewBody: The fountain is the icon of the city. Local people recall that the original fountain used to be colorful when it was placed there back to 1930\u00b4s. To present day, the fountain made of bronze is there from 1984 and is a good symbol of Morelia located in a famous corner of the city, where the main street ends to the east and the arches of the acqueduct turn around the park next, making all this such a great picture that everybody will say this is Morelia

484406239.name: Part of a great view
484406239.author: a TripAdvisor user
484406239.reviewBody: When you go to the Aqueduct you will see the fountation. All part of a great must see day of events.

468289391.name: An atractive Center Piece
468289391.author: a TripAdvisor user
468289391.reviewBody: Nice focal point within a majopr intersection.  Just off a nice little, well groomed park,  A nice visual as you walk on the wy to th Guadalope Sanctuary

465607881.name: Lovely fountain to stroll by and admire
465607881.author: a TripAdvisor user
465607881.reviewBody: We walked past this fountain several times while exploring the city. It\'s history is lovely and it is a nice spot to relax and take a break from all the walking you will do when in Morelia.

460256523.name: Lovely fountain
460256523.author: a TripAdvisor user
460256523.reviewBody: A small park, a nice fountain that represents the Purepecha women a beautiful place to walking by and spend some time just enjoying the place.

451821534.name: Fountain
451821534.author: a TripAdvisor user
451821534.reviewBody: Is a good place to visit, but don\'t plan a full day at it because if on a very traffic Avenue.  There are good stores and restaurants around so you can just plan a dinner and enjoy the view of the roundabout.

447475290.name: A fountain
447475290.author: a TripAdvisor user
447475290.reviewBody: It\'s a nice thing to check off the list of things to see in Morelia. \nHowever it doesn\'t require a lot of time and you will be done in 10 minutes. Put it in as a quick stop along your way through the city

442001118.name: Loverly fountain with history and culture
442001118.author: a TripAdvisor user
442001118.reviewBody: Lovely fountain of Tarrascan Indians holding up baskets of fruits and crops from the region next to the aqueduct.

441630037.name: Lovely sculpture !
441630037.author: a TripAdvisor user
441630037.reviewBody: The Fontaine  is meddle of busy street intersection you can see from the park across the road.  Park is next to aqueduct ,

439136591.name: Nice fountain
439136591.author: a TripAdvisor user
439136591.reviewBody: This fountain is situated between the town centre and the hotel were I was staying so I saw it often. It represents 3 purepecha women carying a plaat of food.\nYou can appreciate the purepechas by visiting Tzintzuntzan (the archeological site) which is not too far from Morelia on your way to Uruapan.

393395987.name: Beautiful
393395987.author: a TripAdvisor user
393395987.reviewBody: This place means the fertility and the beauty of this state. Each woman means one of the capitals michoacan have had during its existence. It\'s a beauty place around also

374882353.name: Tarascas are Morelia
374882353.author: a TripAdvisor user
374882353.reviewBody: The Tarascas Fountain are a great starting point to check out either the Aqueduct or Downtown. Downside is that the current sculpture is a "knock-off" as the original one is rumored to have been stolen and its sitting at a estate in Spain.

374120739.name: Historic statue
374120739.author: a TripAdvisor user
374120739.reviewBody: This fountain is a landmark that connects the Centro, with other parts of Morelia... Parks and Squares surround the area, where people watching is a weekend activity...

373755405.name: Morelia\'s downtown
373755405.author: a TripAdvisor user
373755405.reviewBody: At the villalongin Square, at one side of this fountain, is where lots of couples meet and lots of friends gather to go somewhere else, at sundays there is a Cycling event and races and the Madero Ave. in which this fountain is, closes from 8 to 1 pm its car circulation. Its a nice day to have a walk to meet Morelia\'s downtown and its where its everything

354373345.name: An all around great area to walk to.
354373345.author: a TripAdvisor user
354373345.reviewBody: The fountain is gorgeous and there is another one just across the road. We enjoyed sitting on one of the many benches in the area watching people and take in the historic aqua duct that runs past this area.  Afterwards we went across the road to one of the restaurants for something to drink and ice cream. We were able to hop on a local van bus and go back to our hotel. The fountain is in the centre of a busy road intersection and harder to enjoy than if it had been in in the park across the road. It was nice to see while driving past.

353455320.name: Beautiful at any time of day
353455320.author: a TripAdvisor user
353455320.reviewBody: My hotel was near the iconic Tarascas, so I saw it during the day, with bustling traffic.  I saw it at dusk, when it comes golden.  And I saw it at night, illuminated.  Graceful and beautiful in any light!  Travelers to Morelia should not miss this.

352389160.name: Well it\'s a fountain...
352389160.author: a TripAdvisor user
352389160.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful fountain representative of the city, if you go to Morelia this is a must. \nIt\'s not big or grand, but it represents the native people of the region.

346671768.name: Fountain replaced
346671768.author: a TripAdvisor user
346671768.reviewBody: This is a lovely fountain near the end of the aqueduct in Morelia. The original disappeared in the 1940s and this is a replica. Beautiful, nonetheless with indigenous maidens showing off their bounty.

335092145.name: Nice spot
335092145.author: a TripAdvisor user
335092145.reviewBody: Cosy square with a nice fountain. From here you can see "El Acueducto" and "the lovers road". Amazing walk from the "Plaza de Armas"

325764436.name: Icon of Morelia is a must see if you are visiting this wonderful colonial city!
325764436.author: a TripAdvisor user
325764436.reviewBody: Icon of Morelia is a must see if you are visiting this wonderful colonial city! Great stop close to the aqueducts ... a look into the history of the city!

318855923.name: THE TARASCAN FOUNTAIN
318855923.author: a TripAdvisor user
318855923.reviewBody: We passed the Tarascan Fountain a while back as we were leaving Morelia. A lovely sculpture of three naked women holding a basket of fruit.

318812839.name: Do this and aqueducts
318812839.author: a TripAdvisor user
318812839.reviewBody: You can kill 2 birds with 1 stone but visiting here and the aqueduct. It\'s a 15-20 minute walk from cathedral.

287358377.name: Pretty Fountain, Lots of Water
287358377.author: a TripAdvisor user
287358377.reviewBody: I wish I could say more here, but the fact that it\'s a pretty fountain and that it  has a lovely water effect pretty much sums it up.

284464116.name: Great Sculpture
284464116.author: a TripAdvisor user
284464116.reviewBody: Very nice Sculpture, the surroundings are also very nice, this is a must see in Morelia. The fountain around the sculpture gives a nice touch.

279364004.name: A guy just got killed right in front of my eyes at 3:30 PM
279364004.author: a TripAdvisor user
279364004.reviewBody: A guy just got killed right in front of my eyes at 3:30 PM. I was eating in a restaurant and saw how everything happened. This place is crazy.

259179741.name: Things You Gotta Know !!
259179741.author: a TripAdvisor user
259179741.reviewBody: Very interesting part of Morelia history.  It has replaced the fountain of flowers across the street.  There is a tremendous amount of history to be learned in Morelia. Also we felt totally safe at all times, safer than most 1.5 million population cities in estados unidos.

255878356.name: Walk around then sit and enjoy
255878356.author: a TripAdvisor user
255878356.reviewBody: It is a very nice fountain and nice area to sit if you don\'t get run over by cars getting to it. One very nice item about the fountain is that a portion of the aqueduct circles around one portion of it.

250820650.name: The ladies have a "story"
250820650.author: a TripAdvisor user
250820650.reviewBody: This fountain was once painted in bright colors which scandalized the public for "showing too much skin" so it was moved and the current one was placed without paint.

247845450.name: Beautiful fountain.
247845450.author: a TripAdvisor user
247845450.reviewBody: Visit for the historical importance.  It is within walking distance of the city center and taxis are available.

230647600.name: Just a fountain
230647600.author: a TripAdvisor user
230647600.reviewBody: Color me cynical, but this is just a fountain in a country full of them. It is not horrid but it is Just.A.Fountain.

228198293.name: Beautiful!
228198293.author: a TripAdvisor user
228198293.reviewBody: Pretty much the entire historical center of Morelia is incredibly beautiful and well balanced, and this fountain portraying Pur\u00e9pecha\'s womanhood is no exception.

226401099.name: An iconic symbol of a complicated history
226401099.author: a TripAdvisor user
226401099.reviewBody: The Purhepecha people (the indigenous name of these people) are one-quarter of the state\'s population. The original colorful versi\u00f3n was stolen by a former governor for his own property, reflecting the contradictions of our society, which is still a beautiful place to enjoy a sound and light show over the Cathedral every Saturday evening (for free) and the wonderfful park not far away along the Colonial Aqueduct and the nearby romantic walk along San Diego.

208443075.name: Pretty Fountain
208443075.author: a TripAdvisor user
208443075.reviewBody: This is a pretty fountain, located in a lovely area of town.  Not so much an attraction, really more of  landmark.  \n\nIts a nice stroll along Madero from the Cathedral.  Make sure to stop for an ice cream paleta at Michoacana--its the first time I have had avocado ice cream.

198113189.name: A must-see when you visit Morelia
198113189.author: a TripAdvisor user
198113189.reviewBody: This is a beautiful icon of the city that is located downtown, close to other tourist attractions. You can\'t miss taking a picture in front of this pink stone monument. After that, you can take a stroll around the area and maybe enjoy a cup of coffee in the several cute places located nearby.

195837069.name: This is one thing to see in this very cool part of town
195837069.author: a TripAdvisor user
195837069.reviewBody: The Tarascas Fountain is one of a group of things to see in this part of Morelia. On a traffic circle with cars driving around it is the statue of three Purepecha women (Tarascans to some of us) holding up a huge basket of fruit. The story goes that it disappeared some decades ago and had to be created again but I am not sure about the validity of the story. Next to it is the small park named Villalongin which is also a lovely statue and fountain. In addition to the two fountains you will also find the Callejon (alleyway) de Romance. It\'s a short narrow walk that is most attractive with homes on both sides and a church and lots of flowers. In addition to all  this the aqueduct that Morelia is famous for ends here after running for a few KMs. There is a large public park on one side of the aqueduct that has a couple of museums, lots of cafes and restaurants, schools, and a 500 meter walk way to another popular plaza with a huge statue of Morelos and the Guadaloupe church. \nIf you are in Morelia this area is a must and once there you can spend a couple of hours checking out what I have described and more if you stop for a bite or a drink. The fountain is just one of the several things to see in this part of town. To get to all this just walk east along Madero until you come to the Tarascas Fountain. It\'s maybe a walk of a full KM from the cathedral to the fountain (maybe a mile). Go if you are in Morelia. You won\'t be disappointed.

193296119.name: Beautiful Fountain near the Aqueduct
193296119.author: a TripAdvisor user
193296119.reviewBody: The fountain itself is wonderful, with three women on their knees, holding an immense bowl or platter of fruits above them.   In the middle of a well tended park, next to the aqueduct, this is a sight to see and a fine photo-op.

165752220.name: Strategic location worth taking your time and walk here
165752220.author: a TripAdvisor user
165752220.reviewBody: The tarascas fountain is one of the main landmarks of Morelia. It is also situated in a strategic place, right across the aqueduct, the calzada, the park and the callejon del romance.You can walk and make a great tour. There are many architectural styles that it is a pleasure just to take your time to enjoy the view. The tarascas hold a huge basket of all the fruits that the sate of Michoacan offers.

157295525.name: Symbol of the city
157295525.author: a TripAdvisor user
157295525.reviewBody: This large fountain is located very near the Aqueduct and near a park. The area is busy with people enjoying the park and the fountain which sits at a crossroad.

156998978.name: Beautiful meeting place!
156998978.author: a TripAdvisor user
156998978.reviewBody: Just a block away from my hostel, this beautiful fountain and the accompanying park are great spots to meet up with friends, read a book, walk the dog, etc. Such a peaceful, serene this!

155286150.name: The fountain is in the middle of a street easy to access only on Sundays when is closed to automobiles.
155286150.author: a TripAdvisor user
155286150.reviewBody: I like the Jacaranda trees blooming already and making a nice frame for the fountain. what I don\'t like is the fact that during working days it is a very busy place.

151967760.name: Quick photo as there is no place to park
151967760.author: a TripAdvisor user
151967760.reviewBody: A fountain in the middle of traffic, a nice pic must be snatched fast in order to avoid more traffic

151017428.name: Quiet amidst the hubbub
151017428.author: a TripAdvisor user
151017428.reviewBody: The fountain and the little park that surrounds it are an island of tranquility in the midst of the noise and busyness of the city. It is a lovely place to sit and watch people too.

147009633.name: charming
147009633.author: a TripAdvisor user
147009633.reviewBody: A charming little park with beautiful view of the aqueduct.\nBeautiful place to chill with a cup of coffee and a book.

140955351.name: Lovely oasis
140955351.author: a TripAdvisor user
140955351.reviewBody: A lovely little park with some manicured shrubs, benches, impressive monuments, and fountain, and the aqueduct in the background. Makes a perfect rest stop, and photo op.

131871319.name: You can\'t miss it when you visit the aqueduct!
131871319.author: a TripAdvisor user
131871319.reviewBody: This interesting fountain is part of the scenery when one visits the aqueduct. Located in the boulevard that divides one of the streets around the aqueduct the fountain is certainly unique, not the standard tiered fountain found so often in parks and squares.

130873619.name: Tarascas Fountain
130873619.author: a TripAdvisor user
130873619.reviewBody: It is a good starting spot for walking along a stoned street, free of traffic, to reach a beautiful church at the end.

127507045.name: beautiful
127507045.author: a TripAdvisor user
127507045.reviewBody: just the time and patience that was put to make such a masterpiece like this fountain astonishes me

126426743.name: Naked women!!!
126426743.author: a TripAdvisor user
126426743.reviewBody: It\'s not only the statues. The whole area is agreable because there are well kept gardens around.

123740957.name: Beautiful.
123740957.author: a TripAdvisor user
123740957.reviewBody: The Tarascas Fountain is really pretty and leads to the walk down the romantic alley.  Certainly don\'t miss this when visiting Morelia.

122744640.name: Just a fountain in the middle of the road
122744640.author: a TripAdvisor user
122744640.reviewBody: A fountain that celebrates the indigenous tarasco women. Too bad it is located in the middle of a busy road.

122739974.name: anticlimax.
122739974.author: a TripAdvisor user
122739974.reviewBody: Maybe of historical value, but unimpressive and unaesthetic.\n

122205997.name: Lovely fountain
122205997.author: a TripAdvisor user
122205997.reviewBody: This entire park area was decorated beautifully for Christmas.  The fountain is quite lovely and has an interesting legand that goes with it.

121150837.name: Tarascas fountain
121150837.author: a TripAdvisor user
121150837.reviewBody: I imagine it was bigger but they are nice. The problem is the traffic surrounding it.

116173977.name: Well, Its a nice fountain
116173977.author: a TripAdvisor user
116173977.reviewBody: Something to do with everyone sharing the fruits of the country, symbolized by three women carrying baskets of fruit.

636210598.name: More than meets the eye.
636210598.author: a TripAdvisor user
636210598.reviewBody: Just walking along killing time and we come across this church, previously a convent.  There was a sign outside in English and Spanish.  It says that the church is attached to a school which the purpose was to educate poor or orphaned Spanish girls and widows.  For some reason, the way it was done then, the nuns were hidden at the back of the church behind bars.  Really interesting to see the set-up. Right across the street from a small park/garden. One of the many gems Morelia has to offer.Follow me for more reviews.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

567917139.name: Morelia church
567917139.author: a TripAdvisor user
567917139.reviewBody: Charming old church in colonial city of Morelia.  Build of pink sandstone typical of most colonial churches and old 16-17 century buildings in Morelia.  Lovely tree-shaded park across the street, great for lunch or a drink.  Fun to watch locals meet and greet there.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

480012796.name: Beautiful Small Church
480012796.author: a TripAdvisor user
480012796.reviewBody: Although incomparable to the Sanctuary of Guadalupe, this is an unusually pretty church that is worth a pop in with the carved wood painted in gold leaf and the carved faces. Very pretty.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

457105427.name: Gorgeous
457105427.author: a TripAdvisor user
457105427.reviewBody: We enjoy touring the ornate churches in Mexico. Beautiful expression of the love for God by the people

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

451762301.name: What a surprise.
451762301.author: a TripAdvisor user
451762301.reviewBody: Not far from main square, very nice, a little different the way is laid out, well worth a visit. ...

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

442002196.name: Wonderful real gold covered altar
442002196.author: a TripAdvisor user
442002196.reviewBody: This centuries old church is a don\'t miss it.  Beautiful altar covered in gold.  Lovely old church as well located within a 3 blocks of the main central cathedral plaza.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

364893171.name: Beautiful baroque church
364893171.author: a TripAdvisor user
364893171.reviewBody: We were on a walking tour of the Centro Historico, and had a very knowledgable local guide.  He took us into the Santa Rosa church and pointed out the grille in the back.  He told us the nuns needed to stay behind the grille to hear Mass, as they were not allowed to be seen in public.  We also noted the little side chapels, also covered by grilles, so the nuns could pass to and from the convent to the church.  I was taking photographs of the side chapels, and a security came and reprimanded me.  There were no signs saying that photographs were not allowed, so I\'m not sure if the guard was just exercising some authority for kicks.\nThere is breathtaking woodcarving throughout the church, much of it covered in gold leaf.  I was especially impressed with carvings of cherubs, which resemble ship\'s figureheads.\nIt doesn\'t take very long to visit this church, but it\'s worthwhile.  If you\'re in the area of Jardin de las Rosas, by all means take a few minutes to look at this lovely example of baroque architecture.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

353951693.name: Spectatular Church
353951693.author: a TripAdvisor user
353951693.reviewBody: A must to visit, the workmanship within this beautiful church is beyond expectations.  Take your time to enjoy the wonderful experience.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

352495139.name: Beautiful beyond expectation.
352495139.author: a TripAdvisor user
352495139.reviewBody: We were there for 4 days prior to the Pope arriving. We didn\'t think we would be able to get into the churches as security was already over the top. We did manage to see everything we wanted to. It was a very friendly city.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

349640531.name: City Visit
349640531.author: a TripAdvisor user
349640531.reviewBody: Very Beautiful! It is a Must see while visiting Morelia. This is where the Pope said mass last week. Take time to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

347661158.name: The churce representing Morelia
347661158.author: a TripAdvisor user
347661158.reviewBody: This church is usually shown in the page explaining the Morelia.\nThe facade of the building varying depending on where you see.\nIts interior is also magnificent with crystal chandeliers.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

264358722.name: Splendid Baroque Altarpiece
264358722.author: a TripAdvisor user
264358722.reviewBody: The Temple of Las Rosas was part of the Sta Catalina Convent (1595AC)  and is one of the only two golden baroque altarpieces left in the city. Very interesting to note is that you enter the church by the side, because at the back were the chorus for the nuns. Just in front, there a lovely plaza with picturesque restaurants and cafes!

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

129182389.name: What a beautiful church
129182389.author: a TripAdvisor user
129182389.reviewBody: We spent some time in this lovely and ornate church with incredible art work in the rear gallery area. I recommend this church because it\'s smaller and seems different from the dozens of others we\'ve seen in Mexico over the years. Also, it\'s across from the Jardin de Roses which is a beautiful, restful place for a cappuchino and some people watching.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Rosa de Lima

675389625.name: Rich and Mesmerizing
675389625.author: a TripAdvisor user
675389625.reviewBody: As a history buff, I regaled in the onslaught of history and culture of Michoac\u00e1n, when I perused these hallowed halls

560531010.name: How to put an historic old building to good use
560531010.author: a TripAdvisor user
560531010.reviewBody: You take a beautiful historic old building and put in some nice art and offer painting and dance. One thing I always admire about Mexico is how they utilize the old buildings and make them work in a modern setting. \nthere may not be a huge amount of art shown here but they have some awesome "steam punk" statues made of metal parts and an amazing woodcut in one of the hallways. The front room has a nice temporary exhibit of paintings. A worthwhile visit while you are exploring the area. There are so many museums in Morelia and they are all worth visiting.

559465392.name: Massive Architecture - Limited Accessible Art
559465392.author: a TripAdvisor user
559465392.reviewBody: We thought there might be more art here - but much appears to be used as an art school.   We did like the scrap metal sculptures of Don Quixote and Pancho, and appreciate some architectural elements like the massive round windows: impressive masonry.

485632165.name: Great Architecture!
485632165.author: a TripAdvisor user
485632165.reviewBody: We had the privilege of visiting this sight with a local who gave us a great tour and explained to us the architecture. This is truly a must if you visit Morelia.

478395786.name: Amazing construction in downtown
478395786.author: a TripAdvisor user
478395786.reviewBody: Amazing place to walk and admire, next to a church and with its external small plaza where you can buy an ice cream or a snack from walk-by sellers.\nAll the year this place offers cultural workshops for the citizens of Morelia. There are some tourist tours of legends about the emblematic constructions of downtown Morelia, one of the main attractions are the hidden underground passages that connects some of this building, sadly they are not open to the public and it all stays in the narrative of the theatrical tours.

464638847.name: Excellent place to visit with historical building
464638847.author: a TripAdvisor user
464638847.reviewBody: One of several locations that we toured.  Interesting and well preserved architectural elements and was in good location

460425372.name: Amazing building
460425372.author: a TripAdvisor user
460425372.reviewBody: This is a historical building arranged as museum. It had the taste of colonial days and the awesome of modern art collections. It\'s always a pleasure to get in there even just for a walk.

442001767.name: Old Jesuit monastery now cultural center
442001767.author: a TripAdvisor user
442001767.reviewBody: Centuries old Jesuit monastery transformed into a cultural center.  Don\'t miss the sun dial on the outside wall: it still works!

378771800.name: One of the cultural sources in Morelia
378771800.author: a TripAdvisor user
378771800.reviewBody: This is the place where lots of cultural activies are held and where you can take some "culture" classes like dancing, writing, painting, and others.\nIt is a very antique place with a beatiful architecture. Its a nice place, but there\'s nothing like tourist information for visitors.

360383692.name: A serendipitous find
360383692.author: a TripAdvisor user
360383692.reviewBody:
I stumbled across this, and was so glad I did!  I have a friend named Carmen, so I meandered over to the Virgen del Carmen church to look around and take photos. 
At some point I became aware that the former convent, connected to the church, is the Casa de Cultura.  To begin with, there were lovely sculptures of Don Quixote and Sancho Panza in the outer courtyard.  I wandered around the colonial courtyard and discovered a wonderful bookstore.  The books they offer have to do with art, indigenous cultures (especially Perebecha), and Morelian and general Mexican history.
I wandered a little further, and sat on a bench to eat a snack. As I rested, I watched some theater students practicing a fistfight scene.  
There was a marvelous juried photography exhibit in one chamber.  A little later, I saw a curator begin to move that exhibit to another salon.  It was interesting just to watch that process take place.
I walked up the grand staircase, and as I did so I could hear captivating guitar music. One of the professors, a French man, was rehearsing some Indian music that he had been exploring.  He stopped playing long enough to explain his study to me.
I made my way down several hallways, admiring the former cells with their beautiful wooden doors.  Almost every cell has become a studio or rehearsal area.
At one point, a custodian asked me if I'd like to enter the cupola.  She unlocked it to show me around.  The cupola itself is very spare, with very little decoration, but the views were terrific.
When you visit, who knows what you'll see?  Every day at the Casa de Cultura is different, as the art and performances are always changing.  But do go, for a few minutes or a couple of hours.  It'll be worth your while.

334274233.name: Outstanding building with many artistic and artesian activities
334274233.author: a TripAdvisor user
334274233.reviewBody: This is a large and superbly built building with a large courtyard facing a portico and a second floor built in pink rocks. The architecture is beautiful and well preserved. At different times there are many cultural activities, painting shows and a great selection of local folk art.

330515913.name: misleading travel guides
330515913.author: a TripAdvisor user
330515913.reviewBody: Travel guides suggested that this would be a good place for a tourist to go to see various artisans and cultural exhibits.  It is a lovely building, virtually empty when we arrived, which is used for many types of classes in art and music, but does not have anything to offer a tourist who wanders in.

264743724.name: good place to shop
264743724.author: a TripAdvisor user
264743724.reviewBody: Many of the artists studios are not open all the time but the gift shop is first rate.  This is operated by the local government.  Artists who have studios or sales space are juried in so the quality of the work is high.

259178653.name: Visit real Mexico...forget Cabo !
259178653.author: a TripAdvisor user
259178653.reviewBody: Morelia and Michoacan are very important to Mexico.   I think everyone that visits Mexico should visit Morelia and learn how much culture Mexicans have developed.

228199548.name: Palacio Clavijero - Perfect Proportion and Design
228199548.author: a TripAdvisor user
228199548.reviewBody: Oboy, what can I say?  We spent several hours just soaking up the beauty and balance of this stone palace that houses the Casa de Cultura in Morelia.  You can feel the energy of the Spanish and indigenous craftsmen who carved this palace from stone.  There is a perfection to its proportion and design seldom seen anywhere in the world.  So beautiful.

196299301.name: a large facility all devoted to the arts
196299301.author: a TripAdvisor user
196299301.reviewBody: After reading previous reviews I felt that some posters confused the Casa de la Cultura with the Casa de las Artesanias (museum and shops) which is next to the San Francisco church. The Casa de la Cultura is about a ten or 15 minute walk from the main plaza and cathedral and you need to enter from almost the backside of the Casa de Cultura. It was a huge church and convent which is now a facility completely devoted to the arts. it\'s not too far from the Conservatorio de las Rosas which is the very famous music school so there is lots of culture happening in that part of Morelia. \nWhen you first enter you will see a huge open courtyard that\'s in front of you and a cafe to your immediate right. Walk all the way across the courtyard to a right hand side entrance to the real places where there are offices, rooms for music practices and lessons, and more rooms for concerts. We attended one concert in the evening when we were there which was a guitar player from Colombia. My wife asked about practicing the piano if a piano room was available and she was given permission to do so. While there we heard lots of music and saw some dancing in two different rooms.

190166372.name: Galleries
190166372.author: a TripAdvisor user
190166372.reviewBody: four galleries...three particularly interesting to me. A very good Surrealist exhibition, but not my cup of tea.

157120061.name: A must for those traveling around Michoacan
157120061.author: a TripAdvisor user
157120061.reviewBody: It has a wonderful display of the work of excellent artisans around the state and tells you what town they are from

154442336.name: Fabulous and pricey
154442336.author: a TripAdvisor user
154442336.reviewBody: I love this place. It is like a museum that holds a collection of the best of the best Michoac\u00e1n has to offer in the way of artesanias. But do not expect to get a bargain. Pay what they ask and take home the real thing. Or do like I do, and just look and enjoy.

153744191.name: Wonderful place to learn.
153744191.author: a TripAdvisor user
153744191.reviewBody: At the Casa de Cultura you can learn to dance, play guitar, play the piano, paint, draw, or learn several other instruments. My girlfriend is currently taking drawing classes with Maestro - Prado Velazquez.\nShe is having a wonderful time and I am so amazed and impressed with the multitude of children and adults who come there to learn and improve on their talents.

145683087.name: wonderful display of native crafts
145683087.author: a TripAdvisor user
145683087.reviewBody: the display of native crafts during th fesitval week wa amazing..........our only wish was that we had gone right when it opened as so much had already been sold.

142783505.name: Worth the visit.
142783505.author: a TripAdvisor user
142783505.reviewBody:
An amazing display of the works of artisans from the region, including the unique handmade ceramic pineapples of many different designs and colours.
The clay is extracted by hand near the villages of San José de Gracia and Patamban, the only places in the world where these pineapples are made.  We loved so many of them - but could only bring home one in our luggage!
Upstairs are many shops with items fro sale, including glassware, jewellry, guitars, etc.

139070240.name: a real showcase of art and artisans
139070240.author: a TripAdvisor user
139070240.reviewBody: this place is endless, every corner you turn has wonderful surprises in store. There is so much to look at from some of the most talented artists and artisans in the country. Upstairs are shops also that you can purchase items from all the surrounding towns that specialize in their own arts such as pottery, weaving, Catrina dolls....a MUST see!

123734893.name: Give real insight to this area of Mexico
123734893.author: a TripAdvisor user
123734893.reviewBody: Well done and informative displays. Spend three or four hours there and you will gain a real understanding of the area and it\'s history.

565922913.name: Wonderful building
565922913.author: a TripAdvisor user
565922913.reviewBody: It is a wonderful building but had some lack of maintenance, if you don\'t care you could have a wonderful experience on the exhibition.

address.streetAddress: Av. Ventura Puente S/N Centro de Convenciones Morelia

565951877.name: Park Located by Two of the Most Famous Attractions in Morelia!
565951877.author: a TripAdvisor user
565951877.reviewBody: This is the park where you have to go when you are in Morelia. It is a central area that combines several must see attarctions in Morelia. The park has a beautiful fountain and flowers. The manicured trees and bushes add a feeling of being in a mideveil era garden. Enjoy the shade while getting your shoes shined by one of the many vendors. They also give you the best history lesson and information with a smile! A place anyone in the family will enjoy and you can also take a nap on the lawn during siesta! Close ot central and numerous places to eat. Also close to the HUGE park in downtown.

483328515.name: Elegant and Abundant
483328515.author: a TripAdvisor user
483328515.reviewBody:
Jardín de Villalongín is a stylish garden plaza, named for a brave man, but honors the sophistication and excellence of women. Formerly the site of a women’s prison, this graceful garden and adjacent traffic median are now adorned with fountains of feminine figures symbolizing Morelia’s elegance and abundance.

The garden is named for Don Manuel Villalongín, an insurgent who fought with Hidalgo and Morelos in the Mexican War of Independence. The colonial Spaniards referred to this location as Plazuela de Las Ánimas, where they had adapted a chapel into a women’s prison. When the royalist army took Don Manuel’s wife hostage and imprisoned her here, he boldly rode in on horseback and rescued her.

Aptly situated in the center of Jardín de Villalongín is a fashionable fountain of Flora, the Roman goddess of flowers and springtime. Before being moved here in 1889, the large elegant water feature spent a century in Plaza de Armas, making it one of the city’s oldest.

A mere 50 meters (165 feet) southeast of Flora, on a nearby traffic median is another exquisite feminine fountain, the Fuente Las Tarascas. This source includes three topless Tarascan women kneeling in long traditional pleated skirts, and holding above their heads an enormous platter of bountiful Michoacán produce.

On a pretty spring day, I sat on an ornate wrought iron park bench in the shade of a manicured Indian Laurel tree, and admired the lovely garden of Manuel Villalongín. Like the city of Morelia, the feminine fountains of Flora and Las Tarascas overflowed with elegance and abundance.

465610610.name: A nice place to rest
465610610.author: a TripAdvisor user
465610610.reviewBody: This park is right at the beginning of the aqueduct. It is across the street from the Callejon de Romance. There is a lot of traffic in the area but I still found it to be a pretty place to take a break while walking around the city.

373764187.name: Pretty place where people gather and meet
373764187.author: a TripAdvisor user
373764187.reviewBody: Around this place is a lot of afternoon life and nightlife, specially if you are visiting Morelia. This place is exactly at one side of the Fountain of Tarascas and about 2.5 miles away from the Chatedral, this is where the Aqueduct starts and where lots of locals meet and gather to go somewhere else.

353457771.name: An excellent place to people-watch
353457771.author: a TripAdvisor user
353457771.reviewBody: Like most people, I suppose, I stumbled upon this park on my way to see Tarascas Fountain and the Acquaduct.  Everything about this park is charming and beautiful -- the flowers, the fountain, even the benches and municipal garbage cans!  I saw this park at various times of day -- full daylight, dusk, and nighttime.  It always seemed to bustling with young families, students, tourists, and shoeshine stands.  There are several cafes and bars nearby; the Callejon del Romance is only steps away; and there\'s even something called the "Casa Club" that meets on Wednesday evenings.  When I was there, some older people were having fun at the Casa Club dancing the cha cha.

287359985.name: Monumental Statue on Busy Intersection
287359985.author: a TripAdvisor user
287359985.reviewBody: The statue is impressive, but the traffic detracts from being fully able to appreciate it. It\'s on the way to may of the city\'s sights, so it\'s worth stopping to see in passing.

237923908.name: Great bars
237923908.author: a TripAdvisor user
237923908.reviewBody: This plaza at the beginning of the Aqueduct has a set of bars and restaurants with outdoor seating and artisanal beers.

196137496.name: Very close to the Tarascan Fountain and the Aqueduct
196137496.author: a TripAdvisor user
196137496.reviewBody: By walking to the end of Madero (the main drag that goes through central Morelia) you come to this very lovely fountain that is inside a small park. I thought it nicer than the Tarascan Fountain despite the historical importance of the Tarascan one. The famous Aqueduct that brought water to the city for decades also ends here and you can take the short walk through the Romantic Alleyway (Callejon) and the walk to the square with the Morelos statue and the Guadeloupe Church. This area is a center of the city only topped by the Cathedral area.

675389982.name: Fresh respite in dry season
675389982.author: a TripAdvisor user
675389982.reviewBody: Loved seeing locals riding bikes and walking in this pristine city forest, though it was dry season, the trees sang with fresh greenness!

560937019.name: Great place of open green space in the city
560937019.author: a TripAdvisor user
560937019.reviewBody: I made my way there on purpose for a jog in the morning and was pleased to find it a great park and open space.  Bosque means forest in Spanish and that\'s what it\'s like in the middle of Morelia.

558996260.name: Lovely Urban Park Popular with Locals
558996260.author: a TripAdvisor user
558996260.reviewBody: We enjoyed the park, as did many locals.   People were sitting on the benches enjoying life, walking their dogs, jogging, kicking the soccer ball.   We focused on finding and photographing some birds.   We did see and hear many birds in the trees.   There are some workout stations, at least one playground area, a natural history museum...to name but a few feature of Bosque Cuauhtemoc.   We understand that the museum of modern art is located near the park, so one could combine the two.    The walk from the central square to the Bosque is not too long.

539191411.name: A nice wooded area with amenities.
539191411.author: a TripAdvisor user
539191411.reviewBody: The bosque is a large wooded park that is surrounded by a jogging path and has a BMX bike track, a skate park, a museum of natural history, food vendors, a duck pond, and a few other things.  A block west of the duck pond is Frutastika, a great spot for smoothies, sandwiches, or waffles.  A good place to toss a Frisbee or just sit in the shade and relax.

640766801.name: Small and lovely
640766801.author: a TripAdvisor user
640766801.reviewBody: The park is an easy 10  minute taxi hop from the historic centre of Morelia and along with well-kept orchid house is the location of the planetarium and many lovely birds. An interesting city park, well patrolled and right by the conference centre.

584822050.name: Nice but small
584822050.author: a TripAdvisor user
584822050.reviewBody: It\u2019s beautiful! Many kinds of orchids! It\u2019s nice for contemplate, but it is very small, although it is worthy for passing by!

480013659.name: Wished it was larger ...
480013659.author: a TripAdvisor user
480013659.reviewBody: This had been high on my must-see list, yet didn\'t realize it was only 1 of the 3 buildings. For 55-cents USD it was okay, yet many of the orchids seemed similar to the specimens found in US supermarkets. There were about 4 or 5 interesting ones ... the good news is that it\'s close by to one of the best restaurants in the city (San Miguelito), so it\'s a good add-on to a

475689061.name: Beautiful flowers
475689061.author: a TripAdvisor user
475689061.reviewBody: It is small but if you are around it is worth it. It is at a small park and near the planetarium. We were told that in May there is a Orchid Expo.

529201524.name: Fun for all ages
529201524.author: a TripAdvisor user
529201524.reviewBody: Going to a soccer game in Morelia is one of those things you just have to experience, even if you aren\'t a fan of the game.  Sit close to the home team cheering section near section A5

address.streetAddress: Periferico Paseo de La Republica No. 514 Col. Bosques Camelinas

465024513.name: Experience real sports passion
465024513.author: a TripAdvisor user
465024513.reviewBody: Went here to "experience" a soccer game.  I was mesmerized by the whole scene.  I just drank in the passion of the crowd and participated in the singing.  I had to buy one of those obnoxious noise makers just to remember the whole experience.  It was affordable and the Monarcas won.

address.streetAddress: Periferico Paseo de La Republica No. 514 Col. Bosques Camelinas

460515573.name: Nice stadium, best soccer field in Mexico, cheap compared to other stadiums in Mexico
460515573.author: a TripAdvisor user
460515573.reviewBody:
The stadium is located 20 - 30 minutes away from Downtown Morelia "La Catedral".

Be sure to arrive at least 30 minutes before the actual game or 1 hour in case you decide to drive there.

Parking across the street at the Bus Station is a great option if you want to avoid all the traffic after the game.

Prices vary, according to who's visiting but overall is much cheaper than Estadio Azteca, Omnilife etc...

Beer costs $60.00 pesos, snacks cost $20.00 pesos...(there's also food and beer pre game outside of the stadium)

If possible, buy "Plateas" which is higher up but you get a better overall view of the field, "Preferente" is also a good option and cheaper but it's lower down and NOT numbered.

Be sure to visit "Estadio Morelos" next time you're in Morelia.

address.streetAddress: Periferico Paseo de La Republica No. 514 Col. Bosques Camelinas

378775352.name: The local soccer club
378775352.author: a TripAdvisor user
378775352.reviewBody: Well, i dont really like soccer, but if you would like to see a soccer match, be prepared for everything: people around drinking, yelling, laughing, whistling, eating and throwing garbage to the field. The matches in Mexico are pretty much arranged so betting is not a good way to earn good money in there.\nThe club is pretty popular within its fans, but the players are not that good and the team is mostly composed by foreigners. There\'s no such thing like "auditions" to let see if a local is good or not for the team.\nAfter the games, the police normally has to be on guard because drunk and nondrunk fans tend to fight or destroy things, independently if Morelia\'s team won or lost. Also, all the public transportation is pretty full until all the stadium is empty (1 hour or more)

address.streetAddress: Periferico Paseo de La Republica No. 514 Col. Bosques Camelinas

348466070.name: Functional stadium
348466070.author: a TripAdvisor user
348466070.reviewBody: This is not the huge stadium experience as Estadio Morelos is a around 25,000 capacity, I went to Morelia vs Chivas match so the stadium was totally full, the stadium is in good shape, you feel conformable everywhere and is plenty of things to eat and drink.

address.streetAddress: Periferico Paseo de La Republica No. 514 Col. Bosques Camelinas

675390148.name: Impressive Antiquity
675390148.author: a TripAdvisor user
675390148.reviewBody: If in Morelia, you cannot miss this step back into time.  It is both historical and impressive in its scope.  I just sat on the side, and breathed in \u201cage\u201d

642096668.name: Must see!
642096668.author: a TripAdvisor user
642096668.reviewBody: This is part of a huge aqueduct system thatwas built in the mid 1700s to supply water to the city of Morelia. So large that traffic goes underneath them.

650008938.name: Charming Museum with Great Historical Information
650008938.author: a TripAdvisor user
650008938.reviewBody: I visited this museum while staying in Morelia and was very impressed with the murals and the vast amounts of historical information. The building and courtyards are impressive as well. Although the museum isn\u2019t huge, the information presented will keep you busy ready for a while. This would be a great way to spend part of your afternoon in Morelia.

561736271.name: Go for the history
561736271.author: a TripAdvisor user
561736271.reviewBody: The last Morelia museum on our list was the Regional Museum. Like most other cultural destinations in the city, it was housed in grand baroque building worthy of a look itself. The collection was a bit of a hodge-podge, with one section devoted to natural history and ecology and other galleries focused on the history of this part of Mexico through the Lazaro Cardenas era. Those exhibits went into considerably more detail than we\u2019d observed in other museums and included the originals of some significant documents related to Mexican independence.

553204391.name: Great, no longer free!
553204391.author: a TripAdvisor user
553204391.reviewBody: This is a charming small museum in a beautiful building. There is no English spoken by attendants, used on signs or in available brochures so good to read a bit on line before visiting. None the less, I went with no preparation yesterday and enjoyed it a lot. Wonderful pottery and old \u201cpicture maps\u201d of activities and events. The museum is very easy to access just half a block from the Plaza.

500342411.name: Interesting and Free
500342411.author: a TripAdvisor user
500342411.reviewBody: Located in Centro Morelia, the museum has an excellent shop where you can purchase local art from the villages in the state.

442006730.name: Very interesting museum.
442006730.author: a TripAdvisor user
442006730.reviewBody: This museum is housed in a centuries old building.  Interesting artifacts of pre-hispanic Mexico of Tarrascan Indians, the Mexican Revolution that overthrew the Spanish imposed government and made Mexico independent.  Lots of history here!

390041186.name: A nice collection
390041186.author: a TripAdvisor user
390041186.reviewBody: A bit of everything, prehistoric, natural, local life, history, etc. Signposted in Spanish only, but you can guess what\'s what about. Local art in one of the rooms as well.

358580546.name: Excellent centric museum in Morelia.
358580546.author: a TripAdvisor user
358580546.reviewBody: i have just visited this Museum and I must say that I found it very informative,  from  the prehisp\u00e1nic era until the Independence Movement. On the first floor , there were a lot of nice precolombin pottery, jewerly, weapons , and "c\u00f3dices" of the native "tarasca" culture.  Second floor was mostly with paintings, religious and of the Mexican Independence Heros. One of them, a large mural, with an informative video explaining  each of the different scenes  of the " Proccession" of the Carmelita\'s Nuns to their new convent. Also, a nice morelian painter (F\u00e9lix Parra) was on display these days.  Opens daily except on Mondays. It is free on Festive days and the fee is about 3 usd.

346672928.name: Worth the visit
346672928.author: a TripAdvisor user
346672928.reviewBody: The Michoacan Museum was interesting both in its prehistoric exhibits but also 19th-century Mexican history. Located in the center of the colonial city.

330515532.name: Very well done museum.
330515532.author: a TripAdvisor user
330515532.reviewBody: Even though all of the exhibits were in Spanish, I was able to enjoy the displays, which used many maps and symbols to enlighten about the history of this huge and complex state.

325765764.name: Well laid out museum in the center of Morelia!!
325765764.author: a TripAdvisor user
325765764.reviewBody: Well laid out museum in the center of Morelia!! Worth the visit if you are in Morelia just so you can learn about the State of Michoacan and what the city is all about!

273420301.name: Michigan To Michoacan
273420301.author: a TripAdvisor user
273420301.reviewBody: I have been searching for the connection between the 2 states of Michoacan and Michigan. This museum was very helpful and interesting. There was no crime or anything to worry about here. A very pleasant experience.

240271066.name: The best
240271066.author: a TripAdvisor user
240271066.reviewBody: This was, I thought, by far the best (I.e., most thorough and comprehensive) museum in Morelia. That being said, I think Morelia is more about beauty.

237924385.name: One of the best museums in Morelia
237924385.author: a TripAdvisor user
237924385.reviewBody: Most of the museums in Morelia are small and of indifferent quality, but this one stands out for its survey of Michoacan history from pre-conquest to the end of the 19th century.

228198827.name: Amazing history
228198827.author: a TripAdvisor user
228198827.reviewBody: All of the museums we visited in Morelia were well done, and this is no exception.  Brush up on your Spanish, as there is little English translation.  We learned a lot about Mexico\'s history from this visit.

196327154.name: One of several museums in Morelia
196327154.author: a TripAdvisor user
196327154.reviewBody: There are lots of museums in Morelia. We were recently there for a full week so we saw quite a few of them. This one focuses this part of Mexico (the city of Morelia and the state of Michoacan) and has a mainly historical focus. It\'s also in another of the many nice old buildings that you constantly run across in Morelia and that is part of the allure of this museum. We did happen to go on a Sunday when the museum is free. Your ability to read Spanish will determine how long you are there. But even if your Spanish is not very good (or if nonexistent) go anyway for the things the museum has to see.

184859044.name: Ancient artifacts from around Michoacan!
184859044.author: a TripAdvisor user
184859044.reviewBody: As a jeweler, I was impressed with the amount of ancient jewelry in the display cases. Much of the jewelry was intact, but there were several display cases with nothing but beads.  Really fascinating!

149210580.name: Not good for English speakers
149210580.author: a TripAdvisor user
149210580.reviewBody: I don\'t speak a lot of Spanish and the museum had nearly nothing in English or any language other than Spanish. I walked in, had a quick stroll around and came out none the wiser.

132248402.name: Learn all about the Indian tribes here!!
132248402.author: a TripAdvisor user
132248402.reviewBody: Go on Sunday, its free.  But go anyday, as it is not expensive and very rewarding as it is in a restored typical mansion and covers the every day life of the Indian tribes centuries ago.. you will be surprised, as the everyday clothing of present day residents, has not changed throughout the centuries.

130808266.name: Learn about History and Craft Development
130808266.author: a TripAdvisor user
130808266.reviewBody: Even for those not enthralled with museums, this one should be on your list, certainly above the city museum.  You can visit it in a half hour or so.  The staff is very helpful in answering questions and offering information. You\'ll learn about the pre-Hispanic cultures, the colonial period, and contemporary Michoac\u00e1n.

126426783.name: Interesting to learn about Vasco de Quiroga & Morelos
126426783.author: a TripAdvisor user
126426783.reviewBody: But the most intriguing is the mural by Alfredo Zalce painting friends & enemies of the national cohesion. Friends like Hidalgo and enemies like the Coca-Cola bottle!!!

675389815.name: Architectural masterpiece
675389815.author: a TripAdvisor user
675389815.reviewBody: For those who relish in times architectural memoirs, this palace is a MUST!  Beautiful, solid, telling

651906945.name: Glad we accidentally stumbled upon this
651906945.author: a TripAdvisor user
651906945.reviewBody: The murals were such a pleasant surprise. We were looking for the nearby Museo Regional Michoacano and saw an opening into s courtyard with a police presence. With no entry fee, we proceeded to enjoy viewing a beautiful mural over the staircase.      An added bonus was a temporary black and white photography exhibit of women at the time of the Mexican Revolution.

450292233.name: Exhibit of photos of Mexican Revolution circa 1910-1915 is astounding
450292233.author: a TripAdvisor user
450292233.reviewBody: Temporary exhibit, ends 17 Feb., on second floor.  Not advertised around town. Go if interested in black and white photography and/ or Mexican history ...

382546918.name: Well-worth visiting
382546918.author: a TripAdvisor user
382546918.reviewBody:
Oh so many beautiful buildings to visit in Morelia’s historical center!  

The stunning Cardenas mural on the grand stairway is reminiscent of the Orozco in Guadaljara’s Palace.

Also, we really enjoyed the current display of photos of urban Mexico of the early Twentieth Century.  Staff were knowledgeable and helpful.

196238221.name: Another lovely old governmental building
196238221.author: a TripAdvisor user
196238221.reviewBody: There are so many grand buildings in the centro historico of Morelia. This one is just off the large plaza next to the cathedral. It was originally the city hall but must have been converted into some kind of Justice building later on. Today might might strike you as closed since there is a gate at the entrance but you can just go around it with permission from a sort of guard. Just give him an, "Es possible mirar" if you don\'t speak Spanish and he will let you in. There is a grand mural on the backside of the stairway and a few rooms have been made into a museum of justice issues. All together it won\'t take you but ten minutes of so but the building is very nice and seeing those Mexican murals is always fun.

163583189.name: mural in staircase
163583189.author: a TripAdvisor user
163583189.reviewBody: from a student of Diego Rivera - 2 stories!! stupendous in scale and bold colors. It is breathtaking as an image of the revolutionary zeal.

157295907.name: If you love architecture
157295907.author: a TripAdvisor user
157295907.reviewBody: Morelia is full of wonderful buildings. The Palace of Justice is another fine example of fine architecture.

142782593.name: Palacio de Justicia
142782593.author: a TripAdvisor user
142782593.reviewBody: Interesting architectural and historical building in the centre of the old quarter.  Inside are paintings of Jose Maria Morelos depicting his struggles during the war of Independence.

128355080.name: Very nice new court buliding.
128355080.author: a TripAdvisor user
128355080.reviewBody: I recommend swing by and taking a picture of it. It is brand new and very nice for Mexican standerds.

675395830.name: Impressive Powerful Architcture
675395830.author: a TripAdvisor user
675395830.reviewBody: I\u2019m a wanderer.  And this palace made me STOP! It\u2019s architecture is astounding, yet technically, antique.  A noteworthy perusal

638598233.name: Make sure you go here
638598233.author: a TripAdvisor user
638598233.reviewBody: The murals at the government palace are amazing.  Shows the history of the country.  It is worth a visit just to see the murals.

564952452.name: Famous Seat of Independence
564952452.author: a TripAdvisor user
564952452.reviewBody: This traditional building with its murals that trace the history of Mexico is where the leaders of the Independence formed their friendships and planned their campaigns.

511116055.name: Murals
511116055.author: a TripAdvisor user
511116055.reviewBody: Impressive, the only issue was a teacher manifestation on the front side causing all door except the back door to be open.

364981497.name: Wonderful murals; colonial architecture
364981497.author: a TripAdvisor user
364981497.reviewBody:
Our tour group was on a walking tour of the Centro Historico, and all of us were eager to see the murals.  We arrived at the Government Palace and were told that the building was being fumigated.  They didn't allow anyone, obviously, to enter.
A few days later I went back on my own.  I was glad I had the opportunity -- the murals are certainly worth a visit.  Each panel has a little historical description, letting the viewer know the date, the events and the main characters that are depicted.
The murals are so stunning it would be easy to miss all the details of colonial architecture, but if you have time, pay attention to the carved doors, the wrought iron window coverings, the arches ...
And here's a bonus:  on my way out, I happened across an office of the Michoacan Tourism Department, on the ground floor.  They had all kinds of brochures and posters to give away, and when I was there, even some memorabilia from the Pope's visit.
Outside the Government Palace there are spaces marked out on the street, not for parking cars, but for people to stand.  I saw dozens of men, blocked in by barricades, waiting.  I asked a nearby bookseller what the men were waiting for.  She just answered, "It's the Government Palace.  They probably have some petitions to present."  I didn't understand why they couldn't wait inside the building's very spacious courtyard?  It would be interesting to see if this happens every weekday, throughout the year.

347659405.name: Palace to visit for free
347659405.author: a TripAdvisor user
347659405.reviewBody: This is the municipal building which we can visit for free.\nInner of the building we can find the guide of the Michoacan which offer us the must-visit in the states.\nAnd on the 2nd floor, we can find the wall paintings that show the history of independence of Mexico like other municipal buildings in Mexico.

326969164.name: Lovely historic murals
326969164.author: a TripAdvisor user
326969164.reviewBody: Was fortunate to visit at night as part of a banquet. We were provided with a guide who explained to history depicted in the murals on that line the second floor gallery. Morelia is a beautiful city with many historic structures. This is a wonderful example.

325765469.name: Wonderful architecture and historical site in the Centro of Morelia!
325765469.author: a TripAdvisor user
325765469.reviewBody: Wonderful architecture and historical site in the Centro of Morelia!\n\nGood to admire and walk around ... so much history!

264744021.name: wonderful murals
264744021.author: a TripAdvisor user
264744021.reviewBody: This is right on Maduro.  Don\'t be put off by the guards at the entrance. You sign the book and put in tourist.  The murals by Valce are magnificent and well worth seeing.

259281656.name: wonderful history
259281656.author: a TripAdvisor user
259281656.reviewBody: if you can take a short guided tour to explain the murals they describe the history of the area quite well and it was interesting and informative.

245288194.name: Journey into the Past
245288194.author: a TripAdvisor user
245288194.reviewBody: Visit it at night. It\'s awesome. You can see the murals and from the second floor the cathedral. It is like going back into time.  Building looks to be very well maintained and the fact that people have their offices in it is almost romantic.

240775753.name: Mexico\'s history on the walls
240775753.author: a TripAdvisor user
240775753.reviewBody: Literally, this place has Mexico\'s history painted on the walls. From the independence to around 1968 you may find all relevant characters and actions in beautiful paintings on the staircases.

240269799.name: Lovely building
240269799.author: a TripAdvisor user
240269799.reviewBody: This building, located on the main square, is lovely. Inside, not atypically of Mexican governmental buildings, are impressive historical murals. These however do not reflect post-revolutionary fervor as they were not installed until the 1960\'s.

237925738.name: Attractive courtyard and murals
237925738.author: a TripAdvisor user
237925738.reviewBody: A visit doesn\'t take long and the building, courtyard, second floor balcony, and murals are well worth it.

233684092.name: Lovely building
233684092.author: a TripAdvisor user
233684092.reviewBody: This building, located on the main square, is lovely. Inside, not atypically of Mexican governmental buildings, are impressive historical murals. These however do not reflect post-revolutionary fervor as they were not installed until the 1960\'s.

196136874.name: Stop and have a look inside this grand old building
196136874.author: a TripAdvisor user
196136874.reviewBody: The Palacio de Gobierno is sort of kitty-corner from the grand Morelia cathedral and, of course, right on Avenida Madero. It is a very nice looking building as are many in this wonderful city but make sure you take a good look inside. Walk around the interior courtyard and take the stairs up to the upper floor. You will find some great murals done by local artist Zalce regarding both the history and society of this part of Mexico. This building is very worth a stop and you need not spend more than 15 minutes inside.

193150695.name: lovely buiding design
193150695.author: a TripAdvisor user
193150695.reviewBody: This building is worthwhile stop for those interested in architecture.   We were impressed by the details on the fa\u00e7ade facing the cathedral.\n

180859090.name: Murals
180859090.author: a TripAdvisor user
180859090.reviewBody: We were welcomed to walk around and explore.  I was amazed by the murals---many photos.  A must see in Morelia!

165751659.name: Murals are a must to see!
165751659.author: a TripAdvisor user
165751659.reviewBody: The architecture,the stair case and the murals are worth visiting! Just by "reading" the murals you will learn from Morelia\'s Maestro Zalce\' rendition of the historical events of Mexican independence and Michoacan\'s history. Zalce is one of the most important contemporary muralist, he  recently died. If you  like mural  art this is the place to learn about art and history.

157297135.name: A jewel in central Morelia
157297135.author: a TripAdvisor user
157297135.reviewBody: We went there around 8.00PM on a Monday. The friendly staff at the gate invited us to enter the building. There are no fees. It is of very beautiful colonial architecture, like many buildings in Morelia, with stairs, ironworks , columns and large murals. At that time of day, the illuminated courtyard sparks like  a true jewel.

150884152.name: Murals worth a look
150884152.author: a TripAdvisor user
150884152.reviewBody: The murals painted in 1961 depict the history of Mexio since the Spanish invaded in the 1500\'s. Great to wander round. Lovely old colonial building.

660930162.name: Presa
660930162.author: a TripAdvisor user
660930162.reviewBody: A media hora de la ciudad, lugar campirano, muy hermoso, con caba\u00f1as, mucho campo para pasear, relax, descansar, hay restaurante local de lugare\u00f1os econ\u00f3micos, presa grande y hermosa con bonitos sitios para visitar a su alrededor a lis amantes de la naturaleza.

618884677.name: Bell\u00edsimo
618884677.author: a TripAdvisor user
618884677.reviewBody: a 40 minutos de la ciudad en auto, muy buen paseo si quieres salir al campo. no hay mucho que hacer, pero al lado de la presa hay un restaurante con buen sabor y buena vista.

608637819.name: TRANQUILIDAD PURA
608637819.author: a TripAdvisor user
608637819.reviewBody: IDEAL PARA TUS DIAS DE CAMPO, NO APTO PARA ACAMPAR, poca infraestructura pero si en camino te encuentras uno de los restaurantes de la zona aprov\u00e9chalo y disfrutalo.

604479434.name: Muy agradable lugar rodeado de Bosques de Pino
604479434.author: a TripAdvisor user
604479434.reviewBody: Excelente lugar para pasar un d\u00eda o un fin de semana\nComida muy econ\u00f3mica y la trucha el platillo estrella\nActividades de ciclismo de monta\u00f1a, Kayak, correr!

361508172.name: nothing to do there
361508172.author: a TripAdvisor user
361508172.reviewBody: It used to be a place where good concerts happen, but it is not worth it now. don\'t waste time here.

664358370.name: Elegant 18th Century Palace, Now a Wonderful Museum
664358370.author: a TripAdvisor user
664358370.reviewBody: Temporary exhibits of Mexican fine art and arte popular, always well curated and so worth seeing.  Opening on April 11: photography by Florence Leyret Jeune, a chronicler of Michoac\u00e1n indigenous life.  Don\'t miss it.

675390309.name: Historic zmodernism
675390309.author: a TripAdvisor user
675390309.reviewBody: It\u2019s funnt that an old building houses modern art, but what a beautiful juxtaposition it is!  One hour of magic!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Contemporaneo Alfredo Zalce (mAcAZ)

549767234.name: Great Modern Art and Artist
549767234.author: a TripAdvisor user
549767234.reviewBody:
This is an excellent museum, nestled into a lovely area of Morelia, full of parks and other cultural attractions.  As you approach the building on Av Acueducto, you can't miss the enormous, ancient, stone aqueduct out front, running for miles down the middle of the street.  The museum is housed in an architecturally fascinating Victorian mansion.  The interior was renovated into a first class modern art exhibit space, but still retains some beautiful vintage details.

The museum is named after an amazing, underrated giant of Mexican art, Alfredo Zalce, who lived and worked in Morelia for many years.  His work is always on display in one of the galleries, while the rest of the museum has constantly changing shows of very high quality art from Mexico and around the world.  When I was there, just after the Day of the Dead, his gallery had several original prints, all related to that theme.  This place provides a rare opportunity to always see a selection of his original work, including a few large sculptures in the yard outside.

Alfredo Zalce created an enormous body of diverse artwork over a long life.  He lived until his mid 90s, and passed away in 2003.  Over a very long career, he worked in a wide variety of medium:  paintings, sculpture, ceramics, drawings, photography and more, but most of all, printmaking.  He was a key member of the Taller de Gráfica Popular, a vibrant and prolific center for printmaking in Mexico City, that thrived in the 1930s and 40s.  So this museum has an enormous wealth of his artwork to select from for carefully curated exhibits.  He also was an acclaimed muralist who painted famous murals in government buildings in Morelia, and other locations around Mexico.

If you love art and are in Morelia, don't miss this great museum, dedicated to one of the great artists in the pantheon of Mexican art.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Contemporaneo Alfredo Zalce (mAcAZ)

516868624.name: Little gem in Morelia
516868624.author: a TripAdvisor user
516868624.reviewBody: Located in a magnificent private property, we viewed a temporary expo of bronze sculpture as well as the permanent expo. Free entry

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Contemporaneo Alfredo Zalce (mAcAZ)

480016998.name: Small, But Mighty ...
480016998.author: a TripAdvisor user
480016998.reviewBody: This small art museum was a great surprise\u2014the main show was excellent and filled 4 rooms on the lower floor, while upstairs was a solid group show. I recommend this museum for any art-lover as it was a good look at current Latin American art trends.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Contemporaneo Alfredo Zalce (mAcAZ)

474848515.name: Small but Nice
474848515.author: a TripAdvisor user
474848515.reviewBody: Most of the art works were by the same artist and I really am not a very good evaluator of art.  Art is personal with everyone and I did not find his art to my taste.  I did enjoy the photos they had on display, in the back quarters, of zoo animals taken by different young photographers at the Morelia Zoo.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Contemporaneo Alfredo Zalce (mAcAZ)

393669083.name: Just one exposition. But cool
